-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: If you are looking for some beautiful words to light up your morning, you should check out these sunrise quotes.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
Sunrise Quotes: 40 Words to Light Up Your Morning

Sunrise Quotes: 40 Words to Light Up Your Morning

There's something special about the way the sky turns from dark to light, and sunrise quotes have a magical way of capturing this beauty. As the sun rises, it brings warmth and light. It's inspiring writers, poets, and dreamers throughout history to put their feelings into words. That's why sunrise quotes remind us of the joy of witnessing the world wake up every morning.

In this article, you can find some great sunrise quotes for Instagram and funny sunrise quotes. Let's take a look!

Short Sunrise Quotes for Instagram

  • "The darkness is at its deepest just before the sunrise." – Voltaire

  • "Sunrise is the reminder that we can start new beginning from anywhere." ― Rupal Asodaria

  • "At sunrise everything is luminous but not clear." ― Norman Maclean

  • "What I know for sure is that every sunrise is like a new page, a chance to right ourselves and receive each day in all its glory. Each day is a wonder." – Oprah Winfrey

  • "Every sunrise begins with new eyes." ― Richie Norton

  • "A sunrise is God's way of saying, 'Let's start again.'" ― Todd Stocker

  • "Today, the sun will rise on all your doubts." ― Marty Rubin

  • "Each day is born with a sunrise." ― Suzy Kassem

  • "Dance when the sun comes up." ― A.D. Posey

  • "I live in the shade created by the sunrise I am waiting for" ― Isbelle Razors

  • "Nature unfolds her treasure at the first ray of sunrise." ― Kishore Bansal

  • "Just like the days, no two sunrises are ever the same." ― Jonathan P Lamas

  • "Every sunrise is an invitation to brighten someone's day." – Jhiess Krieg

  • "We can only appreciate the miracle of a sunrise if we have waited in the darkness." — Sapna Reddy

  • "When the sun came up… I couldn't tell where heaven stopped and the Earth began." — Tom Hanks
  • "Don't you feel you get value for your day if you've actually watched the sun rise?" ― AJ Vosse

  • "Every day a million miracles begin at sunrise." — Eric Jerome

  • "Oh, sunlight! The most precious gold to be found on Earth." ― Roman Payne

  • "Saying good morning to the sun is my favorite way to start the day." – Tahnni Dupre

  • "Let the beauty of sunrise keep your heart warm." — Lailah Gifty

  • "I'm a very early riser, and I don't like to miss that beautiful early morning light." ― David Hockney

  • "He who kisses joy as it flies by will live in eternity's sunrise." – William Blake

  • "It's a new day. Yesterday's failure is redeemed at the sunrise" ― Todd Stocker

  • "Listen to the wind blow, watch the sun rise." ― Fleetwood Mac

  • "Every morning is a revolution against the darkness." ― Mehmet Murat Ildan

  • "The hate of the dark nights will not defeat the love of this sunrise." ― F.M. Sogamiah
  • "Whoever loves the sun always has a reason to wake up." ― Marty Rubin

  • "After God perfected the sunrise, he created photographers, artists, and poets to ensure his feat remained immortal." – Terri Guillemets

  • "Seduce me at sunrise, dance with me barefoot in the dew on the grass." ― Bodhi Smith

  • "I love that this morning's sunrise does not define itself by last night's sunset." ― Steve Maraboli

Funny Sunrise Quotes

  • "Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes as such an inconvenient time of day."

  • "The sun rises before I do, but I break even by retiring after it does." – Jules Rena

  • "Sunrise is starting to feel like a guilt trip." ― Kris Kidd

  • "I love to watch cities wake up, and Paris wakes up more abruptly, more startlingly, than any place I know." ― Bill Bryson

  • "Not all the creatures will be excited by the sunrise." ― Kamaran Ihsan Salih

  • "I like my coffee black and my mornings bright." – Terri Guillemets

  • "For a girl with such a dark mind, you're a little too in love with the sunrise." ― Sherry Namdeo
  • "Dawn and its excesses always reminded me of heaven, a place where I have always known I would not be comfortable." ― Marilynne Robinson

  • "God is now serving scoops of orange and raspberry sherbet on the horizon. What a beautiful sunrise!" Terri Guillemets

  • "I hadn't been paying attention to things like the sunrise, but that old sun had been coming up anyway. It didn't really care how I felt, it was going to rise and set regardless of whether I noticed it, and if I was going to enjoy it, that was up to me." ― Jeanette Walls

Author:

Larasati Natasha (Intern Writer)

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: The appearance of acne in the ear can be annoying. Here are ways to prevent and treat this problem.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
Effective Ways to Prevent and Treat Acne in the Ear

Having acne in the ears can be quite bothersome. Here are some ways to prevent and treat this problem.

Effective Ways to Prevent and Treat Ear Acne

Acne can appear on various parts of the body, including the ears.

Although this problem can be experienced by anyone, the most age range to experience acne is between 12 and 24 years old.

According to Medical News Today, the outer part of the ear and the ear canal have skin and hair cells as well as oil-producing glands.

Acne in the ears occurs when the pores in the ear area become clogged with dirt, dust, dead skin, or oil.

When these pores become blocked, acne can appear as a result of this condition.

In addition to external factors such as dirt, internal factors can also affect the appearance of acne in the ears.

High levels of stress or hormonal imbalances are factors in the body that can trigger acne to appear in the ear area.

How to Treat Ear Acne

Acne in the ear area often triggers the desire to squeeze it.

However, this action can actually worsen the condition.

Squeezing acne can cause bacteria and pus to spread to the surrounding area, causing irritation and even scars.

According to Prevention, to treat uncomfortable ear pimples, it is recommended to use a warm compress.

This can help naturally draw out bacteria and pus.

As an alternative, warm compress can be an effective way to reduce the discomfort caused by acne in the ear.

This process helps to naturally release bacteria and pus without the risk of irritation.

Cleaning the area with clean hands or using tea tree oil can also help gradually reduce inflammation.

Preventing Ear Acne

Prevention is the best step to avoid acne around the ears.

Keeping the area around the ears clean to avoid bacteria is very important.

Dr. Susan Bard, a dermatology expert, explains that acne in the ear area can be very painful because the skin there is tighter and there is cartilage.

Preventing irritation and pain caused by acne in the ear can be done by not touching the acne with fingers, cotton buds, or even earphones.

In addition, regularly cleaning the ear area is also important.

Also, make sure not to use perfume or other harsh products that can affect the condition of the skin.

Keep the skin moisturized and avoid rubbing the area.

These things can help prevent acne from appearing in the ear area.

Trivia Questions for Teens: Fun Facts to Challenge and Entertain

Trivia games are a fun way for teens to learn new facts and test their knowledge. This article has many interesting trivia questions on different topics that teens will enjoy. The questions cover subjects like science, history, pop culture, animals, sports, and more. There are easy questions and harder ones to challenge teens of all ages. Let’s explore some fun trivia facts!

Science Trivia Questions

Science trivia tests knowledge of the natural world, space, and scientific discoveries. Here are some science questions to get teens thinking:

• What is the largest planet in our solar system?

Answer: Jupiter

• What is the chemical formula for water?

Answer: H2O

• Which planet is known as the Red Planet?

Answer: Mars

• What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?

Answer: Diamond

• What galaxy is Earth located in?

Answer: The Milky Way

• How many hearts does an octopus have?

Answer: Three

• What is the boiling point of water at sea level in Celsius?

Answer: 100 degrees Celsius

• Which metal is liquid at room temperature?

Answer: Mercury

• What element does the chemical symbol O represent?

Answer: Oxygen

• What is the most abundant element in the universe?

Answer: Hydrogen

These science trivia questions cover topics like planets, elements, and animal biology. They test knowledge of basic scientific facts that many teens learn in school. Answering these questions helps reinforce science concepts in a fun way.

Pop Culture Trivia Questions

Pop culture trivia focuses on current movies, TV shows, music, celebrities and trends. Here are some pop culture questions teens may enjoy:

• What year was the first Jurassic Park movie released?

Answer: 1993

• Who is the singer behind the hit song “Bad Romance”?

Answer: Lady Gaga

• In The Hunger Games, who is the main character played by Jennifer Lawrence?

Answer: Katniss Everdeen

• Which animated movie features a character named Lightning McQueen?

Answer: Cars

• What is the name of Harry Potter’s pet owl?

Answer: Hedwig

• What video game was credited with popularizing the battle royale genre?

Answer: Fortnite

• What movie won the Academy Award for Best Picture in 2020?

Answer: Parasite

• Which artist released the album titled “Folklore” in 2020?

Answer: Taylor Swift

• Who stars as Eleven in the Netflix series Stranger Things?

Answer: Millie Bobby Brown

• What is the real name of the superhero character Spider-Man?

Answer: Peter Parker

Pop culture trivia tests teens’ knowledge of current entertainment and media. The questions cover popular movies, music, TV shows, and celebrities that many teens follow. This type of trivia lets teens show off their awareness of trends and pop culture phenomena.

History trivia covers important moments and figures from the past. The questions test knowledge of key dates, events, and people that shaped history. This type of trivia helps teens connect historical facts they’ve learned to real-world knowledge.

Animal trivia questions cover interesting facts about different species. They test knowledge of animal characteristics, habitats, and behaviors. This type of trivia can spark curiosity about the animal kingdom and nature.

Sports trivia tests knowledge of different sports, athletes, and sporting events. Here are some sports trivia questions for teens:

Food and Drink Trivia Questions

Art and Literature Trivia Questions

Conclusion

Trivia questions are a fun way for teens to test their knowledge and learn new facts. This article covered many different types of trivia, including science, pop culture, history, animals, sports, movies, music, and more. Playing trivia games can help teens remember information they’ve learned in school and expand their general knowledge. It’s also a fun activity to do with friends or family. -- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.title: 5 Best Places To Visit In Jerusalem
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: This is a guide to some of the best places to visit in Jerusalem.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_keywords: Best Places To Visit In Jerusalem,Jerusalem,Travel
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
5 Best Places To Visit In Jerusalem

Jerusalem is one of the holiest cities on earth. It's been a popular destination for religious journeys among pilgrims since a long time ago. (Photo by Pontus Wellgraf on Unsplash)

5 Best Places To Visit In Jerusalem

Today, Jerusalem is famous among tourists because of its beautiful city and well-preserved old town. Walking through the narrow roads of its old town will take you back in time to its long and glorious past. It's heaven for any history and culture fans all around the world. In this article, we will go on an exciting journey to some of the best places to visit in Jerusalem, according to various sources, Tuesday (8/8/2023). So put on your hat and grab your backpack as we start our adventure to this beautiful and holy city!

1. The Israel Museum

The Israel Museum in Jerusalem is the best place to start your journey in this beautiful city. There's no better place to learn the long history of Jerusalem and Israel in one place than The Israel Museum. (Photo by Israel_photo_gallery on Flickr/CC BY-ND 2.0)

The museum was founded in 1965. It has nearly 500,000 objects in its collection from various eras, from the prehistoric period to modern times. Its collection also covers a wide range of variations, from artifacts to artworks.

One of the highlights of the museum is the Shrine of the Book. It's part of the museum that houses items related to the history of religion. One of the most famous artifacts in the Shrine of the Book is the Dead Sea Scroll. It's a collection of ancient manuscripts that includes some of the earliest known copies of the Hebrew Bible.

The Church of the Holy Sepulchre is one of the most important landmarks in Jerusalem. It's considered the holiest site for Christians in the world. (Photo by Cristina Gottardi on Unsplash)

2. Church of the Holy Sepulchre

The Church of the Holy Sepulchre is located in the northwest quarter of the Old City of Jerusalem. It was built on the site where Jesus was crucified and buried.

At the entrance of the church, you will find the Stone of Anointing. According to the Tourist Israel website, it's believed as the place where Jesus's body was prepared for burial. Visitors can climb a stairway to the Calvary or Golgotha. It's the place where Jesus was crucified.

Another main attraction of the church is the Aedicule Chapel. The chapel has two rooms. One room is where they keep the Angel's Stone. People believed it is the fragment of the stone that sealed Jesus's tomb. The other room of the chapel is the tomb of Jesus. (Photo by David Rodrigo on Unsplash)

3. Haram Al-Sharif (Temple Mount)

Temple Mount, or Haram Al-Sharif, is a special place in Jerusalem that lots of people from different religions think is really important. Muslims, Jews, and Christians have all thought this place is special for a very long time. (Photo by Jorge Fernández Salas on Unsplash)

Temple Mount was built on a site where people believed where Abraham offered his son as a sacrifice to God. It's also believed as the site where Solomon built the First Temple to house the Ark of the Covenant.

The Temple Mount is a complex of historical sites consisting of a big plaza and two other historical landmarks. On the southern side of the plaza, you can find Al-Aqsa Mosque, which is one of the oldest mosques in the world. In the center of the plaza lies the most iconic landmark of Jerusalem, the beautiful Dome of the Rock, a beautiful building with a big shiny gold dome.

Via Dolorosa is another must-visit place in Jerusalem, especially for Christians. Via Dolorosa, or Way of Sorrow, is a route Jesus took while carrying his cross to Golgotha or Calvary. (Photo by Seetheholyland.net on Flickr/CC BY-SA 2.0)

4. Via Dolorosa

According to PlanetWare, the current route stretches for 600 meters that begins on Via Dolorosa Street. You can easily follow the route since it's marked by the fourteen Stations of the Cross. (Photo by StateofIsrael on Flickr/CC BY-SA 2.0)

5. Mount of Olives

Mount of Olives is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Jerusalem, even among non-religious people. Mount of Olives is home to the oldest cemetery in the world that is still used today. (Photo by Adam Kring on Unsplash)

For Christians, the Mount of Olives is a sacred place. They believe it's the place where Jesus ascended to heaven. It's also the home of the Gardens of Gethsemane, where Jesus was arrested.

There are many historical tombs and beautiful churches to visit on Mount of Olives. One of the main attractions is The Church of the Ascension. This beautiful church is located at the top of the mount. From this church, you can enjoy the beautiful panoramic view of the Old City of Jerusalem.

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.title: 5 Scariest Urban Legends In Australia That Will Haunt Your Dream
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: Here are some spine-tingling  urban legends from Australia that will send shivers down to your body.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_keywords: Urban Legends From Australia,Australian Urban Legends,Urban Legends,Australia
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
5 Scariest Urban Legends In Australia That Will Haunt Your Dream

Do you believe that Australia's scariest stories are limited to its creepy-crawly creatures? Well, it's time to broaden your horizons. Australia also has a dark and haunting side filled with spine-tingling urban legends. These tales have been passed down through generations, sending shivers down the spines of those who dare to listen.

5 Scariest Urban Legends In Australia That Will Haunt Your Dream

In this article, we will uncover some of the scariest urban legends in Australia. From the eerie sightings of a bigfoot-like creature lurking in the shadows to the famous legend of the terrifying Drop Bear, these stories are not for the faint of heart.

Prepare yourself for a spine-tingling journey into the mysteries that have gripped the Australian imagination for generations.

© 2023 trstdly.com

The legend of Drop Bear may be one of the most famous urban legends in Australia. The story said that they are scary, carnivorous versions of the cute koala. They live on the treetop and attack people who are not alert by dropping their bodies into their target.

1. The Drop Bear

Some said that this urban legend is a hoax to scare tourists, but what do you think? Do you believe this story?

The Yowie is another very famous mythical creature in Australian folklore. Legend says that it's a mysterious ape-like creature that lives in the Outback, a very remote area of Australia. Yowie is very tall, around 2-3.5 meters high. It's often described as having dark fur and a long snout.

2. The Yowie

Some people believe that the Yowie is a type of Bigfoot, while others believe that it is a relic from Australia's prehistoric past.

The Bunyip is a mythical creature said to inhabit the swamps and billabongs of Australia. It is often described as a large, hairy creature with a horse-like head, a crocodile's tail, and sharp claws. According to Aboriginal legends, the Bunyip is a dangerous creature that preys on humans and livestock.

3. The Bunyip

4. The Hawkesbury River Monster

The Hawkesbury River Monster is the Australian version of Nessie. According to the legend, there's a giant, mysterious creature that lives in the Hawkesbury River in New South Wales, Australia.

There have been many reports about these monster sightings over the years. One of the most popular sightings happened in the 1980's. A group of fisherman claimed that a mysterious giant creature surfaced below their boat. It throws their boat 3 meters up to the sky.

Some people believe that the Hawkesbury River Monster is a type of plesiosaur, a prehistoric marine reptile that is thought to have gone extinct millions of years ago. Others believe that the creature is a type of giant eel or crocodile. Still, others believe that the Hawkesbury River Monster is simply a hoax.

5. The Cursed Devil's Pool

The Devil's Pool is a super famous and beautiful natural pool in the Babinda Boulders Scenic Reserve in Queensland, Australia. However, there's a scary legend about this stunning place that can make anyone shiver.

According to the legend, there was a girl named Oolana from the Yindinji Tribe. She was married to a respected elder named Waroonoo. However, she fell in love with a young, handsome man from another tribe. When they were caught together, they fled into the valleys.

One day, Oolana was swimming in the pool when she was swept away by the current. Her lover tried to save her, but he was too late. Oolana drowned in the pool, and her spirit is said to have remained there ever since.

Since then, there have been numerous drownings at the pool, mostly men. Locals believe that Oolana's spirit is responsible for these deaths, and they warn people not to swim in the pool.

Chris Pine Movies

1. Hell or High Water (2016)

In the Western thriller "Hell or High Water," Chris Pine delivers a tour de force. He is a performance as one of two brothers resorting to bank robbery to save their family's farm. Pine's portrayal is nuanced and emotionally charged. He showcases the complex layers of his character's motivations. Alongside Ben Foster, Pine navigates the intense narrative with gripping drama. This feature makes this Oscar-nominated film a standout in his filmography. Where to watch: Rent or purchase on Amazon, iTunes, Google Play, and Vudu.

2. Star Trek (2009)

Chris Pine's breakthrough came with J.J. Abrams's "Star Trek" reboot, where he assumed the iconic role of James T. Kirk. Pine's portrayal of the rebellious Starfleet captain combines charm, humor, and exposure. As part of an ensemble cast, Pine's performance sets the stage for the franchise's future.

This Chris Pine movie established him as a leading force in blockbuster cinema. Where to watch: Paramount Plus, Paramount+ Amazon Channel, and Paramount+ Roku Premium Channel.

3. Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves (2023)

In the film "Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves," Pine takes on the role of a charming thief. He leads a motley crew on an epic search. Demonstrating his comedic timing and natural charisma, Pine invests in the fantasy genre with his unique energy.

The film promises a blend of humor and excitement, showcasing Pine's ability to bring wit and charm to the big screen. Where to watch: Amazon Prime Video and Paramount+.

7 Most Haunted Places In Cardiff To Facing Ghostly Whispers

7 Most Haunted Places In Cardiff To Facing Ghostly Whispers

Cardiff is the capital city of Wales. It is known for its rich history, stunning architecture, and haunted places. Cardiff has ranged from ancient castles to abandoned hospitals. This city is home to several places that are said to be frequented by ghosts and spirits. If you're brave enough to face ghostly whispers and eerie apparitions, here are seven of the most haunted places in Cardiff, Wales. Let's read till the end, and you may want to explore... if you dare.

flickr/ChiralJon

1. Cardiff Castle

This fantastic castle dates back to Roman times. It is said to be haunted by the ghost of a Roman soldier who roams the grounds at night. Visitors have reported hearing footsteps and whispers echoing through the halls.

2. Cardiff Royal Infirmary

Once a bustling hospital, this abandoned building is now said to be haunted by the spirits of ex-patients who passed away within its walls. Visitors have reported feeling a chilling presence and hearing unexplained noises throughout the building.

wikipedia

3. Llandough Hospital

Another abandoned hospital, Llandough, is rumored to be haunted by the ghost of a nurse. She wanders the halls in search of her lost patients. Many have reported seeing apparitions and feeling a sense of unease while exploring the empty corridors.

flickr/Pete

4. Whitchurch Hospital

This ex-psychiatric hospital is known for its dark history and numerous reports of paranormal activity. Visitors have reported hearing voices, seeing shadowy figures, and feeling sudden drops in temperature as they wander through the abandoned wards.

flickr/Bob Robertson

5. Castell Coch

This fairy-tale castle is rumored to be haunted by the ghost of a lady in white. Locals said she roamed the corridors late at night. Guests have reported feeling a cold breeze and hearing strange noises from empty rooms.

flickr/Glass Angel

6. The National Museum of Wales

This museum is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former curator who still watches over the exhibits. Visitors have reported seeing objects move on their own. Some also felt a presence lingering in certain galleries.

This beautiful cathedral has incredible architecture and peaceful surroundings. This site is said to be haunted by the ghost of a monk.

7. Llandaff Cathedral

The monk spirit roams the grounds in search of peace. Visitors have reported feeling a sense of calm and quiet in certain areas, while others have claimed to see shadowy figures moving about.

Whether you believe in ghosts or not, these haunted places in Cardiff, Wales, have an eerie atmosphere and feel of the past.

If you're feeling brave, let's visit these spots and see if you can glimpse the supernatural. Just remember to tread carefully and respect the spirits that are said to inhabit these locations. Cardiff may be a bustling city by day, but at night, it's a different story, with whispers of the past echoing.

Most Haunted Places In Cardiff

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
7 Chinese Action Movies That Will Leave You On The Edge of Your Seat

7 Chinese Action Movies That Will Leave You On The Edge of Your Seat

If you're a fan of action-packed movies that feature thrilling fight scenes and heart-pumping moments, then you're in luck!

Chinese cinema offers a treasure trove of incredible action movies that are guaranteed to keep you on the edge of your seat.

From epic martial arts battles to jaw-dropping stunts, here are seven Chinese action movies that will leave you wanting more.

1. Kung Fu Hustle (2004)

Directed by Stephen Chow, "Kung Fu Hustle" is a hilarious and action-packed film that combines elements of martial arts, comedy, and fantasy.

Set in 1940s Shanghai, the story follows a young man who aspires to join a notorious gang. However, he soon discovers his hidden talents in kung fu and becomes entangled in a deadly battle between rival gangs.

With its blend of humor and stunning fight sequences, Kung Fu Hustle is a must-watch for any action movie enthusiast.

2. Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon (2000)

Directed by Ang Lee, "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon" is a martial arts masterpiece that took the world by storm. Set in ancient China, the film tells the story of Li Mu Bai.

Li Mu Bai is a legendary warrior who entrusts his sword, the Green Destiny, to a great martial artist named Yu Shu Lien. However, when the sword gets stolen, an epic adventure unfolds, filled with breathtaking fight scenes and poetic storytelling.

With its graceful choreography and compelling characters, Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon won four Academy Awards and left audiences in awe.

3. Ip Man (2008)

Based on the life of the Wing Chun grandmaster Ip Man, this action-packed biographical film stars Donnie Yen as the main character.

Set in the 1930s during the Japanese occupation of China, the movie follows Ip Man as he uses his martial arts skills to defend his community against oppressive forces.

With its intense fight scenes and powerful message about resilience and honor, Ip Man became a franchise that spawned several sequels.

Starring the legendary Jackie Chan, "Drunken Master" is a classic martial arts film that showcases Chan's incredible acrobatic fighting style. The story revolves around Wong Fei-hung, a young troublemaker who is sent by his strict and unconventional uncle to learn martial arts

4. Drunken Master (1978)

Under his uncle's guidance, Wong Fei-hung becomes a master of a unique form of kung fu known as "drunken martial art."

With its entertaining fight scenes and Chan's trademark humor, Drunken Master remains a beloved favorite among action movie enthusiasts.

5. Fist of Fury (1972)

Directed by Lo Wei and starring Bruce Lee, "Fist of Fury" is a martial arts film that propelled Bruce Lee to international fame.

Set in Shanghai during the Japanese occupation, the movie follows Chen Zhen, a martial artist who seeks revenge for the death of his master.

Known for its iconic fight scenes and Lee's dynamic performance, Fist of Fury is considered a classic in the world of Chinese action cinema.

6. Shaolin Soccer (2001)

Combining martial arts and sports, "Shaolin Soccer" is a quirky and entertaining film directed by Stephen Chow. The story follows a group of former Shaolin monks who use their martial arts skills to compete in a soccer tournament.

With its over-the-top action sequences, hilarious moments, and heartwarming story, Shaolin Soccer is a unique blend of sports and martial arts that is sure to keep you entertained.

7. Enter The Dragon (1973)

Considered Bruce Lee's most influential film, "Enter The Dragon" is a martial arts masterpiece that showcases Lee's skills and charisma. The movie follows Lee as he infiltrates a secret martial arts tournament on a remote island to uncover a crime lord's illegal activities.

With its thrilling fights and iconic one-liners, Enter The Dragon remains an iconic film that has stood the test of time.

5 Most Popular Spy Agent Fiction Characters

These characters are skilled in various forms of combat and espionage techniques.

5 Most Popular Spy Agent Fiction Characters

Fictional spies in movies are often interesting characters who operate in the shadowy world of espionage.

They are skilled in various forms of combat, espionage techniques, and often have a sharp wit

Here are 5 of the most popular and widely recognized fictional spy agents especially in the movie industry!

Created by author Ian Fleming, James Bond is a British secret agent known by his code number, 007. Bond works for MI6 and is famous for his sophisticated charm, impeccable style, and ability to handle dangerous situations. He is a skilled marksman, hand-to-hand combatant, and is known for his use of high-tech gadgets provided by Q Branch.

James Bond

Created by author Robert Ludlum, Jason Bourne is a highly trained operative suffering from amnesia. The character is skilled in hand-to-hand combat, marksmanship, and is known for his resourcefulness. Bourne is a central character in a series of novels and has been portrayed by Matt Damon in the film adaptations.

Jason Bourne

Nikita, also known as "La Femme Nikita," is a character who first appeared in the French film "Nikita" and later in the TV series of the same name. She is a former criminal turned secret agent after being coerced into working for a covert government agency. Nikita is highly trained in combat and espionage.

La Femme Nikita

Ethan Hunt is the main character in the "Mission: Impossible" film series, portrayed by Tom Cruise. As a member of the Impossible Mission Force (IMF), Hunt is known for his exceptional physical abilities, mastery of disguise, and proficiency in high-stakes action scenarios. The character is resourceful and often faces seemingly impossible missions.

Ethan Hunt

Created by author John le Carré, George Smiley is a British intelligence officer known for his calm demeanor, strategic thinking, and ability to navigate complex espionage plots. Smiley is a central character in several novels, including "Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy." Unlike some other spy characters, Smiley relies more on his intellect and analysis rather than physical prowess.

George Smiley

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: Here are some of the spookiest and most haunted places in Utah that will send shivers down your spine.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_keywords: Haunted Places in Utah,Spookiest Places in Utah
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
5 Most Haunted Places in Utah That Will Send Shivers Down Your Spine

5 Most Haunted Places in Utah That Will Send Shivers Down Your Spine

Utah, known for its stunning landscapes and outdoor adventures, also has a darker side with some of the most haunted places in the state.

From eerie mansions to tragic historical sites, these locations are rumored to be filled with paranormal activity that will send shivers down your spine.

1. McCune Mansion

McCune Mansion

McCune Mansion is a beautiful and luxurious historic mansion in Salt Lake City that is rented for events and gatherings, such as weddings. It was built in the early 1900's for a famous American businessman, Alfred W. McCune. This mansion is said to be haunted by a mysterious man in black cape and a 10 years old girl. The spirit of the little girl often seen dancing and gigglings at weddings, while the man often seen around the Christmas time.

2. Rio Grande Depot

The Rio Grande Depot is a former train station and depot in Salt Lake City that is famous among ghost hunters in Utah. Guards sometimes heard mysterious footsteps at night or being approached by ghostly figures.

The Purple Lady of Rio Grande Depot

The most famous ghost in Rio Grande Depot is the "Purple Lady." The story said that her fiancee ended their relationship in the station and threw their engagement ring on the rail. When she tried to catch the ring, she was hit by a train and met her end. Her ghost is often seen in the girl's restroom of the former train station.

3. Mountain Meadows Massacre

One of the darkest chapters in Utah's history, the Mountain Meadows Massacre site, is a chilling reminder of the tragic events that took place in 1857.

Over 120 members of a wagon train were brutally killed by a local militia, and it is said that their restless spirits still roam the area, seeking justice and peace.

Some visitors say that they hear the mysterious cries of the victims and feel as though they are suddenly overcome by a terrible wave of sadness when around the area.

4. Devereaux House

Devereux House is a beautiful historic house in Salt Lake City. It was built by William C. Stanes in 1857.

Some say that the house is haunted by the spirit of a young girl. The girl often play pranks on the kitchen staff or wave at people at night.

According to the Let's Roam website, she also often photobomb people's picture.

© 2024 trstdly.com

5. Harold B. Lee Library 

The Harold B. Lee Library is the main library at Brigham Young University (BGU) in Provo, Utah.

Harold B. Lee Library

There are rumors that the reading room in the library is haunted. Visitors have reported hearing mysterious voices and feeling unusual temperatures in the room. In the Harp Room, there is a chair known as the Ghost Chair. Legend has it that the chair mysteriously appeared in the room, and its origins are unknown.

Selena Quintanilla Quotes that Inspired a Generation

Selena Quintanilla quotes capture her kindness, determination, and love for her family and fans. 

Selena Quintanilla Quotes that Inspired a Generation

Selena Quintanilla, often known just as Selena, was an amazing singer and performer. Born in 1971, she became famous for her beautiful voice and captivating songs. Besides her music, Selena was known for her inspiring words and positive attitude. And people often remember her through Selena Quintanilla quotes.

Sadly, her life was cut short when she was murdered at just 23 years old. However, her impact remains strong.

In this article, we will explore some of the most memorable Selena Quintanilla quotes, which continue to inspire her fans around the world.

These Selena Quintanilla quotes capture her kindness, determination, and love for her family and fans. They serve as reminders why she is still remembered and celebrated.

Selena Quintanilla Quotes

• "You have to take what you can get when you're getting started."

• "When I'm singing, I'm another person. I can be really free, in the sense that I can do whatever I want."

• "If you have a dream, don't let anybody take it away, and always believe that the impossible is possible."

• "Well, when I am singing I am a completely different person. I could be very free, depending on the situation I could do what I want."

• "Yes. I love Texas. I’m a Texas girl. I am Texan. I really like Corpus because it’s really laid back... When I go other places, I’m working, and I’m enjoying meeting people, but when I go home, that’s my time to be myself, and relax."

• "I’m very real, very sincere, and honest, and that’s how I’ll always be."

• "Not only as an entertainer but as a person who cared a lot and I gave the best that I could, and I’ve tried to be the best role model that I possibly could and the best person that I could be." — Selena on how she wants to be remembered.

• "The family that plays together stays together."

• "If you work hard to achieve your goals, the rest it’s really easy."

• "You shouldn’t care for somebody just because of the materialistic things that they have and I’m a firm believer in that."

• "Our culture is very beautiful. It’s very romantic. Spanish is a very romantic language. It’s the language of love. I think it’s very sad if we forget where we come from. Because we are who we are. I think the color or our skin is beautiful. I think people should be proud of that."

• "We got laughed at. My father was told that we would never make it. It's gradual, a growing process. It's not like it came overnight."

• "I don’t feel pressure because I’m not trying to portray something that I’m not."

• "It’s really cool to kind of have people come to me and get excited, you know, I don’t see myself that way. And I get excited when I see other artists."

• "Anybody can be a role model."

• "We never thought we'd get this far, but we're here."

• "I feel very proud to be Mexican. I didn't have the opportunity to learn Spanish when I was a girl, but... it's never too late to get in touch with your roots."

• "If you’re going to be somebody, you need to be a leader and not a follower. The impossible is always possible and you don’t need anybody else to tell you that you’re good."

• "The reason I'm really appreciative of everything that's going on around me is because of the fact that I never expected it, and I want to keep that attitude."

• "All I need to do is try and do the best that I can do."

• "One of the most important things, for me, is to have my family by my side, supporting me and have that love. For me, love is super important because money comes and goes but love lasts for such a long time, for the rest of your life."

• "I'm very simple. I like the finer things in life but because we have gone through some tough times in life I am able to enjoy the simpler things in life."

• "We went through a hard time, and we had to turn to music as a means of putting food on the table. And we've been doing it ever since. No regrets either."

• "Tejano music was hard for us because I was a girl. My dad had a lot of problems while trying to set up shows for us or presentations because there are a lot of men who don't think that women can get the attention of the public. But... wrong!"

5 Haunted Places In Pensacola Florida: A Journey Through Paranormal Landscape

5 Haunted Places In Pensacola Florida: A Journey Through Paranormal Landscape

Pensacola, Florida, is a city with a rich history and culture.

However, hidden within its charming streets and historic buildings lie paranormal tales. This article will take you through Pensacola's haunted landscape, from forts to lighthouses. Brace yourself for spooky stories as we explore five haunted places in Pensacola, Florida. Join us as we discover the mysteries that surround these old buildings.

Haunted Places In Pensacola Florida

1. Fort Barrancas and Fort Pickens

Our first stop on this paranormal adventure takes us to Fort Barrancas and Fort Pickens. These historic military forts have seen countless battles and tragedies.

Visitors have reported hearing spooky sounds, seeing shadowy figures, and feeling cold spots while exploring the grounds. Some believe these spirits are the restless souls of soldiers who lost their lives in combat.

Next, we head to the Pensacola Lighthouse. It is a towering structure that has guided ships safely for over 150 years.

2. Pensacola Lighthouse

Legend has it that the ghost of an ex-lighthouse keeper named Joseph remains within its walls. Visitors have claimed to hear footsteps, doors opening and closing on their own, and even catching glimpses of Joseph's ghostly figure. Even in death, Joseph seems to watch over the lighthouse he once cared for.

3. The Seville Quarter

Our next haunted destination is the Seville Quarter. It is a popular entertainment complex in downtown Pensacola.

Despite its lively atmosphere, it is rumored to be home to several spirits.

Employees and guests have reported hearing unexplained footsteps, laughter, and whispers in empty rooms. Some have even claimed to see apparitions and feel the presence of unseen entities. The spirits of the past still enjoy the spirited energy of the Seville Quarter.

Haunted Places In Pensacola Florida

4. St. Michael's Cemetery and St. John's Cemetery

Moving on, we arrive at St. Michael's Cemetery and St. John's Cemetery. These historic graveyards have a haunted reputation.

St. Michael's Cemetery is the final resting place of many notable figures, including soldiers, politicians, and even a famous pirate. Visitors have reported strange happenings such as unexplained lights and orbs, cold spots, and the feeling of being watched. Meanwhile, St. John's Cemetery is said to be haunted by the ghost of a young girl who tragically lost her life in a fire. People claim to hear the sound of her laughter and see her apparition playing among the tombstones.

Lastly, we visited Old Christ Church, a beautiful historic landmark in downtown Pensacola. This church has stood for over two centuries. It is believed to be haunted by several spirits.

5. Old Christ Church

Visitors have reported hearing organ music when no one is playing. Some also feel a presence behind them and even see shadowy figures in the pews. It is said that the spirits of former churchgoers still linger within these sacred walls.

As we finish our journey through Pensacola's haunted places, it is clear that this city holds a charming and spooky history.

Whether you believe in the paranormal or not, exploring these spots is an adventure. So, if you're ever in Pensacola and feel brave, visit these destinations. Who knows? You might experience something mystical.

Haunted Places In Pensacola Florida

Confirmed. Lionel Messi's Bodyguard is NOT an Ex-Navy SEAL

Confirmed. Lionel Messi's Bodyguard is NOT an Ex-Navy SEAL

Lionel Messi's bodyguard, who jumped into action to protect the soccer star during Sunday's match, is widely reported to be an ex-Navy SEA. But veterans of the elite unit say they've never heard of him.

Yassine Chueko shot to fame when videos circulated last month showing him walking on the sidelines of a soccer match, pushing an intruder on the pitch, and pulling fans' hands away from Messi as they took selfies with the Inter Miami star.

And he further proved his dedication to the athlete during Sunday's match when a fan ran onto the field in a Barcelona jersey and tried to hug Messi. Chueko quickly grabbed the fan by the neck and ripped him off in front of the entire Los Angeles stadium.

Sports websites, including Barstool Sports, and publications, including La Nacion and the New York Post, reported that Chueko, a large and muscular mixed martial arts professional, was a former US Navy SEAL who served in Iraq and Afghanistan.

But current and former members of the elite unit told DailyMail.com no one they knew had ever heard of him and that his name did not appear in a database of SEAL veterans they had access to.

Chueko and Inter Miami did not respond to requests for comment, leaving it a mystery where the claim emerged that the ring fighter-turned-bodyguard served as a SEAL.

A Navy spokeswoman said they could not locate any records for Yassine Chueko.

News reports also claim he was hired on Inter Miami president David Beckham's recommendation.

Beckham's representatives, Authentic Brands Group, also failed to respond to requests for comment.

Christophe Freisenbruch, a former SEAL who runs military medical technology company Rip Shears LLC in Virginia, posted angrily on LinkedIn referencing a news story about Chueko.

"Karma has a funny way of finding you when you're publicly advertised as a former SEAL, but you never graduated from BUD/S or earned the Trident. This is either media misattribution or outright fraud. #stolenvalor," he wrote.

Another former SEAL asked to remain anonymous and told DailyMail.com: "I've never heard of him. A former colleague has a database and says he's not a [SEAL] Team Guy."

It is unclear whether Chueko was the source of the claims that he served in the Navy's crack unit.

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: 8 Stunning Facts About Ducati; from racing dominance to revolutionary system!
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
8 Stunning Facts About Ducati

8 Stunning Facts About Ducati

Ducati, an Italian brand renowned for its high-performance motorcycles, has a rich history filled with innovation and passion. Here are eight captivating facts that showcase Ducati's journey.

Swipe Up to Learn More!

Founded in 1926 by Antonio Cavalieri Ducati and his sons in Bologna, Italy, Ducati initially focused on producing radio components and electronic devices. This family-owned business laid the groundwork for Ducati's future in engineering excellence.

Family Origins

By the 1930s, Ducati had become the largest employer in Bologna, Italy, with a workforce of 5000. Despite setbacks during World War II, including damage from bombings, Ducati persevered and continued to expand its production.

Fast Growth

While the Cucciolo bike was Ducati's initial foray into motorcycles, the Ducati 60, launched in 1949, marked their official entry. Featuring an upgraded engine and innovative design elements, it paved the way for Ducati's future models.

First Motorcycle

The Ducati Monster, introduced in 1993, revolutionized motorcycle design with its minimalist style and exposed trellis frame. It became a best-seller, contributing significantly to Ducati's global sales and popularity.

Iconic Monster

Located in Bologna, Italy, the Ducati Museum celebrates the brand's legacy with a collection of iconic motorcycles, racing memorabilia, and interactive exhibits. It's a pilgrimage site for motorcycle enthusiasts worldwide.

Legacy's Museum

Ducati has excelled in motorsport, winning 18 World Superbike Championship manufacturer titles and 15 rider championships since 1988. With a track record of 407 race victories, Ducati remains a powerhouse on the racing circuit.

Motorsport Dominance

Ducati's early success came with the Cucciolo, a small engine designed for bicycles. Selling over 200,000 units by 1950, the Cucciolo met post-war demand for affordable transportation, setting Ducati apart in the industry.

Popular Cucciolo Engines

Introduced in the late 1950s by engineer Fabio Taglioni, Ducati's desmodromic valve system is renowned for its precision. Unlike conventional engines, it uses a mechanical system to close valves, enabling higher engine speeds and performance.

Revolutionary 'Desmodromic' Valve System

Top 10 Cold-Weather Dog Breeds That Love Playing in Snow

Top 10 Cold-Weather Dog Breeds That Love Playing in Snow

If you live in a cold climate, you might be wondering which dog breeds love playing in the snow. Some dogs are naturally built for winter activities and enjoy the cold weather. Here is a list of the top cold-weather dog breeds that love playing in the snow.

1. Siberian Husky

The Siberian Husky is one of the most well-known snow-loving breeds. Originating from Siberia, they were bred to pull sleds in the harsh Arctic conditions. They have thick coats and are very energetic, making them perfect for snowy adventures.

2. Alaskan Malamute

Another Arctic breed, the Alaskan Malamute, is strong and powerful. They were also used for sled pulling and have a thick coat that keeps them warm in freezing temperatures. They are very playful and love running in the snow.

3. Newfoundland

While Newfoundlands are often associated with water, they also love playing in the snow. Their thick coats and friendly nature make them great companions for winter activities. They are also known for their intelligence and loyalty.

4. Samoyed

The Samoyed is a fluffy white dog that thrives in cold weather. They have a thick double coat that keeps them warm and are very energetic. They love running and playing in the snow, making them a great choice for families who enjoy winter sports.

5. Bernese Mountain Dog

The Bernese Mountain Dog is a sturdy breed that originated in the Swiss Alps. They have a thick coat and are very strong. It makes them perfect for hiking and playing in the snow. They are also known for their friendly and gentle nature.

6. Saint Bernard

The Saint Bernard is famous for its role in saving travelers in the Alps. They have a thick coat and are very strong, making them well-suited for snowy conditions. They are also known for their friendly and outgoing personalities.

7. Great Pyrenees

The Great Pyrenees is a large breed that was originally used to guard sheep in the Pyrenees Mountains. They have a thick coat and are very protective of their families. They love playing in the snow and are very calm and gentle.

8. Tibetan Mastiff

The Tibetan Mastiff is a giant and powerful breed that originated in the Himalayas. They have a thick coat and are very protective of their families. They are also very intelligent and love playing in the snow.

9. American Eskimo Dog

The American Eskimo Dog is a small to medium-sized breed that was originally used as a circus performer. They have a thick coat and are very energetic, making them perfect for playing in the snow. They are also very intelligent and love to learn new tricks.

10. Norwegian Elkhound

The Norwegian Elkhound is a medium-sized breed that originated in Norway. They have a thick coat and are very energetic, making them perfect for hunting and playing in the snow. They are also very intelligent and love to run and play.

5 Unique Facts About Viking Warriors You May Never Heard About

These facts highlight the complexity and sophistication of Viking warriors.

5 Unique Facts About Viking Warriors You May Never Heard About

Viking warriors known as "berserkers" were famed for their ferocity and seemingly inhuman strength in battle. They are believed to have entered a trance-like state, often attributed to the consumption of psychoactive substances.

Some theories suggest they ingested substances like Amanita muscaria (a type of hallucinogenic mushroom) to induce this berserker rage, which made them incredibly formidable but also uncontrollable in battle.

Drugs Usage During Combat

Viking warriors adhered to a complex set of laws and ethics, known as the "Gulathing Law" and "Frostathing Law," among others. These legal codes governed not only everyday life but also conduct in warfare.

They outlined rules for fair combat, honor, and the treatment of prisoners and enemies. This structured legal system helped maintain order and discipline within Viking society and during military campaigns.

Ethical Codes and Honor

While the majority of Viking warriors were men, there is evidence suggesting that some women also took part in combat. Archaeological findings, such as the grave of a high-ranking female warrior in Birka, Sweden, equipped with weapons and war gear, indicate that women could be active participants in Viking warfare.

These "shieldmaidens" are not just the stuff of legend but were a real, though perhaps rare, phenomenon.

Woman Vikings

Vikings often engaged in psychological warfare to intimidate their enemies before battle. They used war cries, drumming, and the blowing of horns to create an atmosphere of fear and chaos.

Additionally, they sometimes practiced gruesome rituals such as the "blood eagle," a method of execution intended to terrorize foes and demoralize opponents through the sheer brutality of the act.

Psychological Warfare

The quality of their weapons was often exceptional due to advanced metallurgy skills. For instance, the Ulfberht swords, made from high-quality steel, were renowned for their strength and flexibility.

These swords were ahead of their time and highly prized, showcasing the Vikings' sophisticated craftsmanship and trade connections.

Superb Weapon Quality

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_keywords: marriage tips,things to prepare before getting married

Before Deciding to Get Married, Make Sure You Have Prepared These 4 Things

These various things will help your marriage and your partner's life to be more peaceful and minimize conflicts.

Before Deciding to Get Married, Make Sure You Have Prepared These 4 Things

Getting married is not an easy decision to make.

This is because marriage itself is a sacred thing and requires commitment from the couples who do it. 

Also, building a household needs openness. This keeps the relationship harmonious and lasting.

Well, before your marriage, there are certainly a few important things that need to be prepared.

These various aspects will help to create a peaceful and conflict-free married life for you and your partner.

For those who are curious, here are four main things that should be prepared before deciding to get married.

1. Emotional and Mental Preparedness

Marriage is not just about love and togetherness, but also about being prepared to face various challenges and changes that will come. It is important to ensure that you and your partner are emotionally and mentally ready to face life together.

Discuss your hopes, dreams, and concerns with each other. Pre-marital therapy can also be an option to ensure that both of you are truly emotionally ready to enter a new chapter in life.

2. Financial Preparedness

Getting married means combining two finances into one, and it is important to have a clear financial plan. Therefore, discuss about budgeting, savings, debt, and long-term financial plans.

Make sure you and your partner agree on how to manage household finances.

Including the division of financial responsibilities and plans for the future, such as buying a house or planning for children's education.

3. Readiness to Share Responsibilities

Before getting married, it is important to discuss how you will divide household chores, work, and family time.

This agreement will help avoid conflicts in the future and ensure that both of you feel fair in living together.

Being ready to support each other in careers and personal aspirations is also something to consider.

4. Readiness for Long-Term Commitment

Marriage is a long-term commitment that requires strong dedication from both parties. Make sure that you and your partner have the same understanding of the meaning of commitment and are ready to work together in maintaining the integrity of the marriage. This includes being ready to communicate effectively, resolving conflicts in a healthy manner, and continually striving to strengthen the relationship over time.

In a marriage, both you and your partner need to prepare many things to ensure that the bond you have created will never be broken. By paying attention to the things mentioned above, your marriage will have a strong foundation and be ready to face any challenges in the future.

In addition, when you and your partner decide to get married, you should also prepare other things, such as wedding rings. In the global culture, wedding rings symbolize eternity because of their circular shape. That's why, in almost every wedding ceremony, exchanging rings is a mandatory and important part.

Choose a ring design that suits your and your partner's taste. The design can be casual, classic, or even fancy with a modern style. Also, pay attention to the materials used in making the ring. With the right choice, you and your partner will never regret buying it.

Rose Quotes: Finding Beauty Through Roses and Thorns

(Photo by Eward Howell on Unsplash)

Rose Quotes: Finding Beauty Through Roses and Thorns

Did you know that roses carry distinct meanings based on their colors in the language of flowers?

Red roses signify love, and yellow roses signify friendship. This enables people to convey emotions and intentions through the specific colors of these flowers. Moreover, there are rose quotes that perfectly capture the essence of these flowers.

We have gathered a list of rose quotes that offer wisdom, love, and hope to all who admire these cherished flowers

Let’s explore the beauty contained in this collection of rose quotes!

© 2024 trstdly.com

Rose Quotes: Finding Beauty Through Roses and Thorns

1. “If you know how to make people happy with a single look, then you are a rose! If you know how to hurt people with a single touch, then you’re a thorn.” – Mehmet Murat Ildan

2. “A rose does not lose sleep because it was mocked by weeds.” – Matshona Dhliwayo

3. “The rose is fairest when it is budding new, and hope is brightest when it dawns from fears.” – Sir Walter Scott

4. “Some people grumble that roses have thorns; I am grateful that thorns have roses.” – Alphonse Karr

5. “A rose does not answer its enemies with words, but with beauty.” – Matshona Dhliwayo

6. “Real beauty is in the fragility of your petals. A rose that never wilts isn’t a rose at all.” – Crystal Woods

7. “You may break, you may shatter the vase, if you will, but the scent of the roses will hang round it still.” – Thomas Moore

8. “A life with love must have some thorns, but a life with no love will have no roses.” – Anonymous

9. “A rose with ten thousand thorns is still more valuable than a daisy without even one.” – Matshona Dhliwayo

10. “The rose and the thorn, and sorrow and gladness are linked together.” – Saadi

11. “Just like the rose holds her beauty among the thorns, we can gather our strength from the most unlikely places.” – Christine Evangelou

12. “The gentle rose offers a powerful joy known only to the heart.” – Andrew Pacholyk

13. “Roses do not bloom hurriedly; for beauty, like any masterpiece, takes time to blossom.” – Matshona Dhliwayo

14. “The more you love roses, the more you must bear with thorns.” – Matshona Dhliwayo

15. “In a world full of roses, stand out like a dandelion in the middle of a green, plush lawn!” – June Stoyer

16. “Roses fall, but the thorns remain.” – Dutch Proverb

17. “A rose’s rarest essence lives in the thorn.” – Rumi

18. “If roses were not special, weeds would not envy them.” – Matshona Dhliwayo

19. “Discipline trains you to put up with disappointments, every rose has a thorn.” – Sai Baba

20. “The sharp thorn often produces delicate roses.” – Ovid

21. “If the rose is a beautiful flower, it is also because it opens itself.” – Charles De Leusse

22. “No rose without a thorn.” – French Proverb

23. “A thorn defends the rose, harming only those who would steal the blossom.” – Chinese Proverb

24. “Thorns and roses grow on the same tree.” – Turkish Proverb

25. “A rose in a desert can only survive on its strength, not its beauty.” – Matshona Dhliwayo

26. “A rose isn’t quite as beautiful as it once was, when after its thorn pricks you.” – Anthony Liccione


27. “The rose that is democracy has its own thorns. We have to bear with it.” – Don Santo

28. “Dear Superwoman, remember that a rose does not stop looking beautiful because of the thorns around it. So, never allow weaknesses to stop you from admiring your own strengths.” – Gift Gugu Mona

29. “If you enjoy the fragrance of a rose, you must accept the thorns which it bears.” – Isaac Hayes

30. “Original daisies are worth more than counterfeit roses.” – Matshona Dhliwayo

31. “But he that dares not grasp the thorn should never crave the rose.” – Anne Bronte

32. “Where there are no thorns there are no roses.” – Matshona Dhliwayo

33. “A cactus is a desert’s rose.” – Matshona Dhliwayo

34. “For the rose, though its petals be torn asunder, still smiles on, and it is never cast down.” – Rumi

35.“If roses tried to be sunflowers, they'd lose their beauty; and if sunflowers tried to be roses, they'd lose their strength.” – Matshona D. 

36. “The rose is a rose from the time it is a seed to the time it dies. Within it, it contains its whole potential. It seems to be constantly in the process of change. Yet, at each state, at each moment, it is perfect as it is.” – Paulo Coelho

37. “The optimist sees the rose and not its thorns; the pessimist stares at the thorns, oblivious to the rose.” – Kahlil Gibran

38. “Just like the rose holds her beauty among the thorns, we can gather our strength from the most unlikely places.” – Christine Evangelou

Tyson Fury is the current WBC and lineal world heavyweight champion. He has an undefeated record of 31-0-1 and has won important fights against Deontay Wilder and Wladimir Klitschko.

George Foreman

George Foreman is famous for his strong punches. He knocked out Joe Frazier and Ken Norton. At 45, he became champion again by defeating Michael Moorer.

Joe Frazier

Joe Frazier was known for his tough fighting style. He gave Muhammad Ali his first loss in the "Fight of the Century" in 1971. Frazier was one of Ali's toughest opponents.

Larry Holmes

Larry Holmes was great with his powerful jab and held the world heavyweight title for eight years. He beat top fighters like Ken Norton, Earnie Shavers, and Muhammad Ali.

Mike Tyson

Mike Tyson scared opponents with his powerful punches in the 1980s and 1990s. Some of his big wins were against Trevor Berbick, Larry Holmes, Michael Spinks, Frank Bruno, and Donovan Ruddock.

Evander Holyfield

Evander Holyfield is the only boxer to win the heavyweight title four times. He is well-known for beating Riddick Bowe and Mike Tyson.

Lennox Lewis

Lennox Lewis won the world heavyweight title three times. He defeated Evander Holyfield (twice), knocked out Mike Tyson, and beat Vitali Klitschko with his smart boxing skills.

Muhammad Ali

Muhammad Ali is often called the greatest heavyweight boxer ever. He won against Joe Frazier, George Foreman, Floyd Patterson, and Ken Norton. Ali's talent and personality make him the standard for greatness in boxing.

Feel Better Quotes: 30 Encouraging Words for A Better Day

Feel better quotes are special sayings that help lift our mood. 

Feel Better Quotes: 30 Encouraging Words for A Better Day

Sometimes life can be tough. We all have days when we feel a little down.

But did you know that a few kind words can make a big difference?

That's where feel better quotes come in. Feel better quotes are special sayings that help lift our spirits and remind us that things will get better. 

Feel better quotes come from many different people, like authors, leaders, and everyday folks. They remind us that we are not alone in our journey.

In this article, we will explore a collection of feel-better quotes that can comfort your heart. Moreover, they’ll inspire you to keep going.

  • “You can’t stop the waves, but you can learn to swim.” – Jon Kabat-Zinn

  • “In order to carry a positive action, we must develop a positive vision.” – Dalai Lama

  • “Vibe high and the magic around you will unfold.” – Akilnathan Logeswaran

  • “Positive thinking is more than just a tagline. It changes the way we behave. And I firmly believe that when I am positive, it not only makes me better, but it also makes those around me better.” – Harvey Mackay

  • “You attract the energy that you give off. Spread good vibes. Think positively. Enjoy life.” – Unknown

Feel Better Quotes for A Better Day

  • “You should cleanse your mind of all the bad vibes. Let the good vibes flow instead.” – Unknown

  • “The struggle you’re in today is developing the strength you need tomorrow.” – Robert Tew

  • “Put your thoughts to sleep. Do not let them cast a shadow over the moon of your heart. Let go of thinking.” – Rumi

Can Reading in Low Light Harm Your Eyes? This is the Fact!

Reading in low light conditions will not cause low vision, but it can cause eye strain.

Can Reading in Low Light Harm Your Eyes? This is the Fact!

Myopia is one of the most common vision conditions.

But it is still many misunderstandings about this condition.

One of the many "myths" is eyes can become minus because they read too much in warm or dark light.

However, is that true?

The answer is no.

Reading books in dim or little dark light does not directly cause myopia.

Dark light may make it difficult for the eyes to focus.

It can be caused short-term eye fatigue, says Richard Gans, MD, FACS, an ophthalmologist at the Cleveland Clinic Cole Eye Institute.

Richard Gans said,

"But there is no scientific proof that reading in the dark will harm your eyes in the long term, or make your eyes go minus,"

as reported by WebMD.

However, reading in bad light conditions can cause the eye to be tired.

It can affect overall eye health. Just like any other muscle in the body, the eyes can become weak if they are overworked.

Reading in dim or dark light causes the eyes to weaken faster than usual.

Some symptoms of eye strain include tired eyes, headaches, itchy eyes, blurred vision, and increased sensitivity to light.

Top 6 Greatest Singaporean Movies Ever Made To Add To Your Watchlist

Top 6 Greatest Singaporean Movies Ever Made To Add To Your Watchlist

Singaporean cinema may not yet be as widely recognized as Hollywood blockbusters or acclaimed international films, but it has produced some hidden gems that are definitely worth exploring.

From thought-provoking dramas to heartwarming tales, here is a list of the best Singaporean movies ever made that you should add to your watchlist.

1. Tiong Bahru Social Club (2020)

Set in the vibrant Tiong Bahru district, this quirky comedy takes a satirical look at Singapore's obsession with becoming a utopian society.

Follow Ah Bee as he joins a unique self-improvement program that promises to make his life perfect. This lighthearted film offers a humorous yet thought-provoking commentary on society's pursuit of happiness.

2. A Yellow Bird (2016)

Siva is an Indian-Singaporean man who just got released from prison for contraband smuggling. He embark on a quest to find his missing ex-wife and daughter which lead him to discover the dark truth about his family.

With stunning performances and a haunting storyline, this film tackles issues of identity, forgiveness, and redemption.

Directed by award-winning filmmaker Anthony Chen, this poignant drama tells the story of a Chinese language teacher who forms an unlikely bond with a troubled student during Singapore's monsoon season.

3. Wet Season (2019)

The film beautifully captures the complexities of human relationships and the resilience of the human spirit.

4. Ilo Ilo (2013)

A critically acclaimed film that has garnered international recognition, Ilo Ilo is a touching and honest portrayal of a Filipino maid's relationship with a Singaporean family during the Asian financial crisis in the 1990s.

This touching movie delves into the themes of family dynamics, sacrifice, and the transformative power of compassion.

5. Apprentice (2016)

Venture into the dark and gripping world of the Singaporean prison system with this psychological drama.

Follow Aiman, a young correctional officer, as he becomes an apprentice to the chief executioner.

This thought-provoking film explores themes of morality, justice, and the inner struggles of the characters.

6. A Land Imagined (2018)

Winner of the Golden Leopard award at the Locarno Film Festival, this mesmerizing film blurs the line between reality and dreams.

It follows a police investigator as he delves into the mysterious disappearance of a construction worker from China while exploring themes of isolation, alienation, and the hidden sides of Singaporean society.

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: “It started as a random idea, inspired by the original ALS Ice Bucket Challenge and how powerful that movement was.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
Why Is 'Ice Bucket Challenge' Becoming Viral Again Recently?

In a heartfelt revival of the 2014 viral sensation, the Ice Bucket Challenge has made a comeback in 2025, this time aiming to spotlight mental health issues.

Spearheaded by students from the University of South Carolina's MIND (Mental Illness Needs Discussion) Club, the renewed campaign, dubbed #SpeakYourMIND, seeks to destigmatize mental health struggles and raise funds for Active Minds, a nonprofit dedicated to mental health advocacy among young adults. ​

The famous ‘Ice Bucket Challenge’ is now going viral again

Instead of ALS, the challenge aims to raise mental health awareness this time around pic.twitter.com/odFaly4BsM

— Dexerto (@Dexerto) April 23, 2025

The format remains familiar: participants record themselves being doused with ice water, share the video on social media using the hashtag #SpeakYourMIND, and challenge others to do the same or donate to the cause.

The initiative has rapidly gained traction, amassing over $190,000 in donations and drawing support from public figures like Peyton Manning and Jenna Bush Hager. ​

“It started as a random idea, inspired by the original ALS Ice Bucket Challenge and how powerful that movement was,” Wade Jefferson, Sophomore at USC and Founder of the MIND club, said in a statement.

“We wanted to bring that same energy to mental health. Watching it take off — seeing people we admire, like Peyton Manning, join in — has been surreal. We’re proud, grateful, and just excited to see how far it’s gone and continue to go,” Jefferson continued.

While some critics argue that the new focus diverges from the original ALS awareness mission, the ALS Association has expressed support for the campaign's evolution, recognizing its potential to address pressing mental health concerns. ​

5 Most Frightening Places in Illinois with Ghostly Legends

If you're feeling brave, visit one of these haunted sites and see for yourself.(Photo: pinterest/The Tick)

5 Most Frightening Places in Illinois with Ghostly Legends

Illinois is known for its rich history and diverse culture. It is also home to some of the most haunted places in the United States.

The state has no shortage of spooky locations with ghostly legends that will send chills down your spine. In this article, we will explore five of the most frightening places in Illinois. It is where paranormal activity is said to run away. 

Let's grab a flashlight and prepare yourself for a thrilling adventure into the unknown.



Most Frightening Places in Illinois

1. Old Joliet Prison

This historic prison, which operated from 1858 to 2002. This site is said to be haunted by the spirits of former inmates.

They met untimely ends within its walls. Visitors have reported hearing ghostly whispers and feeling sudden drops in temperature as they explore the abandoned building.

Photo: flickr/treetopleaf/Mary/

2. Rialto Square Theatre

Built in 1926, this elegant theater in Joliet is rumored to be haunted by a ghost named "Red." Legend has it that Red was a stagehand who tragically died during a performance and now roams the theater, causing mischief and moving objects around.
Photo: flickr/cjsmithphotography/Chris Smith

flickr/curtis locke

3. Couch Tomb Lincoln Park

Located in Chicago's Lincoln Park, the Couch Tomb is said to be haunted by the ghost of Ira Couch, a wealthy businessman who was buried alive in the tomb in 1857. Visitors have reported seeing apparitions and hearing strange noises coming from the mausoleum.

wikipedia

4. Englewood Post Office

This abandoned post office in Chicago is rumored to be haunted by the ghost of a former employee who died under mysterious circumstances. People have reported seeing shadowy figures moving through the building and hearing unexplained footsteps in the empty halls.

5. Manteno State Mental Hospital


Once a psychiatric hospital, Manteno State Mental Hospital is now abandoned but is said to be haunted by the tortured souls of patients who suffered within its walls. 













Most Frightening Places in Illinois

Visitors have reported seeing apparitions of former patients and feeling overwhelming sadness and despair while exploring the eerie grounds.

These five spots in Illinois are not for the faint of heart.

Whether you believe in ghosts or not, the stories and legends surrounding these places are enough to make anyone feel uneasy. If you're feeling brave, visit one of these haunted sites and see for yourself.

Remember to proceed cautiously - you never know what spirits may lurk in the shadows. For those brave enough to explore the haunted places of Illinois, there is no shortage of eerie encounters waiting to be discovered. Happy ghost hunting!

Most Frightening Places in Illinois

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.title: Blur to Release New Concert Film and Documentary Reunion 2023
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: Blur to Release New Concert Film and Documentary Reunion 2023
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
Blur to Release New Concert Film and Documentary Reunion 2023

Blur to Release New Concert Film and Documentary Reunion 2023

Blur will release a new documentary and concert chronicling their big reunion in 2023.

As Screen Daily reports, UK sales and distribution company Altitude has added two upcoming movie titles to its European Film Market (EFM) list.

Both projects will be released in cinemas in the UK and Ireland later this year.

The first film is a feature-length documentary detailing the Britpop band's latest comeback, which sees Damon Albarn and co. Record and release their first album in eight years, 'The Ballad Of Darren'.

In addition, Blur played two massive headline shows at Wembley Stadium in London last summer.

This historic and emotional date will be immortalized in a concert film titled Blur: Live At Wembley Stadium.

The pair are directed by Toby L and produced by Josh Connolly through UK production company Up The Game, who previously worked on Liam Gallagher: Knebworth 22, Olivia Rodrigo Sour Prom, Foals: Rip Up The Road, and many more.

L directed all three titles and directed the visuals for Blur's 2023 single 'St. Charles Square' and Albarn's 'Polaris' performance videos.

In a five-star review of Blur's first show at Wembley Stadium in July, NME wrote, "The two-hour show showed that Blur have made a soundtrack to the audience's lives with real emotional impact."

"[Alex] James recently called the making of their new album an 'incredible joy'. It's clear that fans will be saying the same about tonight."

Late last year, Damon Albarn said it was "time to finish" Blur again and called their reunion in 2023 a "beautiful success".

However, the band has been confirmed for both editions of Coachella 2024. No further performances have been announced yet.

Blur's latest return also sees them perform in the UK, Ireland, Europe, Japan, and South America.

Meanwhile, Blur has been nominated for three BRIT Awards: Album Of The Year ('The Ballad Of Darren'), Group Of The Year, and Alternative/Rock Act. The 2024 ceremony will take place on March 2.

8 Nutritious Fruits that are Safe to Consume during Diarrhea, Cheap and Delicious

There are several fruits that can be a good choice to consume when experiencing diarrhea and other health issues.

8 Nutritious Fruits that are Safe to Consume during Diarrhea, Affordable and Delicious

Diarrhea is a common digestive problem that many people experience.

This condition can be caused by various factors such as infections, contaminated food, or stress.

When you have diarrhea, it is important to choose the right food to avoid worsening your digestive condition.

One good option is fruits.

There are several fruits that are a good and safe choice to consume when you have diarrhea.

Gathered from various sources, here are some fruits that are safe to consume when diarrhea strikes.

Banana

This fruit contains pectin, a soluble fiber that helps thicken stools and relieve diarrhea. Bananas also contain potassium, which can help replace electrolytes lost due to diarrhea. Additionally, bananas are easy to find and affordable.

Peeled Apple

Apples are a good source of fiber, but if you're experiencing diarrhea, it's best to peel the skin off first.

The apple skin contains rough fiber that can worsen diarrhea.

Skinless apples still contain soluble fiber that helps thicken stools and relieve diarrhea.

Papaya

Papaya contains the enzyme papain which can aid in digestion and alleviate symptoms of diarrhea. This fruit is also rich in soluble fiber which can help reduce diarrhea. Papaya is a commonly accessible tropical fruit that can easily be found in markets.

Watermelon

Watermelon is a fruit that contains a high amount of water, which can help keep your body hydrated during diarrhea. The high water content in watermelon also helps loosen stools and relieve constipation that may occur after diarrhea. Watermelon is usually available at an affordable price during its season.

Melons

Melons are another fruit that contains a lot of water and soluble fiber. The water content in melons helps maintain fluid balance in your body during diarrhea, while the soluble fiber helps thicken stool.

Melons are available in various types, such as cantaloupe and honeydew, which you can choose according to your preference.

Guava

Guava contains soluble fiber that helps reduce diarrhea and alleviate uncomfortable digestive symptoms. In addition, guava contains vitamin C which is good for your immune system. Guava is usually available in the market at an affordable price.

Mango

Mango is a delicious and healthy tropical fruit that can help relieve diarrhea. Mango contains soluble fiber that helps thicken the stool and reduce the frequency of bowel movements. Additionally, its sweet taste makes it a tasty snack when you're experiencing diarrhea.

The Pirate

Pears contain soluble fiber that can help in treating diarrhea. This fiber helps to bind excess water in the intestines and alleviate diarrhea. Pears also contain vitamin C and various other essential nutrients.

When consuming fruits during diarrhea, make sure to avoid high-sugar fruits, such as berries, as sugar can worsen diarrhea. 

Additionally, it is important to stay hydrated by drinking enough water during diarrhea to prevent dehydration.

In terms of safe foods to consume during diarrhea, these fruits are a good choice because they are not only easy to find and affordable, but they can also help alleviate your diarrhea symptoms.
