Top 7 Greatest John Cusack Movies You Need To Watch

Top 7 Greatest John Cusack Movies You Need To Watch

John Cusack is a versatile actor known for his captivating performances across various genres.

Whether you're into romantic comedies, dramas, or thrillers, there's a John Cusack movie for everyone. Here's a curated list of seven of his greatest films that you absolutely need to add to your watchlist.

(Watch on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

1. Say Anything (1989)

Say Anything (1989)

In this classic romantic comedy-drama, Cusack plays Lloyd Dobler, a lovable underachiever who falls for the valedictorian of his high school class. The film is known for its iconic scene of Lloyd holding up a boombox playing Peter Gabriel's "In Your Eyes" outside his love interest's window. It's a heartwarming and timeless tale of young love and self-discovery.

2. High Fidelity (2000)

(Watch on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

High Fidelity (2000)

Cusack stars as Rob Gordon, a record store owner who is obsessed with music and relationships. The film follows Rob as he revisits his past breakups and tries to figure out why he keeps sabotaging his love life. With its witty dialogue and memorable characters, "High Fidelity" is a must-watch for any music lover or fan of smart romantic comedies.

3. Love & Mercy (2014)

(Watch on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Love & Mercy (2014)

In this biographical drama, Cusack portrays Brian Wilson, the troubled genius behind The Beach Boys. The film explores Wilson's struggles with mental illness and his creative process, as well as his relationship with his controversial therapist, Dr. Eugene Landy. Cusack's performance is both heartfelt and haunting, making "Love & Mercy" a powerful and moving portrait of a musical legend.

4. Grosse Pointe Blank (1997)

(Watch on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Grosse Pointe Blank (1997)

Cusack stars as a professional assassin who returns to his hometown for his high school reunion in this dark comedy. As he tries to juggle his personal life with his secretive profession, he reconnects with an old flame (played by Minnie Driver) and faces off against rival hitmen. With its sharp humor and action-packed sequences, "Grosse Pointe Blank" is a thrilling and entertaining ride.

5. Better Off Dead (1985)

(Watch on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, Paramount+,  and Apple TV)

Better Off Dead (1985)

In this quirky comedy, Cusack plays a lovelorn teenager named Lane Meyer, who goes to extreme lengths to win back his ex-girlfriend. The film's offbeat humor and surreal visuals make it a cult classic among 80s movie fans. From skiing down treacherous slopes to challenging the high school ski team, Lane's misadventures are sure to keep you laughing from start to finish.

6. Bullets Over Broadway (1994)

(Watch on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, Peacock TV, and Apple TV)

Bullets Over Broadway (1994)

Cusack stars in this Woody Allen film as a struggling playwright who gets entangled with a mobster's girlfriend during rehearsals for his latest play. As tensions rise and egos clash, the characters must navigate a web of deception and betrayal to see their show through to opening night. With its sharp dialogue and stellar ensemble cast, "Bullets Over Broadway" is a witty and engaging comedy-drama.

7. Eight Men Out (1988)

(Watch on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Eight Men Out (1988)

Based on the true story of the 1919 Black Sox scandal, Cusack plays baseball player George 'Buck' Weaver, who becomes embroiled in a conspiracy to throw the World Series. As the players grapple with moral dilemmas and the consequences of their actions, tensions mount both on and off the field. Cusack delivers a compelling performance in this gripping sports drama that sheds light on a dark chapter in baseball history.

The 8 Best Places to Visit in Oregon: Amazing Places You Need to Visit

The 8 Best Places to Visit in Oregon: Amazing Places You Need to Visit

Are you looking for some great places to visit in Oregon? Look no further!

Oregon is a beautiful state with a lot to offer, from bustling cities to stunning natural landscapes. Whether you're an outdoor enthusiast or a city slicker, there's something for everyone here.

If you're planning a trip to this beautiful state and wondering where to go, here are some of the best places to visit in Oregon you shouldn't miss:

1. Portland

Known for its hipster culture, delicious food scene, and beautiful parks, Portland is a must-visit city in Oregon. Explore the trendy neighborhoods like Pearl District and Alberta Arts District, where you can find unique shops, art galleries, and cafes.

Don't miss out on iconic landmarks like Powell's City of Books, the Portland Japanese Garden, and the International Rose Test Garden.

2. Crater Lake National Park

Located in the southern part of Oregon, Crater Lake National Park is home to the stunning Crater Lake, the deepest lake in the United States.

Visitors can admire the crystal-clear blue waters of the lake, hike along scenic trails, and marvel at the surrounding cliffs and forests. Don't forget to take a boat tour to Wizard Island or drive along Rim Drive for panoramic views of the lake.

For nature lovers, Silver Falls State Park is a paradise with its lush forests, cascading waterfalls, and hiking trails.

3. Silver Falls State Park

The most popular attraction in the park is the Trail of Ten Falls, a 7.2-mile loop trail that takes you past ten stunning waterfalls.

Enjoy a picnic by South Falls, take a dip in the refreshing waters, or simply relax and soak in the beauty of nature.

4. Cannon Beach

Located on the Oregon Coast, Cannon Beach is a charming seaside town known for its scenic beauty and iconic Haystack Rock. Spend your day strolling along the sandy shores, exploring tide pools, and watching colorful sunsets.

Don't miss the quaint boutiques, art galleries, and local eateries in town. Visit Ecola State Park for panoramic views of the coastline and a chance to spot whales in the distance.

One of the most iconic waterfalls in Oregon, Multnomah Falls is a must-see destination for nature enthusiasts.

5. Multnomah Falls

With a height of 620 feet, it is the tallest waterfall in the state and offers breathtaking views of cascading water surrounded by lush greenery.

Visitors can take a short hike to reach the base of the falls or simply admire the beauty of the viewing platform.

6. Bend

Located in central Oregon, Bend is a charming city known for its outdoor recreation opportunities and vibrant culture. With an abundance of hiking and biking trails, as well as world-class skiing in the nearby mountains, Bend is a paradise for outdoor enthusiasts.

The city also boasts a thriving craft beer scene, with numerous breweries offering delicious brews for visitors to enjoy.

7. Newport

Situated along the Oregon coast, Newport is a picturesque seaside town with plenty to offer visitors. From scenic beaches to historic lighthouses, Newport is a great destination for those looking to relax and unwind by the ocean.

Visitors can explore the bustling waterfront, sample fresh seafood at local restaurants, or visit the renowned Oregon Coast Aquarium.

8. Willamette Valley

Widely recognized as one of the premier wine regions in the United States, the Willamette Valley is a paradise for wine lovers. 

With more than 500 wineries producing world-class wines, visitors can enjoy wine-tasting tours and explore the picturesque vineyards that dot the landscape.

In addition to wine tasting, the Willamette Valley also offers stunning scenery, with rolling hills and lush countryside to explore.

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.title: Assam Tourist Places: 5 Beautiful Destinations in the Land of Blue Hills
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: From stunning national parks to charming cities, these Assam tourist places will take your breath away.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_keywords: Assam Tourist Places,Places To Visit In Assam,Tourist Places In Assam,Assam
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
Assam Tourist Places: 5 Beautiful Destinations in the Land of Blue Hills

Assam is a beautiful Indian state located in the northeastern part of the country. It is a treasure trove of natural beauty, rich culture, and history. When it comes to Assam tourist places, the options are endless, catering to the diverse interests of travelers.

Assam Tourist Places: 5 Beautiful Destinations in the Land of Blue Hills

Whether you're a nature enthusiast, a history buff, or just someone in search of a unique travel experience, Assam has something for everyone. The Assam tourist places offer a wide range of attractions, including stunning tea gardens, wildlife sanctuaries, ancient temples, and vibrant local markets. Exploring these places will not only give you a chance to witness the state's natural wonders but also immerse yourself in its fascinating cultural heritage.

In this article, we will guide you to the best Assam tourist places you must visit, according to various sources, Monday (8/1/2024). So, don't miss out on the opportunity to explore this enchanting part of India.

1. Kaziranga National Park

Kaziranga National Park is a famous wildlife sanctuary located in Assam. It was established in 1905 and is known for being a conservation success story, especially for the greater one-horned rhinoceros.

The park is home to a diverse range of wildlife, including tigers, elephants, wild water buffalo, and a variety of bird species. The most iconic and famous animal at Kaziranga is the greater one-horned rhinoceros, which is found in large numbers here. In fact, Kaziranga is home to two-thirds of the world's population of this rare and endangered species.

The park is also known for its unique and beautiful landscape, with tall elephant grass, marshland, and dense tropical broadleaf forests. The Brahmaputra River flows through the park, further adding to its natural beauty.

2. Manas National Park

Manas National Park is another exciting place for nature lovers and adventure seekers in Assam. Located on the Himalayan foothills, It is home to a wide variety of animals, including tigers, elephants, rhinoceros, and wild water buffaloes.

The park is known for its stunning natural beauty, with lush forests, grasslands, and a winding river running through it. It is also a UNESCO World Heritage site, recognized for its rich biodiversity and conservation efforts.

Manas National Park offers visitors the chance to see these incredible animals in their natural habitat through safari tours and guided walks. It also provides opportunities for bird watching and nature photography.

Overall, Manas National Park is a treasure trove of wildlife and natural beauty, making it a must-visit destination for nature lovers and conservation enthusiasts alike.

3. Majuli Island

Majuli Island is the world's largest river island, located in the Brahmaputra River. The island covers an area of around 880 square kilometers during the dry season.

Majuli Island is known for its rich cultural heritage. It is home to various ethnic groups and is considered a center for Assamese arts, music, and dance. 

The island also has a significant historical and spiritual significance. There are many ancient Vaishnavite monasteries, known as satras, scattered across the island. These satras are not only places of worship but also centers of learning and art, preserving the traditional Assamese culture.

The island is also known for its stunning natural beauty, with lush greenery, wetlands, and a variety of bird and animal species. The unique ecosystem of Majuli Island is a draw for tourists and nature enthusiasts, providing opportunities for bird-watching, boat rides, and trekking.

4. Guwahati

Guwahati is the largest city in Assam. The city offers a wide range of attractions, making it one of the best Assam tourist places.

One of the most famous places in Guwahati is the Kamakhya Temple. This ancient Hindu temple is dedicated to the goddess Kamakhya and is a significant religious site. People come from near and far to visit and worship at this sacred place.

For those interested in history and culture, the Assam State Museum is a must-visit. The museum houses a large collection of artifacts and exhibits related to the history and culture of the region.

Guwahati is also famous for its scenic beauty, with the Brahmaputra River flowing through the city and lush green hills surrounding the area. Visitors can take a boat ride on the river or simply enjoy the stunning views.

5. Dibrugarh

Dibrugarh is a lively city in Assam known for its rich cultural heritage and natural beauty. The city is situated on the banks of the Brahmaputra River and is surrounded by tea gardens and lush greenery.

Dibrugarh is often referred to as the "Tea City of India." It is located near many tea estates and is an important major tea trading center.

Visitors can also enjoy the natural beauty of the surrounding area. There are also opportunities for river cruises on the Brahmaputra, as well as trekking and wildlife safaris in nearby national parks.

With its blend of natural beauty and cultural heritage, Dibrugarh has something to offer for everyone. Whether you're interested in history and nature or simply enjoying a cup of freshly brewed tea, Dibrugarh is a city worth exploring.

Actor Christian Oliver and His Two Daughters Killed in Plane Crash

Actor Christian Oliver and His Two Daughters Killed in Plane Crash

Actor Christian Oliver passed away along with his two daughters in a plane crash in the Caribbean Islands. This unfortunate incident occurred while returning home on vacation.

Olivier and his two daughters were on a single-engine plane, taking off from Bequia airport on a small island in St. Vincent and the Grenadines at around 12:10 local time.

St. Vincent and the Grenadines police officials said the plane, which was headed to the St. Lucia area, experienced problems in flight. The plane crashed into the sea.


Quoting the Guardian, fishermen, divers, and coast guards descended on the scene after the incident. They managed to evacuate four bodies on the plane.

The four bodies were 51-year-old Oliver, his 10-year-old daughter Annik Klepser, and 12-year-old Madita Klepser, as well as pilot and aircraft owner Robert Sachs. Police said the four were pronounced dead at the scene by medical staff.

Coastguards took the bodies of Oliver, his daughter, and Sachs to the local morgue by boat for autopsies.

The deadly accident, which occurred on Thursday (4/1), prompted an outpouring of condolences for the family and friends of the late actor, who had completed filming scenes for the movie Forever Hold Your Peace.


Oliver's acting career began in 1994 with a 26-episode role on the show Saved by the Bell: The New Class. From 2006 to 2008, he played characters in Clooney and Cate Blanchett's The Good German, Emile Hirsch's Speed Racer, and Tom Cruise's Valkyrie.

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.title: His Old Age Photo Goes Viral. Here's Jackie Chan's Wealth at Almost 70 Years Old
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: His Old Age Photo Goes Viral. Here's Jackie Chan's Wealth at Almost 70 Years Old
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
His Old Age Photo Goes Viral. Here's Jackie Chan's Wealth at Almost 70 Years Old

His Old Age Photo Goes Viral. Here's Jackie Chan's Wealth at Almost 70 Years Old

Starting his career in acting in 1962 when he was 8 years old, Jackie Chan was still active until he was 69 years old.

Jackie Chan's latest appearance at almost 70 has made him the talk of the town on social media.

Even though Chan is getting older, he is still known to be active in the entertainment world today, and Chan also implied that Rush Hour 4 would be made.

"There are so many good action stars. My acting is better than other people's, not because I'm really good, but because I write a script that suits myself," he said.


"I can use camera angles to make my acting better. At night, I go home and edit myself and use things like that to make my acting better," he added.

To date, he has starred in more than 200 movies, and according to Forbes, his movies have made an average of US$2.6 billion worldwide.

So, it's no surprise that Jackie Chan is reported to have a net worth of US$400 million in 2023, and that number could continue to grow in 2024.

His wealth is earned from the film industry and because Chan skillfully maneuvers in the entertainment world.

His successful movies, endorsements, smart investments, and business ventures have created an empire beyond his on-screen image.

But it's not all instant gratification. Along the way, Chan has transformed from a stunt performer and fighter to a leading man and role model.

He also did not come from a wealthy family. Although Chan spent his early years at the top of Victoria Peak, Hong Kong's most prestigious address, his life was never privileged.

His father worked as a cook at the French consulate while his mother did the laundry.

Now, with his wealth, Chan has never used it for himself.

He still dresses, wears old sneakers, isn't surrounded by bodyguards, and he's always devoted to charity.

He admits that it's also a process. But some things make him question the meaning of his life.

"What have I done, for myself, for my country, for society? I thought, if I recover I should do more for everyone," he said when he was injured in an action scene without a stunt double.

In 2004, he started a second foundation, which builds schools and helps children and parents in remote areas of China.

"When I was a kid, I was very poor and wanted everything. So when I had money, I started buying things," he says.

"Now I want to give everything. When I give someone something and see their face, it makes me very happy," he continued.

Paul McCartney and John Lennon's Son Release Song Together

Paul McCartney and John Lennon's Son Release Song Together

For decades, the quality of work produced by John Lennon and Paul McCartney as songwriters has been the gold standard in the music industry. Therefore, many fans were surprised when a new McCartney-Lennon song surfaced recently.

The new song Primrose Hill is not the work of John Lennon and Paul McCartney but their children. It was just released on Thursday (4/11). The dreamy ballad reminds many people of The Beatles' musical style.

The song Primrose Hill was released by James McCartney, the son of Paul McCartney and his wife, Linda McCartney. James wrote this song with John Lennon and Yoko Ono's son, Sean Ono Lennon.

"With the release of this song, it feels like we're really starting something new, and I'm excited to continue sharing music with you," James wrote via his social media accounts the day after the release of "Primrose Hill", as reported by the New York Times on Thursday (4/18).

James and Sean declined to comment further on the release of the song Primrose Hill. Even so, McCartney openly promoted his son's music on social media.

"My son James has just released a new song called "Primrose Hill" - listen! And much love to Sean Ono Lennon, who co-wrote the song," McCartney wrote via his social media account.

James began releasing his songs in 2010 through an extended play album, Available Light. James at Abbey Road recorded some of the songs on this album.

In 2013, James released his first full-length album, Me. The album was produced by David Kahne, a former record executive who has worked with Linkin Park, Lana Del Rey, and Paul McCartney. James released another album, The Blackberry Train, in 2016.

James also contributed to the production of his parents' albums, Flaming Pie and Wide Prairie. In February, James also released a B-side song entitled Beautiful.

What Do Armadillos Eat? Fun Facts About the Amazing Animal

Are you wondering what do armadillos eat? These small animals with hard shells are interesting creatures that many people see in their yards. They look like little tanks walking around, but they are actually helpful animals that eat many different things.

Armadillos are famous for their armor-like shells and their ability to dig holes in the ground. They spend most of their time looking for food and can eat surprising amounts each day. These animals are not dangerous to humans and prefer to run away when they see people.

In this article, we will talk about what do armadillos eat and learn more about this interesting animal. From where they live to some surprising facts about them, we will see why they are so amazing. We gathered the information from various sources, Friday (13/6/2025).

What Do Armadillos Eat?

Armadillos are omnivores, which means they eat both plants and animals. However, insects make up about 90% of their daily diet. These hungry creatures can eat over 500 different types of food, making them very flexible eaters that can survive in many different places.

Insects and Bugs (Main Diet - 90%)

The main foods that armadillos eat are insects and bugs, which make up 90% of their daily diet. They love to eat ants, termites, beetles, grubs, cockroaches, spiders, and scorpions. These small creatures live in the soil and underground areas where armadillos spend most of their time digging. Giant armadillos can eat up to 200,000 ants in just one day, showing how important these tiny insects are for their survival.

Small Animals and Creatures

Besides insects, armadillos also hunt and eat small animals when they can find them. Their diet includes snails, worms, small frogs, lizards, small snakes, bird eggs, and reptile eggs. These foods provide extra protein and nutrients that help armadillos stay healthy and strong. They usually find these creatures while digging in the soil or searching near water sources during their nighttime hunting trips.

Plant Foods

When insects are hard to find, armadillos turn to plant foods to fill their stomachs. They eat fruits, berries, seeds, mushrooms, and roots that they find while foraging. These plant materials provide important vitamins, minerals, and carbohydrates that give armadillos energy. Plant foods become especially important during dry seasons or winter months when insects are less active and harder to catch.

Other Food Sources

Armadillos will also eat carrion, which means dead animals they find while searching for food. This helps them survive during times when fresh prey is not easy to find. Eating carrion shows how adaptable armadillos are and how they can make use of any available food source to meet their nutritional needs.

Armadillos use their strong sense of smell to find insects that are hiding up to 8 inches underground. Their long, sticky tongues help them catch insects from deep holes and narrow spaces. Plants become more important in their diet when insects are hard to find, helping them survive during difficult times.

Where Do Armadillos Live?

Armadillos live only in North, Central, and South America. Most of the 21 different species live in South America, where they first appeared millions of years ago. Only one species, the nine-banded armadillo, lives in the United States.

These animals prefer warm, wet environments because they cannot control their body temperature very well. They love places with soft soil that is easy to dig, like grasslands, forests, and wetlands. In the United States, nine-banded armadillos live mainly in the southern states like Texas, Louisiana, Arkansas, and Florida.

Armadillos build burrows underground where they sleep and hide from danger. These burrows can be up to 20 feet long and have many different entrances. The reason armadillos stick to warmer areas is because they have lower body temperatures than most other mammals, making it hard for them to stay warm in cold weather.

Do Armadillos Endangered?

Most armadillo species are not endangered and have healthy populations. However, some species are facing serious threats and need protection. The conservation status varies greatly between different types of armadillos.

The giant armadillo and the Brazilian three-banded armadillo are considered vulnerable, which means they could become endangered in the future. These species are losing their homes as people cut down forests and use the land for farming. The pink fairy armadillo is very small and rare, but scientists do not have enough information about how many exist in the wild.

Human activities affect armadillos in many ways. People hunt them for food in some countries, and their shells are sometimes used to make musical instruments and other items. Many armadillos are also killed by cars when they cross roads looking for food.

What Roles Armadillo Play in the Wild?

Armadillos play very important roles in their ecosystems and help maintain balance in nature. Their biggest contribution is controlling insect populations, especially harmful pests that can damage crops and spread diseases. A single armadillo can eat thousands of ants, termites, and other bugs in just 24 hours.

When armadillos dig for food, they also help improve the soil. Their digging brings nutrients from deep underground to the surface, which helps plants grow better. This process is called soil aeration, and it makes the earth healthier for other animals and plants.

Armadillos also provide food for other animals in the food chain. Larger predators like coyotes, cougars, and wolves hunt armadillos, especially the smaller species. The burrows that armadillos dig become homes for many other animals after the armadillos move on.

Other Surprising Facts About Armadillos

Armadillos are full of surprises that make them some of the most interesting animals in the world. These unusual creatures have many special abilities and features that set them apart from other mammals. Here are some amazing facts about armadillos that will surprise you.

1. They Are the Only Mammals With Bone Shells

Armadillos are the only mammals in the world that have hard shells made of bone. These shells grow directly from their backbones and provide excellent protection from predators. The shells are flexible and allow armadillos to move easily while staying protected.

2. Most Cannot Roll Into Balls

Only the three-banded armadillo can roll up into a complete ball Most armadillos are too stiff to curl up, so they run away or jump straight up in the air when scared. The nine-banded armadillo can jump 3 to 4 feet high when frightened.

3. Nine-Banded Armadillos Always Have Identical Quadruplets

Nine-banded armadillos always give birth to identical quadruplets, which means four babies that look exactly the same. This happens because one egg splits into four parts during development. Having four identical babies is very rare in the animal world.

4. They Are Excellent Swimmers and Can Hold Their Breath

Armadillos can hold their breath for up to six minutes, which helps them cross rivers and streams. Some people are surprised to see armadillos walking along the bottom of clear streams underwater. They can also swim very well by inflating their stomachs with air.

5. They Sleep 16 Hours Per Day

These animals sleep for about 16 hours every day, making them some of the sleepiest mammals on Earth. They are most active during dawn and dusk when the temperature is comfortable and insects are easy to find.

6. They Are Used in Medical Research

Armadillos have been used in medical research because they can get leprosy, a disease that affects humans. Scientists study armadillos to learn more about this disease and develop better treatments. However, the chance of getting leprosy from an armadillo is very small.

6 Haunted Places In Saskatchewan, CA, to Explore the Unknown

Let's see if you can uncover the mysteries within these eerie spots. (Photo: illustration by Patty Massenburg on pinterest)

6 Haunted Places In Saskatchewan, CA, to Explore the Unknown

Saskatchewan, Canada, may be known for its vast prairies and stunning landscapes, but did you know it is also home to some haunted places?

If you're an adrenaline junkie looking to explore the unknown, these six haunted places in Saskatchewan will give you chills. These spots are known for paranormal activity, from ghostly apparitions to mysterious sounds. They will send shivers down your spine.











Haunted Places In Saskatchewan, CA

1. Government House, Regina

Government House in Regina is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former lieutenant governor.

The former governor roams the halls at night. Visitors have reported hearing footsteps and feeling a chill in the air. Some even feel cold on warm summer evenings.

2. Gravelbourg School, Gravelbourg

Gravelbourg School is another spooky spot with a dark history.

Legend has it that the ghost of a former student who tragically passed away in a fire still haunts the building.

Visitors have reported hearing eerie whispers and feeling a sense of unease while exploring the abandoned school. Photo: flickr/dallasbohun

wikipedia

3. St. Paul's Hospital

St. Paul's Hospital in Saskatoon is rumored to be haunted by the ghost of a nun. She once worked there. Staff and visitors have reported strange happenings, such as flickering lights and unexplained footsteps. Some report hearing soft chanting from empty rooms.

wikipedia

4. Prince Albert Arts Centre

The Prince Albert Arts Centre is said to be haunted by the ghost of a young girl who tragically died in a fire at the building many years ago. Visitors have reported seeing her ghostly figure wandering the halls late at night and hearing her laughter echoing through the empty rooms.

flickr/Huy Dang

5. Western Development Museum, Saskatoon

The Western Development Museum in Saskatoon is another haunted location with a reputation for paranormal activity. Visitors have reported seeing ghostly figures wandering the exhibits after hours and hearing unexplained voices echoing through the halls.

Bekevar Church, located near Kipling, is said to be haunted by the spirits of former parishioners who continue to linger in the church. Visitors have reported seeing shadowy figures moving in the pews and hearing whispers in the empty sanctuary.

6. Bekevar Church

Are you a seasoned ghost hunter or just looking for a spooky adventure? These haunted places in Saskatchewan will provide an unforgettable experience.

So, grab a flashlight and some courage, and venture into the unknown. Let's see if you can uncover the mysteries within these eerie spots. Who knows what you might encounter in the darkness of the night.

Happy ghost hunting.

30 Fake Friend Quotes to Avoid Toxic Friendships

These quotes will help you understand the characteristics of fake friendship. (Photo by Dimas Prasetyo on Pinterest)

30 Fake Friend Quotes to Avoid Toxic Friendships

In life, we often encounter those who pretend to be friends but in the end, betray our trust.

Recognizing these fake friends is important for maintaining healthy relationships.

In this article, we have collected 30 insightful fake friend quotes to help you understand the complexities of friendship and avoid toxic relationships.

These quotes will help you understand the characteristics of fake friendship.

They will also guide you to choose true friendships that bring positivity and trust into your life. These fake friend quotes are perfect for someone who has experienced betrayal or just wants to protect themselves from potential harm.

These quotes serve as a reminder to cultivate meaningful relationships built on mutual respect and sincerity.

Take a look at these 30 fake friend quotes below and let them remind you of the importance of genuine friendships in your life.

A. Famous Fake Friend Quotes

1. "Fake friends are with you today and against you tomorrow." — Shizra

2. "Stop texting first and see how many dead plants you've been watering."

3. "Sometimes it's not the person who changes, it's the mask that falls off." — Mhaj Porras

4. "Stop letting people who do so little for you control so much off your mind, feelings, and emotions." — Will Smith

5. "Make sure the lions you roll with aren't snakes in disguise." — Beenereux Philip

6. "False friendship, like ivy, decays and ruins the walls it embraces; but true friendship gives new life and animation to the object it supports." — Richard Burton

7. "Fake friends are like shadows: always near you at your brightest moments, but nowhere to be seen at your darkest hour." — Khalil Gibran

8. "Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down." — Oprah Winfrey

9. "Fake friends are like soap bubbles. They pop out when the sun shines brightly." — Chiranjude Bird

10. "In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends." — Martin Luther King Jr.

B. Fake Friend Quotes to Remind You

1. "A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down." — Arnold H. Glasow

2. "You will never have to question the intentions or integrity of people who have your best interest at heart." – Germany Kent

3. "Be very careful of who you share your problem with, remember that not every friend that smiles at you is your best friend." — Kemmy Nola

4. "A friend who stands with you in pressure is more valuable than a hundred ones who stand with you in pleasure." — Edward G. Bulwer Lytton

5. "You never lose friends. Real ones always stay — no matter what about the fakes, you don't need anyways." — Drishti Bablani

6. "You should be aware of fake friend because it is the hardest to be aware of." — Eraldo Banovac

7. "Some people think that the truth can be hidden away with a little cover-up and decoration. But as time goes by, what is true is revealed, and what is fake fades away." — Ismail Haniyeh

8. "Better an honest enemy than a false friend." — German Proverb

9. "The worst pain in the world goes beyond the physical. Even further beyond any other emotional pain one can feel. It is the betrayal of a friend." — Heather Brewer

10. "Friends ask you questions, enemies question you." — Criss Jami

C. Fake Friend Quotes to Identify the Real One

1. “Fake friends: once they stop talking to you, they start talking about you.” – Anonymous

2. “The saddest thing about betrayal is that it never comes from your enemies.” – Anonymous

3. “I’m so tired of fake friends, drama, liars, being ignored, getting hurt.” – Anonymous

4. “Fake people are like soap bubbles; they pop out when the sun shines brightly.” – Chiranjude Bird

5. “Growing up means realizing a lot of your friends aren’t really your friends.” – Anonymous

6. “Always sleep with one eye open. Never take anything for granted. Your best friends might just be your enemies.” – Sara Shepard

7. “If you want to be my friend, I prefer honesty to fake praise. I was never one to run with the wolves.” – Christina Strigas

8. “When you see the genuine, you don’t deal with the fakes anymore.” – Nima Davani

9. “Fake people are like costume jewelry: They look great for a while, then all of a sudden, their true selves ‘shine’ through.” – Nitya Prakash

10. “You don’t lose friends because real friends can never be lost. You lose people masquerading as friends, and you are better for it.” – Mandy Hale

How to do Cinnamon Girl Makeup, the Makeup That Went Viral on TikTok

TikTok is once again becoming a platform for launching beauty trends that capture the hearts of makeup lovers. Recently, a new makeup trend called Cinnamon Girl Makeup—inspired by a song by Lana Del Rey—has been a hot topic on TikTok.

With warm and earthy tones featuring colors like brown, orange, and copper, this makeup style radiates natural beauty while still looking fresh. It creates a monochromatic look that is perfect for the fall season, so it’s no wonder that many beauty enthusiasts are eager to try this look.

But what exactly is Cinnamon Girl Makeup, how can you achieve it, and what products do you need? Are you curious about how to create this look? Let’s dive into the complete guide!

What is Cinnamon Girl Makeup?

The Cinnamon Girl Look is a makeup trend currently going viral on TikTok. It features warm colors like brown, orange, and copper. Inspired by Lana Del Rey's song "Cinnamon Girl," this look adds an elegant yet cozy touch, making it perfect for fall or chilly weather.

The special thing about the Cinnamon Girl Look is its natural colors, which complement various skin tones. Unlike makeup trends that focus on bold or contrasting colors, this look emphasizes a natural appearance that still catches the eye.

This makes the Cinnamon Girl Look ideal for everyday activities and special events. With a little shimmer on the eyes and lips, it can also be transformed into a bold, captivating makeup style. It's no wonder the Cinnamon Girl Look has become a favorite among many on TikTok.

It is easy to follow and offers great flexibility, allowing individuals to adjust the intensity of colors and textures to their liking. Whether for a casual everyday look or formal makeup, this trend perfectly highlights natural beauty with a modern, warm touch.

How to Get the “Cinnamon Girl Makeup” Look

Skin Preparation

This process ensures that your skin is in the best condition so your makeup applies well, looks natural, and lasts longer. The first step is to clean your face using a cleanser that matches your skin type. After cleansing, use a toner to restore your skin's pH balance. Next, apply a suitable serum, like vitamin C, for brightening or niacinamide to reduce redness.

The next step is to choose a lightweight moisturizer, especially if you have oily skin. A good moisturizer creates a protective layer and prevents your makeup from looking cracked or cakey. Select a sunscreen with at least SPF 30 that doesn’t leave a white cast on your skin. Finally, apply a primer to create a smooth base for your makeup. Choose a primer that suits your skin type and needs.

Choosing a Lightweight Base Makeup

Choosing a lightweight base makeup is an important step to achieve a natural and fresh look, known as the "Cinnamon Girl Makeup." A skin tint with light to medium coverage is a great choice.

This product will give your skin a smooth appearance while keeping its natural texture. It's crucial to ensure the base makeup color matches your skin tone. Opt for products that provide a dewy or satin finish, as these will make your skin look healthy and glowing, which is a key feature of the "Cinnamon Girl Makeup."

Avoid using matte foundation if you have dry skin, as it can make your look appear less fresh. Additionally, use concealer only on areas that need it, such as under the eyes, to hide dark circles or small blemishes on the face.

Soft Eye Look

Use eyeshadow in warm shades like light brown, orange, or peach. Blend the colors well to create a smooth gradient. These colors give a natural and warm effect, which is the hallmark of this style. Use a blending brush that is not too dense to apply the colors, ensuring they blend perfectly with your eyelids.

Avoid thick black eyeliner, as it can make the look too dramatic. Instead, use brown eyeliner to draw a thin line along your upper lash line. If you want to add a bit of dimension, apply a darker eyeshadow, like dark brown, to the outer corners of your eyes and blend it gently. Mascara is also important to complete the eye look. Apply mascara to your upper and lower lashes to create a longer and lifted effect.

Natural Blush

Colors like peach, terracotta, or coral are the best choices because they give a soft and natural look, fitting the "Cinnamon Girl" theme. Avoid bright blush colors like bright red or neon pink.

The way you apply blush is also very important. Blush should be applied on the "apple of the cheeks," which is the part of your cheeks that stands out when you smile. Using a soft blush brush in a circular motion will help create a smooth and even color. For a more modern look, you can blend the blush slightly towards your cheekbones, which gives a lifted effect and makes your face look slimmer and fresher.

Choosing the Right Lip Color

Choose a lip tint or lip cream in reddish-brown or nude shades, as these colors can give a natural yet elegant look. Nude colors like peach or beige-coral are suitable for various occasions, whether during the day or at night. To enhance this nude look, apply lip gloss to make your lips appear fresher.

When selecting a lip color, it's also important to consider your skin tone. For light skin, nude shades with a hint of peach or light brown will create a natural effect. Meanwhile, reddish-brown or terracotta colors can be a great choice for medium to dark skin.

The Perfect Touch of Highlighter

Highlighter gives your face a glowing effect, creating a fresh look without losing a natural vibe. Apply a highlighter on your cheekbones right above your blush area for the best results. Adding a touch of highlighter on the tip of your nose is also important, especially if you want to create the illusion of a slimmer nose.

Choose a highlighter with a lightweight formula and a subtle shimmer so it doesn't look too flashy. The Cinnamon Girl Makeup look offers a fresh, glowing, and elegant appearance with a naturally warm tone.

This trend is a great choice for anyone who wants to look effortlessly charming, whether for daily activities or formal events. It's no wonder this style has become so popular on TikTok and is being tried by many beauty enthusiasts. Give it a try, and good luck!

Sun Quotes: 25 Uplifting Words that Radiate Positivity

These uplifting words will radiate positivity and light into your life. (Photo by Simon Berger on Pexels)

Sun Quotes: 25 Uplifting Words that Radiate Positivity

The sun has always been a symbol of hope, warmth, and positivity. It has a magical way of lifting our spirits and bringing warmth to our lives. In this article, we have gathered a collection of sun quotes that are sure to light up your day and uplift your spirits.

In this article, we have gathered a collection of sun quotes that are sure to light up your day and uplift your spirits.

Sun quotes capture the beauty and power of the sun.

These quotes offer inspiration and motivation.

They are perfect for someone who is looking for a boost of positivity or just loves the sun.

These uplifting words will radiate positivity and light into your life.

Join us as we journey through these 25 sun quotes and see how they can inspire positivity in your day!

A. Famous Sun Quotes

1. “Why should we grope among the dry bones of the past? The sun shines today also.” — Ralph Waldo Emerson

2. “I can feel a sunshine stealing into my soul and making it all summer, and every thorn, a rose.” — Emily Dickinson

3. “Anyone can do his work, however hard, for one day. Anyone can live sweetly, patiently, lovingly, purely, till the sun goes down. And this is all that life really means.” — Dale Carnegie

4. “If you want a place in the sun, you’ve got to put up with a few blisters.” — Abigail Van Buren

5. “But you who walk facing the sun, what images drawn on the earth can hold you?” — Kahlil Gibran

6. “Life is a pure flame, and we live by an invisible Sun within us.” — Thomas Browne

7. “Henceforth I will look upon all things with love and I will be born again. I will love the sun for it warms my bones; yet I will love the rain for it cleanses my spirit.” — Og Mandino

8. “I’ve found that there is always some beauty left — in nature, sunshine, freedom, in yourself; these can all help you.” — Anne Frank

9. “For her everything was red, orange, gold-red from the sun on the closed eyes, and it all was that color, all of it, the filling, the possessing, the having, all of that color, all in a blindness of that color.” — Ernest Hemingway

10. “It is the artist’s business to create sunshine when the sun fails.” — Romain Rolland

11. “Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun’s rays do not burn until brought to a focus.” — Alexander Graham Bell

12. “The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences, and hence there is no greater joy than to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun.” — Christopher McCandless

13. “At rest, however, in the middle of everything is the sun. For, in this most beautiful temple, who would place this lamp in another or better position than that from which it can light up the whole thing at the same time?” — Nicholas Copernicus

14. “Yet would we die as some have done: Beating a way for the rising sun.” — Arna Bontemps

15. "People are made of hate and of love, and more of hate than love. But love, like the sun that it is, sets afire and melts everything.” — José Martí

B. Sun Quotes from Literature

1. "The sun, glorious and majestic, brings forth light and life, dispelling the shadows of darkness." —George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

2. "The morning sun has a lesson to teach us – without judging, love everyone as he does." —Debasish Mridha

3. "The sun shone, having no alternative, on the nothing new." —Samuel Beckett, Murphy

4. "The sun himself is weak when he first rises, and gathers strength and courage as the day gets on." —Charles Dickens, The Old Curiosity Shop

5. "The sun, the bright sun, that brings back, not light alone, but new life, and hope, and freshness to man." —Charles Dickens, Oliver Twist

6. "The sun, with all those planets revolving around it and dependent on it, can still ripen a bunch of grapes as if it had nothing else in the universe to do." —Galileo Galilei

7. "Rest is not idleness, and to lie sometimes on the grass under trees on a summer’s day, listening to the murmur of the water, or watching the clouds float across the sky, is by no means a waste of time." —John Lubbock, The Use of Life

8. "Even after all this time, the sun never says to the earth, 'You owe me.' Look what happens with a love like that, it lights the whole sky." —Hafiz

9. "The sun was warm but the wind was chill. You know how it is with an April day." —Robert Frost, Two Tramps in Mud Time

10. "The sun is new each day." —Heraclitus

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: From the stunning Glacier National Park to the charming Flathead Lake, here are some of the most beautiful places in Montana you should visit.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_keywords: most beautiful places in Montana,places to visit in Montana

Top 7 Most Beautiful Places in Montana: Magical Places to Visit in the Big Sky Country

Montana is known for its stunning landscapes and natural beauty. It has many mountains, lakes, and parks that attract visitors. The most beautiful places in Montana offer breathtaking views and adventures for everyone. From the towering peaks of Glacier National Park to the serene waters of Flathead Lake, Montana is a place where nature shines.

In this article, we will explore some of the most beautiful places in Montana that you should visit. Each location has its own charm and unique features that make it special.

1. Glacier National Park

Glacier National Park is one of the most famous parks in Montana. It has beautiful mountains, deep valleys, and many hiking trails. Visitors can see stunning lakes like Lake McDonald and enjoy wildlife such as bears and mountain goats. The park is perfect for hiking, camping, and taking photos of the amazing scenery. With over 700 miles of trails, there is something for everyone, from easy walks to challenging hikes.

2. Yellowstone National Park

Yellowstone National Park is mostly in Wyoming but has a part in Montana. It is famous for its hot springs, geysers, and colorful pools. Old Faithful is a well-known geyser that erupts regularly, attracting many visitors. The park also has many animals like bison, elk, and wolves. Visitors can enjoy hiking along scenic trails or taking guided tours to learn more about the park's unique geothermal features.

3. Big Sky

Big Sky is a popular destination for skiing and snowboarding in winter. In summer, it transforms into a place for hiking and mountain biking with stunning views of the surrounding mountains. The area has many outdoor activities, including zip-lining and horseback riding. After a day of adventure, visitors can relax in charming shops and restaurants that offer delicious local cuisine and cozy atmospheres.

4. Flathead Lake

Flathead Lake is the largest natural lake in Montana and is known for its clear blue waters surrounded by mountains. People come here to swim, fish, and boat during the summer months. The lake is also great for kayaking and paddleboarding. The sunsets over the lake are breathtaking, making it a perfect spot for picnics or relaxing with family and friends while enjoying nature's beauty.

5. American Prairie Reserve

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by American Prairie (@americanprairie)


The American Prairie Reserve is a unique area that aims to create a large wildlife reserve in Montana. It features wide-open spaces where visitors can see bison roaming freely across the prairie landscape. This area offers opportunities for hiking, birdwatching, and enjoying the peaceful environment away from city life. It's an excellent place for nature lovers who want to experience Montana's wild beauty firsthand.

6. Whitefish

Whitefish is a charming town located near Glacier National Park. It has beautiful lakes and mountains nearby, making it great for outdoor activities year-round. In winter, people come here to ski at Whitefish Mountain Resort, which offers fantastic slopes for all skill levels. In summer, visitors can enjoy hiking trails, fishing spots, and relaxing by Whitefish Lake while exploring local shops and restaurants that add to its quaint charm.

7. West Yellowstone

West Yellowstone is a small town located at the entrance of Yellowstone National Park. It serves as a gateway for visitors exploring the park's wonders like geysers and hot springs. The town has many shops and restaurants where tourists can find souvenirs or enjoy meals after their adventures. Additionally, there are museums that showcase local history and wildlife, making it an excellent base for exploring Yellowstone's stunning landscapes.

5 Traditional Food Gems of Naples, Italy

Naples is a city in the southern part of Italy. It's the capital city of Campania region. Naples is one of the biggest cities in Italy. It's known for its rich culinary heritage. Many famous Italian dishes originated in Naples, making it a very important part of Italian culinary heritage. (Photo by shaian ramesht on Unsplash)

5 Traditional Food Gems of Naples, Italy

Naples is a beautiful historic city located in the southern part of Italy. Known as Napoli in Italian, the city is famous for its culinary culture. There are many tasty Italian dishes originated in Naples, from the world-famous Neapolitan Pizza to the tasty sfogliatella. That's why Naples is a paradise for foodies, especially for Italian food fans.

In this article, we will take a look at some of the best and most popular traditional dishes from Naples, according to various sources, Tuesday (18/7/2023). Get ready to uncover some tasty, mouthwatering dishes that will make your taste buds dance with joy!

1. Neapolitan Pizza

The world-famous Neapolitan pizza originated in Naples, Italy. The thin-crust pizza is topped with San Marzano tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella cheese, basil, and olive oil. The pizza is traditionally cooked in a wood-fired oven. The result is a slightly charred, soft, and chewy crust. (Photo by Miha Rekar on Unsplash)

2. Sfogliatella

Sfogliatella is a classic pastry dish from Naples. The pastry is shaped like a shell. It's filled with sweetened ricotta cheese, semolina, cinnamon, eggs, sugar, and candied citrus peel. (Image by Davide M from Pixabay)

There are two versions of Sfogliatella in Naples. The first one is Riccia, which features a flaky, layered pastry shell that is shaped into a shell-like form. The second one is the Frolla, which features a smooth, short-crust pastry shell. (Photo by Alpha on Flickr/CC BY-SA 2.0)

Pastiera is a classic dessert from Naples. It's a sweet pie-like treat made with cooked wheat grains, ricotta cheese, sugar, eggs, and candied citrus peel. The filling of pastiera is poured into a pastry crust, baked until golden, and often dusted with powdered sugar. Pastiera is known for its creamy texture, nutty flavor from the wheat grains, and delightful citrus aroma. (Photo by Betty Subrizi on Unsplash)

3. Pastiera

4. Buffalo Mozzarella

Mozzarella di bufala, or buffalo mozzarella, is a special cheese from the Campania region of Italy. The cheese is made from the milk of Italian Mediterranean buffalo. The cheese is only made in the Campania region, including Naples, to guarantee its quality and originality. (Photo from Popo le Chien on Wikimedia/CC BY-SA 3.0)

5. Calzone Pizza

Calzone Pizza is a unique pizza from Naples, dating back to the 18th century. Instead of round pizza, the calzone pizza has a half-round shape, which is made by folding the pizza in half. (Image by Muhammad Usman from Pixabay)

The calzone pizza is filled with salami or ham and cheese, such as ricotta, pecorino, or mozzarella. According to Taste Atlas, the calzone pizza is designed to be eaten while walking or standing. (Image by Sally Meza from Pixabay)

Black Dog Completely Turns White After Two Years Being Diagnosed with Vitiligo

This happens due to an immune problem.

Black Dog Completely Turns White After Two Years Being Diagnosed with Vitiligo

Over two years, the black dog's fur turned completely white due to vitiligo, a condition in which the skin and hair lose color. 

In late 2021, two-year-old Buster was diagnosed with vitiligo. 

This happens due to an immune problem that causes some skin, hair, muzzle, and lips to lose color. 

Buster's owner, Matt Smith, was told to be on the lookout for skin problems. 

However, Buster's health is fine. 

Source: Oddity Central

At first, Matt noticed small white spots around Buster's eyes, nose, and chin. But after nine months, white spots covered Buster's face.

Now, Buster has changed from all-black to all-white. 

Matt first shared Buster's story on Reddit several years ago. He shows how Buster's face changed in nine months due to vitiligo.

Some Reddit comments were shocked and said they wouldn't have believed it without seeing the transition.

Buster looks like a different dog before and after, except for his eyes. 

Luckily, the vitiligo didn't make Buster sick.

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: 6 Amazing Facts About Katana Sword; it is not Samurai!
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
6 Amazing Facts About Katana Sword

6 Amazing Facts About Katana Sword

Katana swords, often called the "soul of the samurai," have a fascinating story. There are less-known facts about the Katana that make it even more intriguing. Let's explore these simple yet rich facts about the Katana sword.

Swipe Up to Learn More!

Often Confused With 'Samurai'

Katana, the famous Japanese sword, is sometimes thought to mean the warrior using it—the Samurai. It's significant to know that Katana is the name of the sword, not the warrior.

Making It Was Considered Religious Ceremony

Long ago, making a Katana was not just a skill; it was a special process. Those who made swords were seen as highly important. Before starting, they did religious rituals, like fasting and praying, making the creation of a Katana a spiritual activity.

Katana Polisher

Making a Katana a real work of art needs a skilled polisher. It's like a composer needing a musician. The true quality of a blade shows up after careful polishing, a process that takes years to learn. This makes Katana polisher seen as an important figure as well.

It Wasn't That Important?

Despite being famous, the Katana wasn't the main weapon for Samurai in battles. At first, they used bows and arrows. Even when they started using swords, longer weapons like spears were more favored. Guns later became more effective, changing how battles worked.

Tameshigiri

In the past, Katana blades went through tough tests called 'Tameshigiri'. Skilled swordsmen tested the blade's quality by cutting through bodies, usually the executed or captured criminals, either dead or alive. The results were written on the sword, showing how good it was.

It is a Dying Art

Making Japanese swords, like Katanas, is becoming less common. Strict rules, limited numbers allowed, and a long time to learn the craft make it hard for sword makers. This traditional art might disappear in the future.

30 Mother and Son Quotes: Expressing Love and Gratitude Through Words

30 Mother and Son Quotes: Expressing Love and Gratitude Through Words

The bond between a mother and her son is truly remarkable. It's a relationship built on love, trust, and endless support.

Mothers have always been there for their sons. Therefore, people write mother and son quotes to capture the essence of this relationship.

Our collection of mother and son quotes is perfect for a card, Instagram post, or simply showing mom you care. Check out the following mother and son quotes!







Mother and Son Quotes

xavier-mouton-photographie-unsplash

Mother and Son Quotes that Capture the Mother’s Love

  • “She loved a boy very, very much — even more than she loved herself.” — Shel Silverstein

  • "Whatever else is unsure in this stinking dunghill of a world a mother’s love is not." — James Joyce

  • “As a son I would say this, she was the best mum in the world. She smothered us with love, that’s for sure.” — Prince Harry

  • “My mother was the most beautiful woman I ever saw. All I am I owe to my mother. I attribute my success in life to the moral, intellectual and physical education I received from her.” — George Washington

  • “Moms are as relentless as the tides. They don’t just drive us to practice; they drive us to greatness." — Steve Rushin
  • “When you look into your mother’s eyes, you know that is the purest love you can find on this earth.” — Mitch Albom

  • “My mother had a slender, small body, but a large heart — a heart so large that everybody’s joys found welcome in it, and hospitable accommodation.” — Mark Twain

  • “If I have done anything in life worth attention, I feel sure that I inherited the disposition from my mother.” — Booker T. Washington

  • "My mother is my root, my foundation. She planted the seed that I base my life on, and that is the belief that the ability to achieve starts in your mind.” — Michael Jordan

  • “Her love for her family and her faith in God somehow gave her the strength, not only to go on but to love life without bitterness and instill in all of us a gratitude for every day we have together.” — Stephen Colbert
  • “A mother is a son’s first true love. A son, especially that first son, is a mother’s last true love.” — Denzel Washington

How Long to Boil Green Beans to Make Them Soft Use 3 Methods

Green beans, with their rich color and crisp texture. Green beans are an adaptable and nutritious addition to any meal.

How Long to Boil Green Beans to Make Them Soft Use 3 Methods

Are you preparing a hearty side dish or aiming for a flavorful piece of your entrée?

The art to know of how long to boil green beans to achieve that perfect softness is an essential skill. In this guide, we'll look at three specific methods. These are complete with detailed recipes. Knowing how long to boil green beans will help you master cooking to tender delight.

Let's check out some methods on how long to boil green beans, as compiled from numerous sources, on Wednesday (16/08/2023).

pexels-pixabay

Tips on How to Boil Green Beans

Follow these tips and experiment with different methods. You'll be well on your way to boiling green beans to the perfect softness. Make sure they become a delightful addition to your meals. Here are some tips to help you boil green beans to fulfill that wanted softness:

• Choose Fresh Green Beans: Select fresh, high-quality green beans with rich color and no signs of loss or marks. Fresh beans will cook more evenly and pay better results.

• Rinse and Trim: Wash the green beans under cold water and trim the ends. If desired, remove any hard strings from the sides.

• Use the Right Pot: A large pot ensures the beans have enough space to cook evenly without overcrowding. Overcrowding can lead to uneven cooking and result in some beans being overcooked or others being undercooked.

• Boiling Water: Start with a pot of boiling water. Adding the beans to boiling water helps them cook more evenly and keep their color.

• Salt the Water: Add a pinch of salt to the boiling water before adding the beans. This will enrich the flavor of the beans but also helps keep their color.

• Cooking Time: The cooking time depends on the thickness of the beans. Thin beans may take around 4 to 5 minutes. While thicker beans might need 6 to 8 minutes. Check the beans for doneness by tasting one during the cooking process.

• Keep Texture: Aim for tender beans with a slight bite (al dente) to complete the perfect softness. Overcooking can lead to mushy beans.

• Ice Water Bath: After boiling, transfer the beans directly to a bowl of ice water to end the cooking process. This helps preserve their rich green color and stops them from becoming overcooked.
istockphoto-

• Seasoning: Season the boiled beans with salt or other selected seasonings while still warm. This allows the flavors to infiltrate the beans.

• Flavor Increase: Experiment with adding flavor to the boiling water. To boost their taste, you can infuse the beans with garlic, lemon zest, herbs, or other aromatics.

• Quick Serve: Serve the boiled green beans promptly. They are best enjoyed when they're fresh and still warm.

• Avoid Boiling Too Long: While boiling is an excellent method, be careful not to cook the beans for an extended period. This can result in loss of nutrients and flavor. Aim to get softness within the recommended cooking time.

• Consider Steaming: If you prefer a gentler cooking method that helps keep more nutrients. Consider steaming the green beans instead of boiling them. This can also help keep their color.

• Customize Doneness: Remember that personal choice varies. Modify the cooking time to achieve the level of softness you like. istockphoto-

Method 1: Classic Simmer

Ingredients:

• 1 pound fresh green beans

• Water

• Salt, to taste

• Ice water (for blanching)

Instructions:

1. Start by thoroughly rinsing the green beans in cold water and snapping off the ends.

2. Fill a large pot with water, allowing enough room for the beans to cook without crowding.

3. Bring the water to a rolling boil and add a generous pinch of salt.

4. Add the green beans to the boiling water and let them cook for approximately 4 to 6 minutes, depending on their thickness. The beans should become tender yet still retain a slight bite.

5. While cooking beans, prepare a bowl of iced water.

6. Once the beans are cooked to your desired level of tenderness, quickly remove them from the boiling water using a slotted spoon and transfer them immediately to the ice water. This step helps preserve their vibrant color and stops the cooking process.

7. Drain the green beans and pat them dry with a clean towel in the ice water after a minute or two.

8. Season with additional salt if needed and serve promptly.

Method 2: Quick Steam-Boil

Ingredients:

• 1 pound fresh green beans

• Water

• Salt, to taste

Instructions:

1. Rinse and trim the green beans as before.

2. In a medium-sized pot, add just enough water to cover the bottom (about 1/2 inch deep).

3. Place a steaming basket or colander in the pot, ensuring it doesn't touch the water.

4. Arrange the green beans in the steaming basket and season with a pinch of salt.

5. Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat.

6. Once the water is boiling, reduce the heat to medium and steam the green beans for approximately 5 to 7 minutes. They should be soft enough to pierce with a fork easily.

7. Remove the beans from the pot and season with additional salt if desired. Serve immediately.

Photo: louis-hansel-unsplash

Method 3: Flavor-Infused Boil

Ingredients:

• 1 pound fresh green beans

• Water

• Salt, to taste

• Optional flavorings: garlic cloves, lemon zest, red pepper flakes

Photo: pixabay/erdemates

Instructions:

1. Prepare the green beans by rinsing and trimming them.

2. Fill a large pot with water and bring it to a boil.

3. Add a pinch of salt to the boiling water and any optional flavorings, such as a couple of crushed garlic cloves, a strip of lemon zest, or a bit of red pepper flakes.

4. Toss in the green beans and cook for approximately 4 to 6 minutes, ensuring they become tender but not overly soft.

5. Drain the beans and remove any added flavorings.

6. Season with additional salt if necessary and serve promptly to enjoy the infused flavors.

How Long to Boil Green Beans

How Long to Boil Green Beans

Master the art of boiling green beans to fulfill that perfect softness. It is a delightful journey that offers endless culinary possibilities. Are you opt for the classic simmer, the quick steam-boil, or the flavor-infused system? Your green beans will rise soft, rich, and ready to grace your table with their nutritious charm. Experiment with these methods on how long to boil green beans, enjoy the process and upgrade your cooking skill to new heights. Bon appétit!

RCB: The Owner and Brief History of the IPL Winning Team

Good news for cricket fans! Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) finally clinched their first Indian Premier League (IPL) title on June 3, 2025.

After 18 years of waiting, Bengaluru's favorite team defeated Punjab Kings (PBKS) by 6 runs at the Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad.

𝐂𝐇𝐀𝐌𝐏𝐈𝐎𝐍𝐒 ⭐️ RCB PLAYED BOLD! 😇

17 Years, 6256 Days, 90,08,640 Minutes later, the wait finally ends. 🙌🤯

The IPL Trophy is finally coming home. And we CANT KEEP CALM! 🤩😍❤️ pic.twitter.com/lQvtLff9o2

— Royal Challengers Bengaluru (@RCBTweets) June 3, 2025

RCB's Ownerhip and History

RCB is owned by United Spirits Limited, a subsidiary of British beverage company Diageo.

The franchise was originally founded in 2008 by Vijay Mallya, who purchased the team for $111.6 million during the inaugural IPL franchise auction.

Following the team's victory, Mallya expressed his joy on social media, reminiscing about signing a young Virat Kohli and celebrating the fulfillment of a long-held dream.

RCB, founded in 2008 by United Spirits, has been a part of the IPL since its inception.

Despite being runners-up three times (2009, 2011, and 2016) and reaching the playoffs many times, the title has always been an unrealized dream.

However, the 2025 season bears witness to the team's struggles and hard work.

A Thrilling Final

In the 2025 season, RCB made it to the finals after beating Gujarat Lions in the qualifiers.

In the summit clash, they faced Punjab Kings in a tightly contested match.

RCB's victory was achieved thanks to the brilliant performances of the bowlers, especially Krunal Pandya and Bhuvneshwar Kumar.

Although Virat Kohli didn't top score, his contribution was still very important to the team.

PBKS' Shashank Singh was outstanding scoring 61 runs, but his efforts were not enough to beat RCB.

The victory was greeted with joy by RCB fans who had been waiting for this historic moment for a long time. 

The RCB team is currently led by captain Rajat Patidar and coached by Andy Flower.

Apart from Virat Kohli, other key players include Krunal Pandya, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, and Josh Hazlewood.

RCB is known to have a rivalry with Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR), one of the oldest rivalries in the IPL.

Mike Tyson vs Jake Paul Boxing Match Is Considered As Professional Fight

The match result will affect their professional records.

Mike Tyson vs Jake Paul Boxing Match Is Considered As Professional Fight

The professional match will be recorded in official boxing record.

As reported by NBC News, Mike Tyson vs. Jake Paul boxing match on July 20 will be considered professional fight.

This was said by the Texas Department of Licensing and Regulations, which is also the promoters on Monday.

The result will affect their professional records.

This was also said by Most Valuable Promotions co-founder Nakisa Bidarian in a statement.

“Mike Tyson and Jake Paul signed on to fight each other with the desire to do so in a sanctioned professional fight that would have a definitive outcome."

“Over the past six weeks MVP has worked with its partners to satisfy the requirements of the Texas Department of Licensing and Regulations (TDLR) to sanction Paul vs. Tyson and we are grateful that we have gotten to this point.”

Nakisa Bidarian said in a statement.

The heavyweight match will be shown live on Netflix from AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas.

The professional fight will take place over eight, two-minute rounds using 14-ounce gloves.

Mike Tyson will be 58 by the time he enters the ring, making him 31 years older than the 27-year-old Pau and will be the biggest gap in boxing history.

8 Mobile Games Like Subway Surfers You Should Try

If you're a fan of the popular endless running game Subway Surfers, you'll be glad to know that there are plenty of other similar games out there that you can try.

Temple Run is a classic endless running game that has been around for years. In this game, you play as an explorer who has stolen an idol from a temple and is now being chased by demonic monkeys. Your goal is to run as fast as you can while avoiding obstacles and collecting coins along the way.

With simple one-touch controls and a variety of power-ups to help you along the way, Jetpack Joyride is a game that you'll want to play over and over again.

5 Recommended Movies For Your Heart Break Moments

Eat Pray Love (2010)

Based on Elizabeth Gilbert’s bestselling memoir, this movie stars Julia Roberts as a woman embarking on a journey of self-discovery after a painful divorce.

Traveling through Italy, India, and Bali, she learns to savor life’s pleasures, embrace spirituality, and find inner peace.

Eat Pray Love is a beautiful reminder that heartbreak can be the starting point for profound personal growth and a renewed sense of purpose.

La La Land (2016)

This modern musical starring Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone tells the story of two ambitious dreamers who fall in love while pursuing their individual aspirations.

While their romance is passionate and inspiring, the film explores the bittersweet reality of love and life choices.

With stunning cinematography and a soul-stirring soundtrack, La La Land beautifully captures the idea that some relationships, though fleeting, leave a lasting impact on our lives.

Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind (2004)

A cult classic starring Jim Carrey and Kate Winslet, this film explores the idea of erasing memories of a failed relationship.

As the protagonist undergoes the procedure, he realizes the value of both the good and bad moments shared with his former partner.

The film is a bittersweet exploration of love, loss, and the power of memory.

500 Days of Summer (2009)

This unconventional romantic comedy-drama follows the non-linear relationship between Tom (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) and Summer (Zooey Deschanel).

The film offers a raw and realistic portrayal of unrequited love and the complexities of modern relationships.

With its creative storytelling and relatable moments, 500 Days of Summer provides solace by showing that heartbreak is a universal experience and a stepping stone to self-discovery.

Blue Valentine (2010)

Starring Ryan Gosling and Michelle Williams, this raw and emotional film captures the rise and fall of a marriage.

Through interwoven timelines, it portrays the intensity of falling in love and the painful unraveling of a relationship.

Its honesty about love’s complexities makes it relatable for anyone navigating heartbreak.

7 Pet Snakes For Beginners That Easy to Care for

Let's dive in and discover which snake might be the right fit for you!


Pet Snakes For Beginners

Corn snakes are popular among beginner snake owners due to their docile nature and easy care requirements. They are great for handling and come in various colors and patterns. (Photo by Johan Sjögren on Unsplash)

2. Ball Python:

wikipedia
