-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.title: How to Burp a Baby and Why You Should Do It
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: Learn how to burp a baby correctly with 3 simple methods, why you need to do it, and when.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_keywords: how to burp a baby,why you need to burp a baby,when you need to burp a baby,burping a baby
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
How to Burp a Baby and Why You Should Do It

Have you ever wondered why your baby seems uncomfortable after eating or starts crying for no clear reason? Learning how to burp a baby is one of the most important skills every new parent needs to know. This simple action can make the difference between a happy, content baby and a fussy, uncomfortable one.

Many new parents feel worried when their baby cries after feeding time. The good news is that most of the time, trapped air in the baby's stomach causes this discomfort. When babies eat, they often swallow air along with milk, which can make them feel bloated and upset.

In this article, we will talk about how to burp a baby with three methods and why you should do it. We will also talk about when to burp your baby and what you should do when it doesn't work out. We gathered the guide from various sources, Monday (27/6/2025).

How to Burp a Baby

There are three main ways to burp a baby that work well for most parents. Each method is safe and effective, so you can try all of them to see which one your baby likes best.

1. Over-the-Shoulder Position: Hold your baby upright against your chest with their chin resting on your shoulder. Support your baby's head and neck with one hand while gently patting or rubbing their back with your other hand. Cup your hand slightly when patting because this feels more comfortable for your baby than using a flat palm. You can also try walking around slowly while doing this, as the gentle movement often helps babies release trapped air.

2. Sitting on Your Lap: Face your baby away from you and place one hand flat against their chest to support them. Make sure you support their chin and jaw area, but never put pressure on their throat. Lean your baby forward just a little bit and use your free hand to gently pat or rub their back. This position works well because it puts gentle pressure on the baby's stomach.

3. Across Your Lap Face Down: Support your baby's chin with one hand while making sure their head stays higher than their chest. Use your other hand to gently pat or rub their back. This position can be very effective because gravity helps the air bubbles move up and out of the stomach.

Remember to always keep a cloth or burp cloth nearby when you try any of these positions. Babies often bring up a small amount of milk when they burp, and this is completely normal. The cloth will protect your clothes and make cleanup easier.

You don't need to spend a long time trying to get a burp. Usually, two to three minutes of gentle patting should be enough. If your baby doesn't burp right away, you can try changing positions or take a short break before trying again.

Why You Need to Burp a Baby

Why do babies need to be burped? When babies drink milk from a bottle or breast, they naturally swallow some air along with the milk. This air gets trapped in their stomach and creates uncomfortable gas bubbles.

These trapped air bubbles can cause several problems for your baby. First, they make your baby feel full even when they haven't eaten enough milk. This can lead to poor feeding and slow weight gain. Second, the gas bubbles cause stomach pain and discomfort, which makes babies cry and become fussy.

Burping helps release these air bubbles before they cause problems. When you burp your baby properly, you help them feel more comfortable and relaxed after eating. This also helps prevent spitting up, which happens when trapped air pushes milk back up through the baby's mouth.

Babies who are not burped regularly may become uncomfortable and fussy. The trapped gas can make babies cry and feel upset after eating. Regular burping prevents most of these issues and helps your baby feel better after meals.

Some babies swallow more air than others, especially if they eat very quickly. This is why some babies need more frequent burping than others.

When You Need to Burp a Baby

When is the right time to burp your baby? Timing is just as important as knowing how to do it properly. There are no strict rules about timing, but there are clear signs that tell you when your baby needs help releasing trapped air.

The most obvious time to burp your baby is when they show signs of discomfort during or after feeding. Look for signs like crying, arching their back, pulling their legs up toward their stomach, or clenching their fists. These behaviors usually mean your baby has trapped gas that needs to come out.

For bottle-fed babies, try burping every two to three ounces of milk. This means stopping the feeding session, burping your baby, and then continuing with the bottle. If your baby tends to be gassy, spits a lot, or seems fussy during feeding, you might need to burp them every ounce of milk they drink.

For breastfed babies, burp them each time you switch from one breast to the other. If your baby tends to be gassy, spits a lot, or seems fussy during feeding, try burping every five minutes during breastfeeding.

Always burp your baby at the end of every feeding session, even if they seem comfortable. This final burp helps make sure all trapped air comes out before you put your baby down to sleep. After burping, keep your baby upright for 10 to 15 minutes to help prevent spitting up.

Some babies wake up from sleep because of gas pain. If your baby wakes up crying and seems uncomfortable, try picking them up and burping them. This often helps them go back to sleep more easily.

What to Do if It Doesn't Work

Sometimes normal burping techniques don't work, and your baby continues to show signs of trapped gas. When this happens, there are other methods you can try to help your baby feel better.

If your baby won't burp after trying the three main positions, lay them on their back and gently massage their stomach. You can also try moving your baby's legs back and forth like they are riding a bicycle. This movement helps release trapped gas.

If your baby continues to have gas problems despite trying these methods, talk to your pediatrician or health visitor. They can check if there are any underlying issues causing the excessive gas.

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
This Is Why Oarfish Rises To The Surface According To Experts

This Is Why Oarfish Rises To The Surface According To Experts

Divers have made a stunning find in the waters off Taiwan's northeastern coast: an enormous deep-sea oarfish.

Video taken in late June 2023 shows an oarfish over six feet long.

Oarfish is a species that lives in the deep sea. Their home is in the mesopelagic zone 200 to 1,000 meters below sea level, so they are rarely seen.

But somehow, the fish ended up in the zone being explored by divers, far from home where it lives.

It is known that oarfish rarely come to the surface of the sea. The cause of the oarfish rising to the surface is said to be possible only when it is dying or has lost its way.

Occasionally washes up on beaches around their range (all seas are tropical to warm).

Most oarfish found near the surface or near shore do not survive.

The emergence of oarfish almost to the surface is often considered a bad sign. Many believe that this deep-sea dweller is a sign of an imminent earthquake.

However, experts claim that this earthquake anticipation theory is actually unfounded.

"There is no scientific evidence of the link, so I don't think one should be concerned," said Hiroyuki Motomura, a professor of ichthyology at Kagoshima University.

"I believe these fish tend to surface when their physical condition is bad, rising above the water currents, which is why they often die when found," added Hiroyuki Motomura.

The body of the oarfish has no scales.

Oarfish is said to be able to reach a length longer than a school bus. Although not too many that big.

This fish has a bright silver color and long red fins. Some people worldwide know it as a ribbonfish (fish ribbon).

The first few elements of the back fin are long and thin, resembling a crown, and give rise to another common name for this species, King of Herrings.

Oarfish have very large eyes, which they use to see in very low light conditions in the deep open ocean, their habitat.

However, the oarfish is quite harmless. They have very small, toothless mouths. They feed by filtering small prey from the water.

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: Feel the time go so slow and wondering how to make time go faster? Here are 14 helpful tips to try.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_keywords: how to make time go faster,time,time management,productivity
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
How to Make Time Go Faster: 14 Useful Tips

We all know that feeling when time moves like a snail. You look at the clock during a boring meeting and only five minutes have passed since you last checked. Learning how to make time go faster can help you get through these difficult moments more easily.

Sometimes an hour feels like a whole day, while other times a full weekend disappears in what seems like minutes. This happens to everyone, whether you are waiting for your lunch break, sitting in traffic, or counting down to an important event.

If you feel like your time passes so slowly and wondering how to make time go faster, you have come to the right place. In this article, we will share some helpful tips to help you speed up the time. We gathered these tips from various sources, Firday (27/6/2025).

Why You Feel Time Goes Slow

So, what makes us feel that time goes too slow? Here are the main reasons that make minutes feel like hours.

- You Keep Looking at the Clock: When you check the time every few minutes, it makes time feel much slower. Your brain focuses on waiting instead of doing something useful. This is like watching water boil - the more you stare, the longer it takes.

- You Are Not Busy Enough: Empty time always feels longer than busy time. When you have nothing interesting to do, your mind starts thinking about how bored you are. This makes every minute feel like it takes forever to pass.

- You Feel Stressed or Worried: Anxiety makes time crawl because your brain keeps thinking about future problems. When you worry about something that will happen later, you become very aware of each passing minute.

- Everything Feels the Same: Doing the same boring tasks over and over makes time drag. Your brain stops paying attention to new things, so nothing feels exciting or different enough to make time move faster.

- You Are in an Uncomfortable Place: Being somewhere you do not want to be makes time feel endless. Whether you are stuck in a long line or sitting through a dull presentation, discomfort makes every second feel longer.

- You Are Waiting for Something: Anticipation is one of the biggest time killers. When you are excited about something that will happen later, waiting becomes painful and time seems to stop completely.

How to Make Time Go Faster

Now that you know why time feels slow, here are proven ways to make it speed up. These simple tricks can work in almost any situation.

- Stop Watching the Clock: Put your phone away and avoid looking at clocks or watches. Cover the time display on your computer with tape if needed. When you stop focusing on time, it passes much more quickly without you noticing.

- Break Your Day into Small Parts: Divide long periods into shorter blocks with different activities. Instead of thinking about eight hours of work, think about four two-hour sessions. Complete one block, then move to the next one.

- Do Something You Actually Enjoy: Find activities that make you happy and engaged. When you do things you love, time flies because your mind focuses on the fun instead of the waiting. Even small enjoyable tasks can make a big difference.

- Learn a New Skill: Use slow time to study something interesting. Download a language app, watch educational videos, or read about topics you care about. Learning keeps your brain busy and makes time pass quickly.

- Listen to Music or Podcasts: Put on background sound that you enjoy. Music and interesting podcasts give your mind something to focus on besides the clock. Choose content that matches your energy level and situation.

- Move Your Body: Physical activity makes time speed up because movement keeps your mind engaged. Take a walk, do stretching exercises, or clean your workspace. Even small movements help time pass faster.

- Talk to Other People: Social interaction is one of the best ways to make time fly. Call a friend, chat with coworkers, or join online conversations. Connecting with others takes your mind off waiting and makes any situation more enjoyable.

- Challenge Your Brain: Solve puzzles, play games, or do mental exercises that require thinking. When your brain works hard on interesting problems, you forget about time completely. Choose challenges that match your skill level.

- Create a Regular Schedule: Having a routine helps time feel more predictable and manageable. When you know what comes next, there are fewer empty moments where time can drag. Build habits that give structure to your day.

- Focus Completely on One Task: Enter a "flow state" by concentrating fully on a single activity. Choose something that challenges you but is not too difficult. When you are completely absorbed in work, hours can pass without you realizing it.

- Change Your Environment: Move to a different location if possible. Go to another room, step outside, or rearrange your workspace. New surroundings stimulate your brain and make time feel like it is moving faster.

- Help Someone Else: Volunteer to assist others with their tasks or problems. Helping people keeps you busy and gives you a sense of purpose. Time passes quickly when you focus on making someone else's day better.

- Set Small Goals: Create mini-deadlines throughout your day and reward yourself when you reach them. Having frequent achievements makes time feel productive instead of wasted. Celebrate each small victory to stay motivated.

- Practice Deep Breathing: When you feel anxious about time, take slow, deep breaths to calm your mind. Stress makes time feel slower, so relaxation techniques can help normalize your time perception and reduce frustration.

40 Inspirational Desmond Tutu Quotes About Justice, Peace, And Love

40 Inspirational Desmond Tutu Quotes About Justice, Peace, And Love

Desmond Tutu, a South African Anglican archbishop and social rights activist, is known for his powerful and inspiring words.

Throughout his life, Tutu has been a leading voice in the struggle against apartheid in South Africa and a staunch advocate for human rights and justice around the world.

Desmond Tutu quotes have resonated with people from all walks of life, inspiring them to stand up for what is right and to show compassion and understanding to others.

Inspirational Desmond Tutu Quotes

In this article, we will celebrate his legacy by selecting some of the most powerful and inspiring Desmond Tutu quotes from various sources, Tuesday (28/11/2023). Whether you are familiar with his work or are just discovering it for the first time, Tutu's quotes are sure to leave a lasting impression on your heart and mind.

A. Desmond Tutu Quotes About Justice

1. "Stability and peace in our land will not come from the barrel of a gun, because peace without justice is an impossibility." - Desmond Tutu

2. "To take a life when a life has been lost is revenge, not justice." - Desmond Tutu

3. "That's the chief lesson I have learned: the texture of our universe is one where there is no question at all but that good and laughter and justice will prevail." - Desmond Tutu

4. "Restorative justice says "No, the offense affected a relationship" and what you are seeking for is to restore the relationship, to heal the relationship." - Desmond Tutu

5. "Retributive justice is one that says clobber him or clobber her because they clobbered me. So it emphasizes punishment." - Desmond Tutu

6. "True peace must be anchored in justice and an unwavering commitment to universal rights for all humans, regardless of ethnicity, religion, gender, national origin or any other identity attribute." - Desmond Tutu

7. "Exclusion is never the way forward on our shared paths to freedom and justice." - Desmond Tutu

8. "We don't want apartheid liberalized. We want it dismantled. You can't improve something that is intrinsically evil." - Desmond Tutu

9. "Making the truth public is a form of justice. This is a moral universe and you've got to take account of the fact that truth and lies and goodness and evil are things that matter." - Desmond Tutu

10. "There are different kinds of justice. Retributive justice is largely Western. The African understanding is far more restorative - not so much to punish as to redress or restore a balance that has been knocked askew." - Desmond Tutu

B. Inspirational Desmond Tutu Quotes

1. "Do your little bit of good where you are; its those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world." - Desmond Tutu

2. "If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor. If an elephant has its foot on the tail of a mouse and you say that you are neutral, the mouse will not appreciate your neutrality." - Desmond Tutu

3. "If you want peace, you don't talk to your friends. You talk to your enemies." - Desmond Tutu

4. "Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness." - Desmond Tutu

5. "There comes a point where we need to stop just pulling people out of the river. We need to go upstream and find out why they're falling in." - Desmond Tutu

6. "I can't control what happens to me, but I can control how I respond to it." - Desmond Tutu

7. "Our maturity will be judged by how well we are able to agree to disagree and yet continue to love one another, to care for one another, and cherish one another and seek the greater good of the other." - Desmond Tutu

8. "My father always used to say, 'Don't raise your voice. Improve your argument.'" - Desmond Tutu

9. "To forgive is to abandon your right to pay back the predator in his own coin, but it is the loss that Liberates."

- Desmond Tutu

10. "We are each made for goodness, love and compassion. Our lives are transformed as much as the world is when we live with these truths." - Desmond Tutu

11. "It is through weakness and vulnerability that most of us learn empathy and compassion and discover our soul." - Desmond Tutu

12. "Without memory, there is no healing. Without forgiveness, there is no future." - Desmond Tutu

13. "You don't choose your family. They are God's gift to you, as you are to them." - Desmond Tutu

14. "It means a great deal to those who are oppressed to know that they are not alone. And never let anyone tell you that what you are doing is insignificant." - Desmond Tutu

15. "If we have loved well while we were alive, there is life after death here-our love will go on for generations." - Desmond Tutu

C. Wise And Meaningful Desmond Tutu Quotes

1. "Differences are not intended to separate, to alienate. We are different precisely in order to realize our need of one another." - Desmond Tutu

2. "Children are a wonderful gift. They have an extraordinary capacity to see into the heart of things and to expose sham and humbug for what they are." - Desmond Tutu

3. "Give young people a greater voice. They are the future and they are much wiser than we give them credit for." - Desmond Tutu

4. "Religion is like a knife: you can either use it to cut bread, or stick in someone's back." - Desmond Tutu

5. "We have allowed the interests of capital to outweigh the interests of human beings and our Earth." - Desmond Tutu

6. "Without memory, there is no healing. Without forgiveness, there is no future." - Desmond Tutu

7. "Forgiveness is abandoning your right to revenge." - Desmond Tutu

8. "You are either on the side of the oppressed or on the side of the oppressor. You can't be neutral." - Desmond Tutu

9. "Language is very powerful. Language does not just describe reality. Language creates the reality it describes." - Desmond Tutu

10. "All of our humanity is dependent upon recognizing the humanity in others" - Desmond Tutu

11. "Love your enemy; it will ruin his reputation." - Desmond Tutu

12. "We need other human beings in order to be human." - Desmond Tutu

13. "To treat anyone as if they were less than human, less than a brother or a sister, no matter what they have done, is to contravene the very laws of our humanity." - Desmond Tutu

14. "It is our moral obligation to give every child the very best education possible." - Desmond Tutu

15. "We are made for loving. If we don’t love, we will be like plants without water." - Desmond Tutu

35 Family Love Quotes that Capture the Essence of Home

35 Family Love Quotes that Capture the Essence of Home

Imagine a cozy evening with your family, gathering around the dinner table or watching a movie together. Those moments bring joy and warm feelings to our hearts.

Luckily, family love quotes capture these feelings in words. They make us smile, laugh, and sometimes even shed a tear. Family love quotes remind us how lucky we are to have such amazing people in our lives.

Let's dive into a collection of family love quotes that capture the heartwarming feeling of home. These quotes can make every moment together even more meaningful.

Best Family Love Quotes

1. “Family is not an important thing. It’s everything.” –Michael J. Fox

2. “You don’t choose your family. They are God’s gift to you, as you are to them.” — Desmond Tutu

3. “Nothing is better than going home to family and eating good food and relaxing.” –Irina Shayk

4. “The family is one of nature’s masterpieces.” – George Santayana

5. “You are the bows from which your children as living arrows are sent forth.” — Khalil Gibran

6. “So much of what is best in us is bound up in our love of family, that it remains the measure of our stability because it measures our sense of loyalty.” — Haniel Long

7. “Everyone needs a house to live in, but a supportive family is what builds a home.” – Anthony Liccione

8. “Family faces are magic mirrors. Looking at people who belong to us, we see the past, present, and future.” – Gail Lumet Buckley

9. “Other things may change us, but we start and end with the family.” –Anthony Brandt

10. “A man should never neglect his family for business.” — Walt Disney

11. “Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we’re related for better or for worse… and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum.” ― Rick Riordan

12. "Sister is probably the most competitive relationship within the family, but once the sisters are grown, it becomes the strongest relationship.” — Margaret Mead

13. “The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only – and that is to support the ultimate career.” ― C.S. Lewis

14. “Having somewhere to go is home. Having someone to love is family. And having both is a blessing.”

15. “Families are the compass that guides us. They are the inspiration to reach great heights, and our comfort when we occasionally falter.” – Brad Henry

16. "There is no such thing as fun for the whole family.¨ — Jerry Seinfeld

17. “To us, family means putting your arms around each other and being there.” — Barbara Bush

18. “Family and friendships are two of the greatest facilitators of happiness.” –John C. Maxwell

19. “The greatest thing in family life is to take a hint when a hint is intended-and not to take a hint when a hint isn’t intended.” — Robert Frost

20. “The other night I ate at a real nice family restaurant. Every table had an argument going.” — George Carlin

21. “My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She’s ninety-seven now, and we don’t know where the heck she is.” ― Ellen DeGeneres

22. “A family is a risky venture, because the greater the love, the greater the loss… That’s the trade-off. But I’ll take it all.” — Brad Pitt

23. “The strength of a family, like the strength of an army, lies in its loyalty to each other.” – Mario Puzo

24. “When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching–they are your family.” – Jim Butcher

25. “The most important thing in the world is family and love.” – John Wooden

26. “Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.” ― George Burns

27. “A happy family is but an earlier heaven.” – George Bernard Shaw

28. “A family means nobody gets left behind or forgotten.” — David Ogden Stiers

29. “We may have our differences, but nothing’s more important than family.” –Coco

30. “Being a family means you are a part of something very wonderful. It means you will love and be loved for the rest of your life.” – Lisa Weed

31. “The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other’s life.” – Richard Bach

32. “Call it a clan, call it a network, call it a tribe, call it a family: Whatever you call it, whoever you are, you need one.” — Jane Howard

33. “It didn’t matter how big our house was; it mattered that there was love in it.” — Peter Buffett

34. “In family life, love is the oil that eases friction, the cement that binds closer together, and the music that brings harmony.” – Friedrich Nietzsche

35. “Family and friends are hidden treasures, seek them and enjoy their riches.” –Wanda Hope Carter

May these family love quotes remind us to always cherish the bond we have at home.





Author: Larasati Natasha (Intern)

55 Quotes About Growth to Inspire You Become Your Best Self

Growth is a key part of life. We all want to improve and become better versions of ourselves. This is why many people look for quotes about growth. These quotes can inspire us and remind us that change is possible. They help us see that every step we take is important for our journey.

Having a growth mindset is very important for success. When we believe we can grow and learn, we open ourselves to new opportunities. Quotes about growth often encourage us to embrace challenges and learn from our mistakes. This positive attitude can lead to great achievements in our personal and professional lives.

In this article, we will share some inspiring quotes about growth from various sources, Friday (9/1/2024). Read these quotes to inspire yourself to never stop learning and to grow into a better person every day.

Short and Powerful Quotes About Growth

1. "We can't become what we need to be by remaining what we are." - Oprah Winfrey

2. "Be not afraid of growing slowly; be afraid only of standing still." - Chinese Proverb

3. "Strength and growth come only through continuous effort and struggle." - Napoleon Hill

4. "Intellectual growth should commence at birth and cease only at death." - Albert Einstein

5. "Growth begins when we begin to accept our own weakness." - Jean Vanier

6. "All change is not growth, as all movement is not forward." - Ellen Glasgow

7. "If there is no struggle, there is no progress." - Frederick Douglass

8. "Thinking is growth; we cannot think without growing." - Wallace D. Wattles

9. "Growth is the only evidence of life." - John Henry Newman

10. "Never look back unless you are planning to go that way." - Henry David Thoreau

11. "Conformity is the jailer of freedom and the enemy of growth." - John F. Kennedy

12. "If we're growing, we're always going to be out of our comfort zone." - John C. Maxwell

13. "It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are." - E.E. Cummings

14. "The strongest principle of growth lies in the human choice." - George Eliot

15. "Growth comes from chaos, not order." - Rakesh Jhunjhunwala

Inspirational Quotes About Growth

1. "Unless you try to do something beyond what you have already mastered, you will never grow." - Ralph Waldo Emerson

2. "Without continual growth and progress, such words as improvement, achievement, and success have no meaning." - Benjamin Franklin

3. "You will either step forward into growth or you will step back into safety." - Abraham Maslow

4. "All growth depends upon activity. There is no development physically or intellectually without effort, and effort means work." - Calvin Coolidge

5. "Growth is painful. Change is painful. But, nothing is as painful as staying stuck where you do not belong." - N.R. Narayana Murthy

6. "Growth is uncomfortable; you have to embrace the discomfort if you want to expand." - Jonathan Majors

7. "There are no great limits to growth because there are no limits of human intelligence, imagination, and wonder." - Ronald Reagan

8. "Criticism, like rain, should be gentle enough to nourish a man's growth without destroying his roots." - Frank A. Clark

9. "Life is growth. If we stop growing, technically and spiritually, we are as good as dead." - Morihei Ueshiba

10. "The purpose of learning is growth, and our minds, unlike our bodies, can continue growing as we continue to live." - Mortimer Adler

11. "The key to growth is acknowledging your fear of the unknown and jumping in anyway." - Jen Sincero

12. "Growth is the great separator between those who succeed and those who do not. When I see a person beginning to separate themselves from the pack, it's almost always due to personal growth." - John C. Maxwell

13. "One of my greatest fears is not being able to change, to be caught in a never-ending cycle of sameness. Growth is so important." - Matt Dillon

14. "Growth is an erratic forward movement: two steps forward, one step back. Remember that and be very gentle with yourself." - Julia Cameron

15. "For things to change, you have to change. For things to be different, you have to be different. Before financial success can occur personal growth must occur." - Jim Rohn

Motivational Quotes About Growth

1. "You can change all things for the better when you change yourself for the better." - Jim Rohn

2. "A feeling of continuous growth is a wonderful source of motivation and self confidence." - Brian Tracy

3. "Growth is never by mere chance; it is the result of forces working together." - James Cash Penney

4. "Seeds of faith are always within us; sometimes it takes a crisis to nourish and encourage their growth." - Susan L. Taylor

5. "You don't need to change the world; you need to change yourself." - Miguel Angel Ruiz

6. "Life is a process of becoming, a combination of states we have to go through. Where people fail is that they wish to elect a state and remain in it. This is a kind of death." - Anais Nin

7. "Change is inevitable. Growth is optional." - John C. Maxwell

8. "Every time you make a mistake, don't bring up everything that's wrong with yourself; tell yourself that you're paying the price for growth and that you will learn to do better next time. Every positive thing you can say to yourself will help." - John C. Maxwell

9. "Where there is age there is evolution, where there is life there is growth." - Anjelica Huston

10. "The ability to grow is directly related to the amount of insecurity you can take in your life." - Bruce Jenner

11. "All of us need to grow continuously in our lives." - Les Brown

12. "Growth demands a temporary surrender of security." - Gail Sheehy

13. "Change and growth take place when a person has risked himself and dares to become involved with experimenting with his own life." - Herbert Otto Gille

14. "Everybody wants to be somebody; nobody wants to grow." - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

15. "Growth means change and change involves risk, stepping from the known to the unknown." - George Shinn

Inspirational Quotes About Growth Mindset

1. "You have to apply yourself each day to becoming a little better. By becoming a little better each and every day, over a period of time, you will become a lot better." - John Wooden

2. "Why waste time proving over and over how great you are, when you could be getting better?" - Carol S. Dweck

3. "Your failures and misfortunes don't threaten other people. . . It's your assets and your successes that are problems for people who derive their self-esteem from being superior." - Carol S. Dweck

4. "Stay afraid, but do it anyway. What's important is the action. You don't have to wait to be confident. Just do it and eventually the confidence will follow." - Carrie Fisher

5. "The expert at anything was once a beginner." - Helen Hayes

6. "Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal. My strength lies solely in my tenacity." - Louis Pasteur

7. "Do not be afraid of failure, but learn from it." - John Wooden

8. "If you quit once it becomes a habit. Don't Quit." - Michael Jordan

9. "Live as if you were to die tomorrow; learn as if you were to live forever." - Mahatma Gandhi

10. "It's not that I'm so smart. It's just that I stay with problems longer." - Albert Einstein

Megan Fox Announces She is Pregnant with Machine Gun Kelly

Megan Fox has announced she is pregnant with her first child with Machine Gun Kelly. The announcement was made via her Instagram account on November 11, 2024.

She shared a photo of a positive pregnancy test. Megan Fox also sent a striking image of her baby bump covered in black liquid.

The actress captioned her post with lyrics from Kelly's song "Last November," stating, "Nothing is ever really lost. Welcome back."

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Megan Fox (@meganfox)


Fox's Fourth Pregnancy

This is Fox's fourth pregnancy. She has three sons - Noah (12), Bodhi (10), and Journey (8) - from her previous marriage to Brian Austin Green.

Machine Gun Kelly, whose real name is Colson Baker, has a daughter named Casie (15) from a previous marriage.

The couple's journey to parenthood has been challenging. Fox had a miscarriage last year, which she openly shared during an interview.

Fox and Kelly's Relationship

Fox and Kelly began their relationship in 2020 after meeting on "Midnight in the Switchgrass." They became engaged in January 2022.

As reported to Elle, this upcoming child is called a "rainbow baby," symbolizing hope following their previous loss.

55 Questions To Ask On a First Date: Funny and Win Your Crush Over

55 Questions To Ask On a First Date: Funny and Win Your Crush Over

Taking a first date is like setting sail on a journey of discovery. It's a chance to know someone's personality, share laughter, and create memories. To make this adventure even more delightful, we will guide you on "Questions To Ask On a First Date." Imagine it: an evening filled with genuine smiles, a sprinkle of humor, and the art of getting to know each other. On first dates, asking the right questions can open up a treasure of connection and charm.

Let's check out some funny questions to ask on a first date, compiled from numerous sources, on Friday (09/02/2024).

1. Are you a city or a nature person?

2. Are you more of a deep sea or an outer space gay?

3. If you could turn one celebrity gay, who would it be? 

4. What’s the weirdest first date you’ve ever been on?

5. Have you ever peed in a public pool?

6. What would you think my name was if you didn’t know it?

7. If you were a character from the L Word, who would you be?

8. Do you have any relationship dealbreakers? What are they?

9. Have you ever been injured during sex?

Questions To Ask On a First Date

10. Do you make the first move or do you like it when someone else does?

11. Are you friends with any of your exes?

12. What is your favorite karaoke song?

13. What would be your role in the zombie apocalypse?

14. Do you talk to your pets? What do you say to them?

15. Have you ever had somebody call you the wrong name and not had the heart to correct them? If so, what did they call you?

Questions To Ask On a First Date

16. What’s the longest lie-in you’ve ever had?

17. What’s the worst nickname someone has ever called you?

18. How bad is your road-rage on a scale of 1-10?

19. What’s the most embarrassing thing you’re afraid of? Or something you’re scared of that most people don’t find scary?

20. Have you ever been on the receiving end of a practical joke? Or successfully pulled one off?

21. Do you have any claims to fame?

22. What’s the weirdest thing that you do in the shower?

23. Do you have any odd vices that you don’t tell people about?

24. What is your favorite random food combination that you make late at night?

25. How about any secret hidden talents?

26. What’s the worst joke that you like to tell everyone?
27. Is there something that you do that others don’t do?

28. What’s the worst school photo that you’ve ever taken?

29. If you were a dog, would you sniff another dogs butt to say hello?

31. What’s the craziest thing you’ve ever done with a best friend?

32. Do you think that soul mates are real or is it just made up for Instagram?

33. Where is the strangest place that you’ve ever used the bathroom?

34. What Halloween costume was your favorite from last year?

35. What is the cringiest thing that a person has ever done to you?

Questions To Ask On a First Date

36. What’s the funniest injury that you’ve ever had when you were growing up?

37. Have you ever had a really weird direct message from someone on the internet?

38. Do you use your phone when you’re using the bathroom?

39. What was your first impression of me when I walked up?

40. Which YouTube channels do you watch but don’t tell anyone about?

41. If you could swap lives with any fictional character for a day, who would it be and why?

42. Do you have a go-to dance move that you bust out when nobody’s watching?

43. What’s the most bizarre hobby you’ve ever attempted or considered trying?

44. What’s the strangest place you’ve found something you’ve lost?

45. If you were stranded on a deserted island, what three things would you want to have with you?

46. If your personality were a type of food, what would it be and why?

47. If you were a meme, what caption would be underneath your picture?

Questions To Ask On a First Date

48. Have you ever been on a midnight snack raid?

49. Share your most hilarious travel mishap or misadventure.

50. If you could have any celebrity be your personal assistant for a day, what tasks would you want them to do?

51. If you had to replace the handshake as a greeting, what would your new greeting be?

52. What’s the most embarrassing thing you’ve ever done to impress someone?

53. What’s a funny childhood memory that never fails to make you smile?

54. What’s the craziest conspiracy theory you secretly wish were true?

55. What’s the weirdest dish you’ve ever tried and what was your reaction?

Questions To Ask On a First Date

Exploration into the world of first-dates. Remember that the essence of these questions is in the humor and the shared moments.

Whether the laughter that echoes through a coffee shop or the smiles exchanged over dinner, the magic of a first date is in the connection developed.

So, as you take your next rendezvous, let curiosity be your guide and sprinkle in some humor. Let's watch as the questions pave the way for getting to know someone new. May your first dates be filled with laughter, warmth, and the promise of delightful connections.

5 Hollywood Live-Action Movies With Best Animatronics Special Effects

Animatronics have played a significant role in creating some of Hollywood's most iconic and memorable characters.

5 Hollywood Live-Action Movies With Best Animatronics Special Effects

Directed by Steven Spielberg, this film is renowned for its groundbreaking use of animatronics to bring dinosaurs to life.

The life-sized animatronic models, especially the T. rex and Velociraptors, created by Stan Winston Studios, were crucial in making the dinosaurs appear realistic and terrifying

Jurrasic Park (1993)

Directed by Jim Henson and Frank Oz, this fantasy film is celebrated for its extensive use of animatronic puppetry.

The Skeksis, Mystics, and Gelflings were all brought to life through intricate animatronics and puppetry, showcasing an extraordinary level of detail and creativity.

The Dark Crystal (1982)

Directed by James Cameron, this sequel to Ridley Scott's "Alien" utilized advanced animatronics to create the terrifying Xenomorphs and the Alien Queen.

Stan Winston's team delivered some of the most intense and realistic creature effects seen at the time.

Aliens (1986)

John Carpenter's sci-fi horror film is famous for its terrifying and grotesque creature effects, designed by Rob Bottin.

The use of animatronics and practical effects in depicting the alien entity's transformations remains highly influential in the horror genre.

The Thing (1982)

The animatronics special effects in "Jaws" were revolutionary for the time. The film famously used an animatronic shark, often referred to as "Bruce" after Spielberg's lawyer.

The mechanical shark, designed by special effects artist Bob Mattey, was a massive undertaking and required three separate models to depict different aspects of the shark's movements and interactions. It appearances on screen were convincing and terrifying, contributing significantly to the film's suspense and horror.

Jaws (1975)

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: From Japan to Thailand, here are some of the most beautiful Asian countries to visit this year.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
The 10 Most Beautiful Countries to Visit in Asia in 2025

Asia is a vast and fascinating continent filled with many beautiful countries waiting to be explored. Each country offers unique experiences, from ancient temples and bustling cities to stunning natural landscapes. Traveling in Asia allows you to discover new cultures, taste delicious foods, and see places that you will remember forever. Whether you enjoy history, nature, or modern life, Asia has something special for you.

In 2025, many Asian countries are ready to welcome visitors once again. This is a perfect time to plan your trip and explore famous landmarks, vibrant markets, and peaceful beaches. You can enjoy festivals, meet friendly people, and learn about different traditions. Asia’s diversity makes it an exciting destination for all kinds of travelers.

So if you are wondering where to go this year, here are ten most beautiful countries in Asia you should visit in 2025:

1. Japan

Japan is a country where tradition and modern life come together in a fascinating way. The capital, Tokyo, offers many exciting places to explore. You can visit the Tokyo Skytree, one of the tallest towers in the world, and enjoy breathtaking views of the city. The historic Sensoji Temple in Asakusa is a peaceful place full of culture, while the famous Shibuya Crossing shows the city’s lively energy. Beautiful parks like Ueno Park and the Imperial Palace Gardens offer calm spots to relax.

Mount Fuji, Japan’s highest mountain, is a must-see for nature lovers and photographers. Kyoto is famous for its beautiful temples, such as the Golden Pavilion (Kinkaku-ji), and traditional tea houses. In Nara, you can meet friendly deer roaming near the large Todai-ji Temple, home to a giant Buddha statue. Japan’s gardens, like Kenrokuen, are stunning in every season, from cherry blossoms in spring to colorful leaves in autumn.

2. Thailand

Thailand is known for its warm hospitality and delicious food that travelers love. Bangkok, the capital, is full of beautiful temples like Wat Arun, the Temple of Dawn, and the impressive Grand Palace. You can shop at lively markets such as Chatuchak Weekend Market or enjoy modern shopping malls. In the north, Chiang Mai offers old temples, mountain views, and a chance to experience traditional culture.

The southern islands, including Phuket and Krabi, are famous for their clear blue waters and white sandy beaches. You can go snorkeling or diving to see colorful coral reefs and tropical fish. The Phi Phi Islands are especially popular for their natural beauty. Northern Thailand also has hill tribe villages and national parks where you can enjoy hiking and nature.

3. Philippines

The Philippines is an archipelago of over 7,000 islands, each with its own charm. Boracay Island is famous for its soft white sand and clear waters, ideal for swimming and relaxing. Palawan is known for stunning limestone cliffs and the Puerto Princesa Underground River, a natural wonder. Manila, the capital, has historic sites like Intramuros, an old Spanish fortress that tells stories of the past.

In Bohol, the Chocolate Hills are a unique natural attraction, with hundreds of cone-shaped hills that turn brown in dry seasons. The Banaue Rice Terraces, carved into mountains by local tribes centuries ago, are a breathtaking sight. The Philippines hosts lively festivals filled with music and dance, welcoming visitors warmly. It is an excellent destination for those who love beaches, nature, and culture.

4. Indonesia

Indonesia is a vast country made up of thousands of islands, each offering something special. Bali is the most famous island, known for its beautiful beaches, rice terraces, and temples like Uluwatu and Tanah Lot. On Java island, you can visit Borobudur, the world’s largest Buddhist temple, which is an impressive sight. Jakarta, Indonesia’s capital, is a bustling city with museums, shopping, and cultural events.

For adventure lovers, Indonesia has many volcanoes and mountains, such as Mount Bromo and Mount Rinjani, popular for hiking. Komodo National Park is home to the famous Komodo dragons, the largest lizards on Earth. Raja Ampat is a paradise for divers, with some of the world’s most colorful coral reefs. Indonesia’s rich culture includes traditional dances and arts that you can enjoy in many places.

5. Vietnam

Vietnam offers stunning landscapes and a rich cultural history. Ha Long Bay is famous for its thousands of limestone islands rising from emerald waters, and boat tours allow you to explore caves and quiet beaches. Hanoi, the capital, has a charming Old Quarter with narrow streets and French colonial buildings. Ho Chi Minh City is a lively metropolis with busy markets like Ben Thanh and important historical sites.

The ancient town of Hoi An is known for its well-preserved old houses and colorful lanterns. The Mekong Delta is a network of rivers and floating markets where life flows on water. Northern Vietnam’s mountains and rice terraces in places like Sapa offer breathtaking views and cultural experiences with local hill tribes. Vietnam combines nature, history, and vibrant city life.

6. China

China is a vast country with many world-famous landmarks. The Great Wall of China stretches across mountains and valleys and is one of the greatest wonders of the world. Beijing, the capital, is home to the Forbidden City, a huge palace complex, and Tiananmen Square, a large public space with historical importance. Shanghai is a modern city with impressive skyscrapers like the Oriental Pearl Tower and busy shopping streets.

In Xi’an, you can see the Terracotta Army, thousands of life-size clay soldiers buried with an ancient emperor. The Yangtze River offers beautiful scenery, and the Yellow Mountains are known for their unique rock formations and sea of clouds. China has many ancient temples, gardens, and museums to explore. It is a country full of history and modern life.

7. South Korea

South Korea is a country where technology meets tradition. Seoul, the capital, has stunning palaces like Gyeongbokgung, where you can watch traditional ceremonies. The city also offers modern shopping districts such as Myeongdong and lively markets like Dongdaemun. Jeju Island is a popular destination with volcanic landscapes, waterfalls, and beautiful beaches.

South Korea’s mountains and national parks, like Seoraksan, are perfect for hiking and enjoying nature. Traditional villages, such as Bukchon Hanok Village, let you see old Korean houses and experience local culture. Korean food is famous worldwide, with dishes like kimchi and Korean barbecue that you can enjoy in many restaurants. South Korea offers a rich blend of old and new.

8. India

India is a land full of colors, history, and diverse cultures. The Taj Mahal in Agra is a stunning white marble monument and a symbol of love admired worldwide. Delhi, the capital, has many historic sites such as the Red Fort and India Gate. Jaipur, known as the Pink City, is famous for its beautiful palaces like the Hawa Mahal and Amber Fort.

India has many sacred cities, including Varanasi on the Ganges River, where people perform ancient religious rituals. The Himalayas in the north offer breathtaking mountain views and trekking opportunities. India celebrates many festivals, such as Diwali, the festival of lights, with music, dance, and delicious food. Indian cuisine is rich and varied, with popular dishes like curry and biryani.

9. Malaysia

Malaysia is a country where modern cities meet beautiful nature. Kuala Lumpur, the capital, is famous for the Petronas Twin Towers, the tallest twin buildings in the world. Langkawi Island offers stunning beaches and lush rainforests. The Cameron Highlands are cool and peaceful, known for tea plantations and flower gardens.

Malaysia’s rainforests are home to unique animals like orangutans and exotic birds. You can explore caves and waterfalls in places such as Gunung Mulu National Park. The country’s diverse cultures, including Malay, Chinese, and Indian, are reflected in its festivals and delicious food. Malaysian cuisine is a flavorful mix of spices and traditions.

10. Sri Lanka

Sri Lanka is an island full of history, culture, and natural beauty. Ancient cities like Anuradhapura and Polonnaruwa have well-preserved ruins and temples to explore. Sigiriya is a famous rock fortress with stunning views from the top. The country’s tea plantations in the hills offer peaceful scenery and fresh air.

Sri Lanka’s coastline has beautiful beaches such as Mirissa and Unawatuna, ideal for swimming and relaxing. National parks like Yala give you the chance to see wild animals, including elephants and leopards. The people are warm and proud of their traditions. Sri Lanka offers a calm and welcoming atmosphere for travelers.

5 Romance Horror Movies for a Spine-Chilling Valentine's Night

5 Romance Horror Movies for a Spine-Chilling Valentine's Night

Valentine's Day is often associated with love, chocolates, and flowers.

But for those who prefer a twist of darkness in their romance, we have a list of scary movies that combine love and horror. These romance horror films are perfect for a thrilling Valentine's night. So you can cuddle up with your loved one and experience the thrill of a different love story.

Romance Horror Movies

1. Let The Right One In (2008)

Based on the novel of the same name, "Let The Right One In" tells the story of a lonely young boy named Oskar who befriends a mysterious girl named Eli.

Oskar discovers that Eli is not a common girl as their bond grows stronger - she is a vampire. This Swedish film beautifully catches the innocence and tenderness of first love.

It also explores the horror and violence that come with vampires. The film explores loneliness, acceptance, and the lengths to go for love.

"Thelma" is a Norwegian supernatural thriller about a young woman named Thelma. She starts experiencing unexplainable seizures. As Thelma tries to understand the cause of her seizures, she meets and falls in love with Anja. Their blossoming romance is twisted by Thelma's supernatural abilities, which become increasingly dangerous as she tries to control them.

This romance horror movie explores themes of self-discovery, sexuality, and the lengths one would go to protect one's love.

3. Bram Stoker's Dracula (1992)

This visually stunning film combines romance, horror, and tragedy. The narrative creates a beautiful love story that is haunting and lovely. With its spectacular cinematography and performances, "Bram Stoker's Dracula" is a must-watch for fans of classic horror.

"Pee Mak" is a Thai romantic horror comedy. It tells the story of a soldier named Mak who returns home from war to his beloved wife Nak and their newborn baby. However, Mak soon discovers that Nak and their baby died during childbirth.

Nak's spirit stays with Mak despite this, causing supernatural happenings and ghostly encounters.

This film is a unique blend of romance, comedy, and horror that will keep you entertained.

5. Crimson Peak (2015)

"Crimson Peak" is a visually breathtaking gothic romance directed by Guillermo del Toro. The film follows the story of the desiring author Edith Cushing. She falls in love with the charming Sir Thomas Sharpe.

Edith soon moves to Sharpe's ancestral home, Crimson Peak, where she uncovers dark secrets and experiences ghostly apparitions. 7 Unique Facts about Sea Sponges That Inspired SpongeBob SquarePants

Deep under the ocean's waves lies a world full of wonder and mystery. It is where even the simplest animals can hold the legend to incredible inspiration.

7 Unique Facts about Sea Sponges That Inspired SpongeBob SquarePants

In this marine realm, sea sponges are natural organisms. They have delighted scientists and artists alike. The beloved character SpongeBob SquarePants may be a playful creation.

But it roots his inspiration in the fascinating world of these marine marvels. Join us as we dive into the depths of the ocean. We'll uncover seven unique facts about sea sponges. They served as the muse for the iconic characters we know and love.

pixabay_dimitrisvetsikas1969

1. Sea Sponges Are Animals, Not Plants: A Surprising Identity

While their name may produce images of kitchen scrubs, sea sponges are far from lifeless objects. These animals are real animals belonging to the "phylum Porifera." Their static nature and simple structure may be like plants. But under the surface lies a complex and rich ecosystem. This marine life inspired the lively and various worlds of Bikini Bottom.

Sea sponges represent a unique feature—they are hermaphrodites. Sea sponges have both male and female reproductive organs. This is a unique characteristic of self-fertilization and cross-fertilization. That inspired the weird relationships within SpongeBob's underwater universe.

2. Hermaphrodites of the Sea: Nature's Dual Role

3. Sea Sponges Can Live Up to 5000 Years

Imagine an animal that has been seen in history for thousands of years. Sea sponges have the fantastic power to survive for centuries.

Some species have lifespans that extend up to an incredible 5,000 years.

This lasting presence reflects the timelessness of SpongeBob's adventures.

Photo: flickr/NOAA Photo Library

4. 500 Million-Year Legacy: Ancient Animals of the Sea

Sea sponges have inhabited Earth's oceans for an incredible 500 million years. This makes them one of the oldest living organisms on the planet. Their enduring presence has incorporated a narrative of strength and adaptability. This reflects the endless popularity of SpongeBob SquarePants.

pinterest_etsy

pinterest_dreamstime

5. 5,000 Species of Sea Sponges Worldwide

The oceans hide a surprising variety of life. Sea sponges contribute significantly to this. They have over 5,000 known species worldwide. Different shapes, colors, and sizes characterize each. Sea sponges offer a diverse collection of inspiration that mirrors the rich cast of characters in Bikini Bottom.

6. A Unique Anatomy

Sea sponges challenge our concepts of complex anatomy. They are unlike animals with centralized nervous systems. Sea sponges do not have heads, eyes, brains, arms, legs, ears, muscles, nerves, or specialized organs. This simplicity highlights the charm of SpongeBob's character, whose natural innocence and curiosity.
Photo: pinterest_dkfindout

7. Masterful Water Filters of Sea Sponge

The design of sea sponges' pores allows them to be professional water filters. These pull in water to extract nourishment and oxygen. The pores also remove waste back into the ocean—this incredible ability to keep a peaceful balance.

In the world of SpongeBob SquarePants, these seven unique facts about sea sponges are linked to the imagination. These live life into a character that catches the essence of the ocean's most habitats. Sea sponges have proven that even the simplest of organisms can inspire. Plus, they can be as charming as the deep blue sea itself.

flickr/Spongebob squarepants!

Quotes from Princess Bride: 30 Messages on Life and Love from Classic Movie

Princess Bride quotes highlight the movie's unique blend of humor, romance, and adventure. (Photo by Nancy Moore on Pinterest)

Quotes from Princess Bride: 30 Messages on Life and Love from Classic Movie

Princess Bride is a timeless classic that has captured the hearts of many. Its memorable quotes are full of life lessons and expressions of love that continue to resonate with audiences today.

In this article, we have gathered 30 of the most iconic Princess Bride quotes to make you fall in love with the movie.

The Princess Bride movie tells the story of a young woman named Buttercup and her true love, Westley. After Westley is presumed dead, Buttercup is reluctantly engaged to Prince Humperdinck.

However, Westley returns to save her, facing many adventures and challenges along the way.

Princess Bride quotes highlight the movie's unique blend of humor, romance, and adventure. They capture the wit of characters like Westley and Vizzini, the deep love between Westley and Buttercup, and the wisdom found in their journey.

So, what are you waiting for? Join us to explore these 30 memorable Princess Bride quotes below. Let’s get started!

A. Best Quotes from Princess Bride

1. "We have already succeeded. I mean, what are the three terrors of the Fire Swamp? One, the flame spurt — no problem. There’s a popping sound preceding each; we can avoid that. Two, the lightning sand, which you were clever enough to discover what that looks like, so in the future, we can avoid that too." - Westley

2. “I do not mean to pry, but you don’t by any chance happen to have six fingers on your right hand?” - Inigo Montoya

3. "I always think that everything could be a trap, which is why I'm still alive." - Prince Humperdinck

4. "I'll explain and I'll use small words so that you'll be sure to understand, you warthog-faced buffoon." - Westley

5. "It's not that bad! Well, I'm not saying I'd like to build a summer home here, but the trees are actually quite lovely." - Westley

6. “As you wish” - Westley

7. "There's a big difference between mostly dead and all dead. Please, open his mouth. Now, mostly dead is slightly alive. Now, all dead ... well, with all dead, there's usually only one thing that you can do." - Miracle Max

8. "I have been in the revenge business so long, now that it's over, I don't know what to do with the rest of my life." - Inigo Montoya

9. "You mean you'll put down your rock and I'll put down my sword, and we'll try and kill each other like civilized people?" - Westley

10. "Why lose your venom on me?" - Westley

B. Quotes from Princess Bride on Life

1. "Life is pain, Highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something." - Westley

2. "Get some rest. If you haven’t got your health, then you haven’t got anything." - Count Rugen

3. “If you’re in such a hurry, you could lower a rope or a tree branch or find something useful to do.” - Man in Black

4. "There’s a shortage of perfect breasts in this world. It would be a pity to damage yours." – Westley

5. "You keep using that word. I do not think it means what you think it means." – Inigo Montoya

6. “We are men of action. Lies do not become us." – Westley

7. "Have fun storming the castle!" – Miracle Max and Valerie

8. "Get used to disappointment." – Westley

9. "When I was your age, television was called books." – Grandpa

10. "You rush a miracle man, you get rotten miracles." – Miracle Max

C. Quotes from Princess Bride on Love

1. “Mawage. Mawage is wot bwings us together today. Mawage, that blessed awangement, that dweam wifin a dweam. And wuv, tru wuv, will fowow you foweva. So tweasure your wuv.” - The Impressive Clergyman

2. "This is true love. You think this happens every day?" - Westley

3. “I told you I would always come for you. Why didn’t you wait for me?” - Westley

4. “It was 10 days to the wedding. The King still lived, but Buttercup’s nightmares were growing steadily worse.” - Grandpa

5. “See, didn’t I tell you she’d never marry that rotten Humperdinck?” - Grandson

10. “Since the invention of the kiss, there have been five kisses rated the most passionate, the most pure. This one left them all behind. The end.” — Grandpa

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.title: 5 Facts About Jack The Ripper Serial Killer You May Not Know About
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: Jack the Ripper’s identity may never be known, but his reign of terror continues to fascinate crime enthusiasts and historians.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
5 Facts About Jack The Ripper Serial Killer You May Not Know About

Jack the Ripper remains one of the most infamous and mysterious serial killers in history.

Operating in the Whitechapel district of London in 1888, he brutally murdered at least five women, leaving behind a legacy of fear and intrigue.

While much is known about his crimes, here are five lesser-known facts that add depth to the mystery surrounding him:

Medical Knowledge

Many experts believe that Jack the Ripper had some degree of anatomical knowledge due to the precision with which he mutilated his victims.

Some reports suggest that his cuts were so precise that he may have been a butcher, a medical student, or even a surgeon.

However, this theory remains speculative, as some coroners of the time dismissed the idea that he had professional training.

More Than Five Victims?

The "canonical five" victims—Mary Ann Nichols, Annie Chapman, Elizabeth Stride, Catherine Eddowes, and Mary Jane Kelly—are the ones most commonly attributed to Jack the Ripper.

However, some researchers believe he may have been responsible for other murders, both before and after 1888.

Cases such as Martha Tabram’s murder, which occurred just before the Ripper’s spree, bear similarities to his modus operandi, leading some to think she was an early victim.

He Sent Taunting Letters – Or Did He?

Several letters were sent to the police and newspapers during the murders, with some signed "Jack the Ripper."

The most famous, the "Dear Boss" letter, is where the killer's infamous name originated.

However, many historians now believe that most of these letters were hoaxes, possibly written by journalists to sensationalize the case.

The "From Hell" letter, which arrived with part of a human kidney, is considered the most likely to be genuine.

Jack the Ripper Was Almost Caught

There were moments when the police came frustratingly close to catching the Ripper.

On the night of Catherine Eddowes’ murder, a constable patrolling the area may have just missed him by minutes.

Additionally, some witnesses described seeing a suspicious man near the crime scenes, but their descriptions varied, making it difficult for investigators to track him down.

Despite an intense manhunt and numerous suspects, he managed to evade capture.

Theories About His Identity

Over the years, countless theories have emerged regarding the Ripper’s identity. Some suggest he was a member of the royal family, a wealthy doctor, or even an American serial killer like H.H. Holmes.

More recent forensic studies have linked DNA evidence from a victim’s shawl to a Polish barber named Aaron Kosminski, but many experts remain skeptical of this conclusion.

The lack of definitive proof means the case remains one of history’s greatest unsolved mysteries.

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.title: 8 Weirdest (But Tasty) Fruits in the World
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: 8 Weirdest (But Tasty) Fruits in the World; from 'buddha hand' to snake fruit!
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_keywords: 8 Weirdest (But Tasty) Fruits in the World
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
8 Weirdest (But Tasty) Fruits in the World

8 Weirdest (But Tasty) Fruits in the World

Get ready for a cool adventure into nature's unique fruits! We're about to show you some really weird ones – not the usual apples or bananas. From spiky melons to the mysterious ‘Buddha hand’, these fruits are far from ordinary. Let's explore the world of strange and exotic fruits!

Horned Melon/Kiwano (Cucumis metuliferus)

This fruit, also called kiwano, is in the gourd family. It has spiky yellow-orange skin and bright lime green flesh. Originally from New Zealand, it's now grown in the USA, Chile, and Australia.

Dragon Fruit (Hylocereus undatus)

Also known as pitaya, this cactus fruit has bright pink skin. Inside, you find white flesh with small black seeds, offering a mildly sweet and slightly tangy taste, perfect for tropical climates.

Durian (Durio zibethinus)

From southeast Asia, the durian is famous for its strong smell. It's often called the king of fruit due to its large size, thorny skin, and intense aroma. It's not allowed on public transport in some places because of its strong smell

Buddha’s Hand (Citrus medica)

A citrus fruit with finger-like segments leading to the core. In China and Japan, it's used as a room freshener and remains a curiosity in Europe.

Passion Fruit (Passiflora edulis)

Grown in tropical regions, this fruit has dark purple skin. Inside, you'll discover fragrant, rich yellow flesh with black seeds.

Rambutan (Nephelium lappaceum)

Cultivated in tropical southeast Asia, this fruit has pink to red skin covered in hair-like bristles. Inside, enjoy milky white flesh with a sweet and slightly tangy taste.

Atemoya (Annona × atemoya)

A hybrid of sugar-apple and cherimoya from Latin America, with a heart-shaped green skin. Inside, find sweet white flesh embedded with black seeds.

Snake Fruit (Salacca zalacca)

Mainly found in Indonesia, this fruit has reddish-brown, snake-like skin with scales. Similar in shape and size to a fig, it has a sweet flavor with a hint of tanginess.

Functions of Money in Economics and The Example Beyond Buying Power

Functions of Money in Economics and The Example Beyond Buying Power

Money plays a crucial role in our daily lives, but have you ever stopped to think about the functions of money?

Money serves more than just a means of buying goods and services. It has several important functions that help facilitate economic transactions and promote societal stability. There are four main functions of money. Let's explore them and the key properties that make them such a valuable asset.

Functions of Money in Economics

  • The 4 Main Functions of Money

Primary Functions of Money:

1. Medium of Exchange

The most basic function of money is to serve as a medium of exchange. This means that money facilitates the buying and selling of goods and services. Instead of having to barter or trade one item for another, people can use money as a universally accepted form of payment. For example, if you want to buy a new toy, you can give the store owner money in exchange for the toy without having to find something else of similar value to trade.

2. Measure of Value

Money also acts as a measure of value, which allows us to compare the worth of different goods and services. By assigning prices to items in terms of money, we can easily choose their relative value and make informed decisions about allocating our resources. For instance, if a book costs $10 and a shirt costs $20, we can easily see that the shirt is worth twice as much as the book.

Secondary Functions of Money:

1. Standard of Deferred Payments

Money serves as a standard for deferred payments, allowing individuals to make purchases on credit and repay them in the future. This function is especially important in today's economy, where loans and mortgages are common. For example, if you take out a loan to buy a car, you agree to repay the lender a certain amount over time, using money as the standard payment unit.

2. Store of Value

Money also acts as a store of value, allowing us to save and accumulate wealth over time. Instead of keeping all our wealth as goods or assets, we can convert it into money and store it for future use. This function is especially useful in times of uncertainty or economic instability when holding onto physical assets may not be practical. For example, if you receive a bonus at work, you can save that money in a bank account or invest it in stocks to preserve its value over time.

In addition to its functions, money also has four key properties that make it an efficient and effective medium of exchange:

Properties of Money:

1. Fungible

Money is fungible, meaning each currency unit is exchangeable for another unit of the same value. This makes it easy to use money in transactions because you don't have to worry about the specific characteristics of each coin or bill.

2. Portable

Money is highly portable. It allows us to carry it around easily and use it for transactions wherever we go. Whether buying groceries at the store or paying for a taxi ride, money's portability makes it a timely payment. 3. Durable
Money is designed to be durable. It lasts through multiple transactions without losing its value. Unlike perishable goods that spoil over time, money can withstand wear and tear, ensuring that it remains a reliable medium of exchange for years.

4. Divisible

Money is divisible, meaning it can be broken down into smaller units to facilitate transactions of varying sizes. Whether buying a cup of coffee or a new car, money's divisibility allows you to purchase at different prices without any bother.

There are multiple functions of money in our society. These functions are essential for the operation of our economy and everyday transactions. 

Money has key properties, such as being fungible, portable, durable, and divisible. These features make it an efficient and effective currency for people of all ages. Understanding the functions and properties of money is essential for individuals to navigate their finances and make informed decisions about managing them effectively. By knowing the importance of money in our daily lives, we can better appreciate its role as a universal medium of exchange that enables us to fulfill transactions, measure value, and store wealth for future use.

40 Christmas Vacation Quotes: Iconic Lines from National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation

Christmas is coming, and it's the perfect time to enjoy holiday movies with family and friends. One of the most popular Christmas movies is National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation. This movie has become a holiday favorite because of its funny and relatable story. Fans especially love the hilarious Christmas Vacation quotes that make the movie unforgettable.

National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation was released in 1989 and is the third movie in the "Vacation" series. It stars Chevy Chase as Clark Griswold, a family man who wants to give his loved ones the perfect Christmas. The movie shows how Clark's plans for a magical holiday turn into one disaster after another, but it's all filled with humor and heart.

The movie is packed with hilarious moments, from family disagreements to surprise visitors and Clark's over-the-top Christmas decorations. These unforgettable scenes are what makes the movie so unique, and many beloved Christmas Vacation quotes come from these iconic parts of the story.

If you are a fan of this movie, hold on. We have selected some of the most iconic Christmas vacation quotes for you from various sources, Wednesday (18/12/2024). These quotes will remind you of the funny and heartwarming moments from the movie.

Iconic Christmas Vacation Quotes

1. "Where do you think you're going? Nobody's leaving. Nobody's walking out on this fun, old-fashioned family Christmas. No, no. We're all in this together." - Clark Griswold

2. "There it is ... the Griswold family Christmas tree." - Clark Griswold

6. "We're gonna have the hap-hap-happiest Christmas." - Clark Griswold

7. "I don't know what to say, but it's Christmas, and we're all in misery." - Ellen Griswold

8. "Save the neck for me, Clark." - Cousin Eddie

9. "Hey kids, look! A deer!" - Clark Griswold

10. "Think you might be overdoing it, Dad?" - Rusty Griswold

11. "Oops, a little knot here. You work on that." - Clark Griswold

12. "Are you out here for a reason, or are you just avoiding the family?" - Ellen Griswold

13. "Is it plugged in?" - Ellen Griswold

14. "The little lights are not twinkling." - Grandpa Art

15. "I just can't believe you're actually standing here in my living room, Eddie." - Clark Griswold

16. "It's people that make the difference. Little people like you." - Frank Shirley

17. "It was an ugly tree anyway." - Grandpa Art

18. "Welcome to our home—what's left of it." - Ellen Griswold

19. "Looks great. Little full, lotta sap." - Clark Griswold

20. "Merry Christmas! Shitter was full!" - Cousin Eddie

Hilarious Christmas Vacation Quotes

1. "Clark, stop it! I don't want to spend the holidays dead!" - Ellen Griswold

2. "Look at the time! I gotta go to bed. I still gotta brush my teeth, feed the hog, still got some homework to do, still got those bills to pay, wash the car ..." - Rusty Griswold

3. "Clark, we're stuck under a truck!" - Ellen Griswold

4. "It's not big, it's just ... full." - Clark Griswold

5. "Can I refill your eggnog for you? Get you something to eat? Drive you out to the middle of nowhere, leave you for dead?" - Clark Griswold

6. "If that thing had nine lives, she just spent 'em all." - Cousin Eddie

7. "Grandma Nora has a painful burr on my heel and if you rub it for me, I'll give you a whole quarter!" - Grandma Nora

8. "How could things get any worse? Take a look around here, Ellen. We're at the threshold of hell." - Clark Griswold

11. "You couldn't hear a dump truck driving through a nitroglycerin plant." - Uncle Lewis

12. "Oh, he's just yakkin' on a bone." - Cousin Eddie

13. " Mom? This box is meowing." - Rusty Griswold

14. Would it be indecent to ask the grandparents to stay at a hotel?" - Audrey Griswold

15. Audrey Griswold: "He worked really hard, Grandpa." Grandpa Art: "So do washing machines."

16. "Yes, it's a bit nipply out, I mean nippy out." - Clark Griswold

17. "Surprised, Eddie?... If I woke up tomorrow with my head sewn to the carpet, I wouldn't be more surprised." - Clark Griswold

5 Most Popular Traditional Foods from Kolkata, Enjoy India's Culinary Capital

Kolkata is the lively capital city of West Bengal, India. It is famous for its rich culinary heritage and various culinary delights. The city's traditional cuisine reflects a fusion of Bengali, Mughlai, and British influences.

5 Most Popular Traditional Foods from Kolkata, Enjoy India's Culinary Capital

So, resulting in a unique blend of flavors and textures. In this article, we take a food journey through the streets of Kolkata to explore. Then savor the five most popular traditional foods. They have captured locals' and visitors' hearts and palates.

Kolkata's traditional food is a delightful fusion of influences. These combine the flavors of Bengali, Mughlai, and British culinary traditions. These truly represent the essence of the city. Each dish is a masterpiece that reflects Kolkata's love of bold flavors. As well as their aromatic spices and the art of blending tradition with innovation.

It ranges from street food delights to elaborate feasts. Kolkata offers iconic dishes to be celebrated and savored. The city's food landscape is rich in taste. Here is where the aroma of spices fills the air and tantalizes the taste buds.

This article will take a flavorful journey to discover Kolkata's most popular traditional food. We will look into the iconic dishes that have become synonymous with the city's culinary identity. Explore the lively street food scene, the rich seafood offerings, and the stunning sweets. They will leave a lasting impression. Discover the tales that will awaken your senses. Enjoy the flavors that make Kolkata's traditional food a cherished part of its cultural heritage.

Let's check out the five most popular traditional foods in Kolkata, compiled from numerous sources, Monday (10/07/2023).

The Kolkata Kathi Roll is a street food sensation. It has become synonymous with the city's culinary identity. This mouthwatering snack features paratha (flaky flatbread). It is wrapped around juicy pierced kebabs, grilled vegetables, and various sauces. The roll perfectly balances smoky, spicy, and tangy flavors. This makes it an irresistible grab-and-go delight for Kolkatans.

1. Kolkata Kathi Roll

Puchka is known as Pani Puri in other parts of India. It is a beloved street food. Puchka embodies Kolkata's love of tangy and spicy flavors. This delightful snack consists of crispy hollow puris. It is filled with a combination of spiced mashed potatoes, chickpeas, tangy tamarind chutney, and refreshing mint-coriander water. The burst of flavors and textures with each bite is a culinary experience not to be missed.

2. Puchka (Pani Puri)

Kolkata Biryani is a fragrant and flavorful rice dish. It holds a special place in the hearts of Kolkatans. It is inspired by Mughlai cuisine. This biryani features fragrant basmati rice cooked with juicy meat (usually chicken or mutton), aromatic spices, and potatoes. Then the addition of fried onions, saffron, and a dash of rose water. These add depth and richness to this delicious one-pot wonder.

3. Kolkata Biryani

As a city on the Ganges River's banks, Kolkata has a deep love for seafood. Shorshe Ilish is an outstanding Bengali treat. It captures the essence of the region's culinary traditions. This dish features the prized Hilsa fish cooked in a tangy and spicy mustard sauce. That cook, a mixture of spices, and a touch of green chili. The fish's rich flavors and tender texture make it a standout dish for seafood lovers.

4. Shorshe Ilish (Hilsa Fish in Mustard Sauce)

Exploring Kolkata's traditional foods would not be complete without mentioning Rosogolla. It is a cherished Bengali sweet that has gained fame across the globe. Rosogolla is made from fresh cottage cheese (chhana). Then they are soaked in a light sugar syrup. These soft and spongy milk-based sweets are delightful treats for those with a sweet tooth. Rosogollas display Kolkata's love of sweet candies. They are proof of the city's culinary excellence.

5. Rosogolla (Rasgulla)

Traditional Foods from Kolkata

Kolkata's traditional cuisine is a culinary treasure trove. They offer a range of flavors, aromas, and textures that attract. Kolkata's traditional food will satisfy food lovers. It ranges from Kolkata Kathi Roll and Puchka to Kolkata Biryani, Shorshe Ilish, and Rosogolla.

Each dish represents a unique blend of tradition, history, and culinary passion. These five iconic foods capture the essence of Kolkata's cuisine heritage. They prove the city's rich and diverse food culture. Whether you are a visitor or a resident, exploring these treats is an invitation to take a flavorful journey. Experience the true essence of Kolkata's culinary soul.
