Top 6 Emma Myers Movies And TV Shows You Need To Watch

Top 6 Emma Myers Movies And TV Shows You Need To Watch 

Emma Myers is a talented actress who has starred in some amazing movies and TV shows that you definitely need to watch.

From thrilling dramas to heartwarming holiday films, she has showcased her acting skills in a variety of genres. Here's a list of the best Emma Myers movies and TV shows that you should add to your watchlist.

1. Wednesday (2022)

"Wednesday" is a new TV series that was released in 2022. It is a coming-of-age story about Wednesday Addams, the beloved character from "The Addams Family."

The show will follow Wednesday as she attends Nevermore Academy and uncovers a supernatural mystery. With its mix of dark comedy and mystery, "Wednesday" promises to be an exciting and entertaining series for fans of the Addams Family and newcomers alike.

2. Deathless (2020)

"Deathless" is a thrilling short movie about three thieves who visit a farm in search of the only human births since "The Crash," a mysterious event that stops people from dying, growing, or getting pregnant. The film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats with its suspense and intrigue.

3. A Taste of Christmas (2020)

"A Taste of Christmas" is a heartwarming romantic comedy movie. The story follows Natalie, who becomes determined to help her cousin Francesca open her Italian restaurant on Christmas Eve.

This movie is filled with love, laughter, and delicious food, making it a perfect watch for the holiday season.

4. Girl in the Basement (2021)

"Girl in the Basement" is a 2021 movie based on a true story. It follows the life of a teenage girl who is kept captive by her father for years in their basement. The movie deals with the girl's struggles and her eventual escape, highlighting the trauma and emotional impact of her experience.

The Baker and the Beauty is a romantic comedy TV series that premiered in 2020. It tells the story of a Cuban-American baker in Miami who falls in love with a famous celebrity. The show explores their relationship as they navigate through the challenges of their different worlds, families, and careers.

5. The Baker and The Beauty (2020)

6. The Glades (2010 – 2013)

The Glades is a TV series that aired from 2010 to 2013. It follows a detective named Jim Longworth, who moves from Chicago to a small town in Florida. He solves crimes in the fictional town of Palm Glade.

The show combines mystery, humor, and a bit of romance. The Glades has four seasons and a total of 49 episodes.

5 Recommended Live-Action Anime Adaptation You Can Watch on Netflix

Here are 5 live action anime adaptations that you can watch on Netflix.

5 Recommended Live-Action Anime Adaptation You Can Watch on Netflix

Netflix is a streaming service that is accessed by many users due to the breadth of streaming services it provides.

As a streaming service, Netflix often airs many live action adaptations of famous anime.

Here are 5 live action anime adaptations that you can watch on Netflix.

The series is based on the popular Japanese manga and anime series of the same name created by Eiichiro Oda. The story follows the adventures of Monkey D. Luffy, a young boy whose body gains the properties of rubber after unintentionally eating a Devil Fruit. With his diverse crew of pirates, named the Straw Hat Pirates, Luffy explores the Grand Line in search of the world's ultimate treasure known as "One Piece" in order to become the Pirate King. The series premiered on Netflix on August 31, 2023, and consists of 10 episodes covering the East Blue saga from the anime and manga.

One Piece

Rurouni Kenshin - The Beginning tells the story of the titular samurai's early years and the tragic romance that made him turn away from his life of killing. The film was artistically done and brings to mind the samurai movies of old while never losing sight of the original anime—all factors that helped the film earn an impressive 89% on Rotten Tomatoes.

Rurouni Kenshin - The Beginning

The 2018 "Bleach" movie is a live-action adaptation of the popular manga and anime series created by Tite Kubo. It follows the story of Ichigo Kurosaki, a teenager with the ability to see ghosts. After inadvertently obtaining the powers of a Soul Reaper, Ichigo finds himself tasked with defending the living world from malevolent spirits known as Hollows.

Bleach

Just like the anime series that aired in 1998, the Netflix series 'Cowboy Bebop' takes place in 2071 where interplanetary travel is already possible. It focuses on Bebop's crew of Spike Spiegel (John Cho), Jet Black (Mustafa Shakir), and others who work as space bounty hunters.

Cowboy Bebop

Death Note, adapted from the manga and anime of the same name, focuses on the life of a teenager named Light Turner (Nat Wolff) who meets a grim reaper named Ryuk (Willem Dafoe) after picking up a book that can take someone's life called Death Note. In the series, Light will face a detective with the initials L (Lakeith Stanfield).

Death Note

7 Most Iconic Marilyn Monroe Movies You Need To Watch

7 Most Iconic Marilyn Monroe Movies You Need To Watch

Marilyn Monroe was an iconic actress known for her captivating performances and timeless beauty.

Throughout her career, she starred in numerous classic films that continue to enchant audiences today. To celebrate her legacy, here are some of the most iconic Marylyn Monroe movies you should add to your watchlist.

1. The Seven Year Itch (1955)

In this lighthearted romantic comedy, Marilyn Monroe portrays The Girl, an enchanting neighbor who captures the attention of a married man.

With her unforgettable subway grate scene, Monroe delivers an iconic performance that has become synonymous with her name.

"The Seven Year Itch" stands as a timeless classic in Monroe's filmography.

2. Some Like It Hot (1959)

Some Like It Hot (1959)

Considered one of the greatest comedies of all time, "Some Like It Hot" showcases Marilyn Monroe's undeniable talent for comedic timing. In this hilarious film, she plays Sugar Kane Kowalczyk, a ukulele player and singer. This film's witty script and Monroe's magnetic presence make it a must-see for all movie enthusiasts.

3. The Misfits (1961)

The Misfits (1961)

"The Misfits" is a poignant drama that showcases Marilyn Monroe's exceptional acting prowess. Playing the role of Roslyn Taber, Monroe shares the screen with legendary actors Clark Gable and Montgomery Clift. This film presents a captivating exploration of the complexities of human relationships, leaving a lasting impression on its viewers.

4. Gentlemen Prefer Blondes (1953)

In this dazzling musical comedy, Monroe takes on the role of Lorelei Lee, a glamorous showgirl with a love for diamonds.

Alongside her equally high-spirited friend, played by Jane Russell, Monroe delivers captivating musical numbers and showcases her comedic talent. "Gentlemen Prefer Blondes" is a dazzling and entertaining film that will leave you smiling.

5. All About Eve (1950)

Although Marilyn Monroe's role in "All About Eve" is relatively small, her performance as Miss Caswell is memorable.

This classic film is about a young woman named Eve who wants to become a big star like her idol, Margo Channing.

Eve schemes her way into Margo's life and tries to steal her fame, leading to lots of drama and betrayal in the world of theater.

Monroe's presence adds a touch of allure and charm to this critically acclaimed movie.

6. How to Marry a Millionaire (1953)

As one-third of a trio of women on a mission to marry wealthy men, Marilyn Monroe shines as Pola Debevoise.

Full of comedic moments and glamorous fashion, this romantic comedy showcases Monroe's charisma and impeccable comedic timing.

"How to Marry a Millionaire" is a delightful film that will keep you entertained from beginning to end.

7. Niagara (1953)

In this thrilling film noir, Marilyn Monroe portrays Rose Loomis, a seductive and manipulative woman plotting her husband's murder.

Set against the backdrop of Niagara Falls, this suspenseful tale keeps viewers on the edge of their seats.

Monroe's portrayal in "Niagara" demonstrates her range as an actress, leaving a lasting impression.

303 Fun Question of the Day for Work Ideas to Spark Great Conversations

Why Use Questions of the Day at Work?

Asking fun questions at work is a great way to build connections between coworkers and create a more positive office environment. A daily question gives people a chance to share a bit about themselves in a low-pressure way. It can spark interesting conversations, help team members get to know each other better, and add some fun to the workday.

Good questions of the day are simple, engaging, and allow anyone to participate. They shouldn’t be too personal or controversial. The goal is to encourage friendly interaction and help people feel more comfortable with their colleagues.

Here are some benefits of using questions of the day at work:

• Breaks the ice and reduces awkwardness, especially for new employees

• Builds rapport and trust between team members

• Sparks creativity and new ideas

• Provides a fun break from work tasks

• Improves communication and collaboration

• Creates a more positive office culture

• Helps remote teams feel more connected

303 Fun Question of the Day Ideas

Get to Know You Questions

1. What was your first job?

2. Where did you grow up?

3. Do you have any pets?

4. What’s your favorite food?

5. What’s your favorite movie?

6. What’s your favorite book?

7. What’s your favorite TV show?

8. What’s your favorite holiday?

9. What’s your dream vacation destination?

10. What’s your favorite season?

11. Are you a morning person or a night owl?

12. What languages do you speak?

13. What’s your favorite childhood memory?

14. What was your favorite subject in school?

15. What’s your favorite way to relax?

Fun Hypothetical Questions

16. If you could have any superpower, what would it be?

17. If you could travel anywhere in time, where/when would you go?

18. If you could have dinner with anyone, living or dead, who would it be?

19. If you won the lottery, what’s the first thing you would buy?

20. If you could instantly become an expert in one thing, what would it be?

21. If you could only eat one food for the rest of your life, what would it be?

22. If you could switch lives with anyone for a day, who would it be?

23. If you could have any animal as a pet, what would you choose?

24. If you could be any fictional character, who would you be?

25. If you could live in any TV show world, which would you choose?

26. If you could have any job in the world, what would it be?

27. If you could instantly learn any skill, what would you choose?

28. If you could be any age for the rest of your life, what age would you choose?

29. If you could live anywhere in the world, where would you choose?

30. If you could meet any historical figure, who would it be?

This or That Questions

31. Coffee or tea?

32. Dogs or cats?

33. Beach or mountains?

34. Summer or winter?

35. Books or movies?

36. Sweet or salty snacks?

37. Early bird or night owl?

38. City living or country living?

39. Cooking at home or eating out?

40. Phone call or text message?

41. Comedy or drama?

42. Camping or luxury hotel?

43. Roller coasters or water slides?

44. Pancakes or waffles?

45. Sneakers or dress shoes?

Would You Rather Questions

46. Would you rather be able to fly or be invisible?

47. Would you rather be able to read minds or see the future?

48. Would you rather have unlimited money or unlimited free time?

49. Would you rather never have to sleep or never have to eat?

50. Would you rather be the funniest person in the room or the smartest?

51. Would you rather live without music or without TV/movies?

52. Would you rather always be 10 minutes late or 20 minutes early?

53. Would you rather be able to speak all languages or play all instruments?

54. Would you rather have a rewind button or a pause button on your life?

55. Would you rather be famous when you’re alive and forgotten when you die or unknown when you’re alive but famous after you die?

56. Would you rather lose all of your memories or never be able to make new ones?

57. Would you rather be able to talk to animals or speak all foreign languages?

58. Would you rather be the best player on a losing team or the worst player on a winning team?

59. Would you rather live in the ocean or on the moon?

60. Would you rather never be able to use the internet again or never be able to take an airplane again?

Funny Questions

61. What’s the funniest thing that’s happened to you at work?

62. What’s your best “dad joke”?

63. If you were a wrestler, what would your entrance theme song be?

64. What’s the weirdest food you’ve ever eaten?

65. If you were a superhero, what would your costume look like?

66. What’s the strangest dream you’ve ever had?

67. If you could rename yourself, what name would you choose?

68. What’s the silliest thing you believed as a child?

69. If your life was a movie, what would the title be?

70. What’s the worst haircut you’ve ever had?

Tips for Using Questions of the Day Effectively

Here are some tips to make the most of your question of the day:

• Keep it optional – don’t force anyone to answer if they’re not comfortable

• Mix up the types of questions to keep things interesting

• Use questions appropriate for your workplace culture

• Consider themed days (e.g. “Wacky Wednesday” for silly questions)

• Let team members suggest questions too

• Use the answers as conversation starters throughout the day

• For remote teams, use a chat tool or video call for questions

• Keep responses brief to avoid disrupting work

• Have fun with it!

Conclusion

Using a question of the day at work is a simple but effective way to build connections between coworkers and create a more positive office environment. With this list of 303 fun questions, you’ll have plenty of options to keep your team engaged and spark great conversations. Remember to keep things light, fun, and appropriate for your workplace. Happy questioning!

M2M Duo Reunites after 22 Years!

M2M Duo Reunites after 22 Years!

Norwegian duo M2M is reuniting after 22 years. A newly created Instagram account has the latest video of Marit Larsen and Marion Ravn performing an acoustic version of “The Day You Went Away”.

“Let's give this story a better ending,” read the caption of M2M's Instagram upload, seen Tuesday, September 24.

Marit and Marion sang a fragment of the song lyrics indicating the time the video was uploaded, “I remember, date and time / September 22nd Sunday twenty-five after nine.”

The duo, best known for the songs “Don't Say You Love Me” and “Mirror Mirror”, have not explained what they will do with this reunion. However, M2M's return received a warm welcome from netizens.

“Our hearts are so full. THANK YOU. We are so excited for what's to come!”

For information, Marit Larsen and Marion Ravn have been friends since childhood and formed a musical duo when they were eight.

They released a children's album in 1996, when Larsen was 12 and Raven was 11, under Marit & Marion.

Later, the duo changed their name to M2M after signing a recording contract with Atlantic Records in 1998.

M2M achieved success with the album Shades of Purple (2000), which sold 1.5 million copies worldwide. They were also recognized in Asia, being nominated for the Mnet Asian Music Awards in 2001 and the MTV Asia Awards in 2002.

In 2002, Marit Larsen and Marion Ravn chose to continue their solo careers. Since then, M2M is no longer active.

Jisung has nickname Gan Jisung, because he always wants to look cool rather than cute.

Here are 5 Facts about NCT's Jisung, Who Likes to be Called a Cool Guy

NCT Jisung is one of the youngest NCT members compared to the other members. 

Park Jisung was born on February 5, 2002, in Mia-dong, Gangbuk-gu, Seoul.

© trstdly 2023

When Jisung was 14, he debuted as the youngest member of NCT through the NCT Dream unit with the song "Chewing Gum."

His position in NCT Dream is as the main dancer and youngest member. 

He has appeared in films BOYS, BE CURIOUS (2012) and GO, STOP, MURDER (2013).

Despite being the youngest member, he has a strong and deep voice. His voice can charm fans when he sings.

Jisung also doesn't want to be seen as cute. He prefers to be called cool guy.

In an interview on K-POP DAEBAK SHOW, NCT Mark, NCT Renjun, NCT Chenle, and NCT Jisung revealed that Jisung has the nickname Gan Jisung. That's because he always wants to look cool rather than cute.

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
MrBeast YouTuber Who Created 100 Wells in Africa Becomes Controversial

MrBeast YouTuber Who Created 100 Wells in Africa Becomes Controversial

American YouTuber MrBeast's latest video, viewed by more than 64 million viewers on November 8, 2023, in which he claims to have built 100 wells across Africa, has elicited a complex response online since it was uploaded on Saturday, November 4, on his channel.

Some Kenyan activists and journalists say that he has highlighted the failures of the Kenyan government. At the same time, MrBeast, whose real name is Jimmy Donaldson, anticipated that he might get a backlash.

The new wells will provide clean drinking water to up to 500,000 people in Cameroon, Kenya, Somalia, Uganda, and Zimbabwe, Donaldson said, while a companion fundraiser to support local water relief organizations had raised more than $300,000 by Monday, November 6, 2023.

Donaldson's 10-minute video also shows him donating equipment to Kenyan schools, such as new furniture, soccer balls, computers, whiteboards, and projectors.

He also built a bridge across a river to connect a village with a local school and hospital and donated bicycles to a town in Zimbabwe to help children get to school.

Renowned activist Boniface Mwangi compared Donaldson's actions to those of the Kenyan government, saying, "we are a shameful country... a begging country, ruled by millionaires."

He added on X (which used to be Twitter): "Every five years we give newly elected MPs, and senators car grants worth Sh5 million ($33,000), refuel those cars every month, but we don't have money to drill boreholes for our people?"

Freelance journalist Ferdinand Omondi praised Donaldson's efforts but said it was "shameful that a YouTuber is flying to Kenya on a charity tour, doing a job that our taxes should have done years ago."

Kaba Jones, founder and CEO of FACE Africa, an organization that works to improve water and sanitation infrastructure in sub-Saharan Africa, told CNN: "I've been doing it for 15 years, but we've struggled to continue this work because funding, awareness and advocacy all take work."

She added, "all of a sudden, this person comes along, who happens to be a white male figure with a big platform, and suddenly, he's getting all the attention. It's kind of frustrating, but it's also understanding the nature of how the world is."

She praised Donaldson for highlighting the need for a clean water supply but warned that "the issue is sustainability. It's one thing to install a well, it's another thing for us to go back three, four, or five years from now, and see if that well is still working."

Kaba Jones told CNN that FACE Africa works in an area where "60% of wells are broken, and people are back to drinking from the river because there is no infrastructure built for follow-up repair maintenance," he hopes Donaldson's well construction efforts include this infrastructure.

While most of the response to Donaldson's video seems to be focused on how he slams the Kenyan government, the creator anticipated the backlash, saying on X, "I knew I would get backlash for uploading a video helping others, and obviously, I didn't care."

Ambitious Kenyan politician Francis Gaitho criticized Donaldson's video, saying on X that it reinforced the stereotype that Africa is "dependent on donations and philanthropic intervention," although his comments were criticized.

Donaldson is the most popular individual creator on YouTube, with over 200 million subscribers. He is known for his philanthropy, uploading videos in which he sponsors cataract surgeries for 1,000 blind people and purchases prostheses for 2,000 amputees.

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: From lovebirds to swans, these animals has been seen as a symbol of love by many people around the world.
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_keywords: animals that are symbol of love,symbol of love,romantic animals
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
8 Animals That Become the Symbol of Love

Love is a powerful feeling that brings people together. Around the world, people use different symbols to express love, and animals often play a big role in this. Some animals represent loyalty, while others symbolize passion, harmony, or lifelong partnerships. These creatures remind us of the beauty and strength of love in nature and our own lives.

In this article, we will talk about animals that are seen as symbols of love. Each one has a special story or meaning that connects it to this wonderful feeling. Let’s explore these animals and what makes them so special.

1. Swans

Swans are a famous symbol of love and romance. They are often seen swimming in pairs, forming a heart shape with their necks. Swans stay with the same partner for life, which makes them a symbol of loyalty and eternal love. Their graceful courtship rituals, which include synchronized swimming and head bobbing, are often seen as a beautiful representation of love’s elegance.

2. White Doves

White doves are often linked to peace and love. In many cultures, they symbolize harmony and affection. According to Greco-Roman mythology, doves were sacred to Venus, the goddess of love. They are also frequently released at weddings to represent the couple’s commitment and a hopeful future. This deep connection with love makes Dove a timeless symbol of purity and devotion.

3. Dolphins

Dolphins are playful and friendly animals that symbolize joy and connection. In Greek mythology, dolphins are associated with Aphrodite, the goddess of love, as they are often depicted accompanying her. Dolphins show empathy and compassion, not just toward each other but even toward other species. These qualities make dolphins a powerful symbol of love and friendship, reminding us to cherish bonds built on care and understanding.

4. Gibbons

Gibbons are small apes that are famous for their lifelong partnerships. They live in monogamous pairs and strengthen their bond by singing duets together. Each pair’s song is unique and reflects their strong emotional connection. Gibbons are a beautiful example of trust, loyalty, and dedication in love, making them an inspiring symbol of long-lasting relationships.

5. Lovebirds

Lovebirds are small parrots that are always seen together. They sit close to each other and groom one another as a sign of affection. These colorful birds symbolize eternal love and devotion. Their name itself reflects their deep connection, and they remind us that love is about being close and showing care for one another.

6. Ladybugs

Ladybugs are a symbol of good luck and love. In many cultures, it is believed that catching a ladybug and setting it free can bring blessings in love. According to folklore, ladybugs may even whisper your name to your soulmate. Their bright red color and charming appearance make them a delightful symbol of passion, joy, and happiness in love.

7. Beavers

Beavers might not seem romantic at first, but they are a great symbol of teamwork and dedication in love. These monogamous creatures work together to build dams and care for their young, showing the importance of cooperation in relationships. Beavers remind us that love is not just about emotions but also about shared responsibilities and partnership.

8. Horses

Horses represent freedom, passion, and abundance. In Chinese mythology, the horse is associated with love and fertility, while in Celtic traditions, it is linked to the goddess Epona, who symbolizes fertility and protection. Their strength and grace make horses a powerful symbol of a wild, untamed love that is full of energy and excitement.

45 Hustle Quotes for Understanding the Mindset of Success

45 Hustle Quotes for Understanding the Mindset of Success

Have you ever heard someone say, "Work hard, play hard?" or "Keep hustling?" Those are hustle quotes! But what does "hustle" really mean? Hustle means working hard and putting in effort to reach your goals. It's about being determined and not giving up, even when things get tough.

And hustle quotes? Well, they are bits of motivation that remind us to keep doing our best to achieve success. In this article, we'll share some great hustle quotes that will help you to learn the mindset behind the success.

Motivational Hustle Quotes

  • "Things may come to those who wait, but only the things left by those who hustle." – Abraham Lincoln

  • "The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing." – Walt Disney

  • "I never dreamed of success, I worked for it." – Estee Lauder

  • "I love the work, love the grind. I love what I have to go through to get what I want." – Deshaun Watson

  • "Worked so hard, forgot how to vacation. They ain't never had the dedication." – Post Malone

  • "If you can't outplay them, outwork them." – Ben Hoga
  • "Some people dream of success while others wake up and work hard at it." – Napoleon Hill

  • "One day I am going to make it, until then I'll just keep hustling." – Grant Cardone

  • "Success in anything will always come down to this: Focus and effort, and we control both of them." – Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson

  • "Success in anything will always come down to this: Focus and effort, and we control both of them." – Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson

  • "Greatness only comes before GRIND in the dictionary." – Hustle and Grind Quote

  • "Ideas don't work for people unwilling to do the work." – Robin Sharma

  • "If you're not willing to risk the usual, you'll have to settle for the ordinary." – Jim Rohn

  • "The heights by great men reached and kept were not attained by sudden flight, but they, while their companions slept were toiling upward in the night." – Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

  • "Where I excel, is ridiculous, sickening, work-ethic!" – Will Smith

  • "There is no substitute for hard work." – Thomas Edison

  • "I am grinding while your sleeping." – Gary Vaynerchuk

  • "It is only through labor and painful effort, by grim energy and resolute courage, that we move on to better things." – Theodore Roosevelt

  • "Men of action are favored by the goddess of good luck." – George S. Clason

  • "It's not about money or connections. It's the willingness to outwork and outlearn everyone when it comes to your business." – Mark Cuban

  • "Hustle, the most important word – ever." – Gary Vaynerchuck

  • "Talent without working hard is nothing." – Cristiano Ronaldo

  • "There is no shortage of money in this world. Start hustling." – Grant Cardone

  • "Without hustle, talent will only carry you so far." – Gary Vaynerchuk

  • "You always want to out work your potential." – Kobe Bryant

  • "Hustle in silence and let your success make the noise." – Unknown

  • "Be not afraid of going slowly. Be afraid only of standing still." – Chinese proverb

  • "Talk less, hustle more." – Atlas Rowe

  • "You can't have a million-dollar dream with a minimum-wage work ethic." – Stephen C. Hogan

  • "Hustle until you no longer need to introduce yourself." – Unknown
  • "Work your ass off, there is no magic pill." – Arnold Schwarzenegger

  • "Some people want it to happen, some people wish it would happen, others make it happen." – Michael Jordan

  • "Give your dreams all you've got, and you'll be amazed at the energy that comes out of you." – William James

  • "Success isn't owned. It's leased, and rent is due every day." – J. J. Watt

  • "Work is a sure-fire money making scheme." – Dave Ramsey

  • "Some succeed because they are destined to, but most succeed because they are determined to." – Henry Van Dyke

  • “Strategy is a commodity, execution is an art." – Peter F. Drucker

  • "Hustle until your haters ask if you are hiring." - Unknown

  • "Formula for success: rise early, work hard, strike oil." – J. Paul Getty

  • "Wake up. Pray. Hustle." – Unknown

  • "Action is the foundational key to all success." – Pablo Picasso

Gordon Ramsay Named the World's Most Successful Celebrity Chef

Gordon Ramsay Named the World's Most Successful Celebrity Chef

Of the hundreds of popular names, it turns out that Gordon Ramsay is ranked 1st as the most successful celebrity chef in the world.

There are so many celebrity chefs in the world.

Gordon Ramsay is a British celebrity chef whose name is very well known. Ramsay exists on social media to star in various popular cooking shows, including Hell's Kitchen.

Ramsay's achievements in the culinary world have been proven again. The Slingo website rating named the 56-year-old chef the most successful celebrity chef in the world.

The assessment is based on several things, such as the number of social media followers, estimated income from Instagram and engagement rate, to the number of Michelin stars obtained from managed restaurants.

Judging from TikTok's category of the most successful celebrity chefs, Ramsay also ranks first with 37.7 million followers. In second place was followed by Amaury Guichon (21.4 million followers), and the third position was occupied by Martha Stewart (1.6 million followers).

The Slingo version of Ramsay has won the title of the most successful celebrity chef in the world. This is not the first time because he also occupied last year's top position.

Its position holds despite an additional 80 chefs in the latest assessment. Since last year, Ramsay has added 600 thousand Instagram followers and owns seven fewer restaurants.

-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_keywords: Apple FINALLY Suggests People Not Using Rice to Dry Their Wet Phone!
-- Batch 7\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
Apple FINALLY Suggests People Not Using Rice to Dry Their Wet Phone!

Apple FINALLY Suggests People Not Using Rice to Dry Their Wet Phone!

If your phone gets wet, people (or the internet) often suggest putting it in a bag of uncooked rice to dry it out. 

However, Apple officially advises against this, as rice particles could harm the iPhone! 

Instead, Apple recommends tapping the phone with the connector pointing down, letting it dry in a place with good airflow for at least 30 minutes before trying to charge it. 

If the liquid alert continues, wait up to 24 hours before attempting to charge again. 

Despite the common belief in rice's effectiveness, it's the time the phone spends drying that helps, not the rice itself.

Uncooked rice is apparently not very good at absorbing moisture.

30 Laughter Quotes to Spread Joy in Your Life

These quotes remind us of the beauty and power of laughter. They help to uplift our spirits and boost our mood.

30 Laughter Quotes to Spread Joy in Your Life

Laughter has a magical way to brighten the darkest days. So, I must remind you that laughter quotes are here to remind you of their importance.

In this article, we have gathered 30 laughter quotes to spread joy in your life.

These quotes remind us of the beauty and power of laughter. They help to uplift our spirits and boost our mood. Join us on a journey through the laughter quotes below.

So, sit back, relax, and let these words of wisdom fill your heart with happiness.

A. Insightful Laughter Quotes

"Laughter is timeless, imagination has no age, and dreams are forever." - Walt Disney

  • “We are here to laugh at the odds and live our lives so well that Death will tremble to take us.” — Charles Bukowski
  • "Laughter is the sunshine that warms our hearts, the rainbow that brightens our skies, and the breeze that whispers in our ears. It is the sweet serenade that fills our days with joy and our nights with peace, reminding us that life is a gift to be cherished and shared." - Unknown

  • "In life, laughter is the golden thread that binds us together, weaving a tapestry of joy and happiness that spans the ages. It is the sweet melody that lingers in our memories, the gentle reminder that no matter where life may lead us, there is always a reason to smile." - Anonymous
  • "Like a gentle breeze on a summer's day, laughter sweeps through our lives, refreshing our spirits and rejuvenating our souls. It is the elixir of life, the secret ingredient that turns moments into memories and transforms ordinary days into extraordinary adventures." - Unknown
  • "Laughter is the language of the heart." - Pablo Neruda

  • "Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face." - Victor Hugo

  • "The human race has only one really effective weapon and that is laughter." - Mark Twain
  • "Laughter is an instant vacation." - Milton Berle
  • "Laughter is the best medicine. But if you laugh for no reason, you need medicine." - Unknown
  • "In the garden of life, laughter blooms like a radiant flower, spreading its petals of joy and filling the air with its sweet fragrance. Let us cultivate laughter in our hearts, nurturing it with kindness, watering it with love, and watching it blossom into a garden of happiness." - Anonymous
  • "Laughter connects you with people. It’s almost impossible to maintain any kind of distance or any sense of social hierarchy when you’re just howling with laughter.
  • “Laughter is a force for democracy." - John Cleese

  • "Laughter is the fireworks of the soul." - Josh Billing

  • "Laughter gives us distance. It allows us to step back from an event, deal with it, and then move on." - Bob Newhart
  • “Laughing is good exercise. It’s like jogging on the inside.” — Kurt Vonnegut

B. Laughter Quotes to Inspire You

  • “Life is a play that does not allow testing. So, sing, cry, dance, laugh and live intensely, before the curtain closes and the piece ends with no applause.” — Charlie Chaplin
  • “Ten years from now you’ll laugh at whatever’s stressing you out today. So why not laugh now?” — Tony Robbins
  • "Laughter is the sensation of feeling good all over and showing it principally in one place." - Josh Billings

“Learn to laugh at your problems, cause everybody else does.” — Jared Leto

  • "Laughter is, after speech, the chief thing that holds society together." - Max Eastman
  • "Laughter is the brush that sweeps away the cobwebs of your heart." - Mort Walker
  • "Laughter is the tonic, the relief, the surcease for pain." - Charlie Chaplin
  • "A day without laughter is a day wasted." - Charlie Chaplin

  • "Laughter is a form of internal jogging. It moves your internal organs around. It enhances respiration. It is an igniter of great expectations." - Norman Cousins

  • “Surround yourself with people who make you happy. People who make you laugh, who help you when you’re in need. People who genuinely care. They are the ones worth keeping in your life. Everyone else is just passing through.” — Karl Marx
  • "Amidst the hard of life, laughter is the sweet symphony that soothes our souls and uplifts our spirits. It is the gentle reminder that no matter how heavy our burdens may be, there is always a reason to smile, a moment to cherish, and a friend to share our joys with." - Anonymous
  • "Laughter is the shortest distance between two people." - Victor Borge
  • "Laughter is the closest distance to the heart." - Victor Borge
  • “Life laughs at you when you are unhappy; Life smiles at you when you are happy; But, life salutes you when you make others happy.” — Charlie Chaplin
  • "Like a river flowing gently through the valley, laughter meanders through our lives, nourishing our souls and refreshing our spirits. It is the song that sings in our hearts, the dance that sways in our steps, and the laughter that fills our days with joy." - Anonymous
